loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe S. de 41 años de edad, reside en la colonia Guadalupe, ubicado en la ciudad de Soyapango, en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus tres hijos de 16, 14 y 11 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar gracias al enorme esfuerzo de su madre. Morena posee un negocio en el cual comercializa desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo diferentes bebidas y golosinas, su puesto está ubicado frente a la empresa Salud, en donde elaboran productos lácteos, esto beneficia mucho a Morena ya que la mayoría de empleados del lugar acuden a su puesto a comprar comida, así mismo no posee mucha competencia, ya que solo hay dos negocios más de venta de comida. Morena solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el deseo de poder contar con el dinero necesario para invertir aún más en el negocio, comprando materia prima para la elaboración de alimentos y comprando más bebidas y golosinas, lo cual le permita contar con más clientela y percibir mayores ganancias, lo que le brinde la ayuda necesaria para darles todo lo necesario a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe S., age 41, lives in the community of Guadalupe, located in the city of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her three children, ages 16, 14, and 11, who are able to be in school thanks to their mother’s enormous effort.

Morena has a business selling breakfasts and lunches, as well as different types of drinks and sweets. Her stall is located opposite a business called Salud where they manufacture dairy products. This location is of great benefit to Morena since most of the employees come to her stall to buy meals. She doesn’t have much competition since there are only two other places selling food.

Morena is applying for a loan from Integral with a view to being able to have the money necessary to invest even more in her business. This will permit her to serve more customers and have greater profits, which will provide her with what she needs in order to give all that is necessary to her three children.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making meals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Mun

texts.en:
Mrs. Mun U. (pictured above) is a 58 year old widow with three sons. Two of them married and live outside the family home and the other one sells coffee at home. She lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Mun has been renting the space of her house for four years. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to build a fence around her house and make a concrete foundation.

loans.use: build a fence around her house and make a concrete foundation

loans.name: Mrs. Seang Chey Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a village bank loan in Ba Srae village in Takeo province consisting of eight people. All the members will use their share of the loan for different purposes to improve the living conditions of their families.

The members selected Mrs. Seang C. as the village bank president. She is 54 years-old. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Soeurng Morm, is a palm juice collector who earns some money from selling palm sugar to support his family. Although they work hard they earn insufficient income. So to improve the family living conditions, Mrs. Seang C. is applying for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. They will also use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to do farming. From this activity, they support four children, one of whom is a teacher in the local village and the others are studying in local public school.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Norboy

texts.en:
R. Norboy has been in the farming business for eight years. It is through farming that he is able to provide for the needs of his family, including his wife and son and also his parents. Norboy would like to request a loan of 7,000 Somoni, which he can use to buy necessary farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers, since they are very expensive. He is very optimistic that this amount will improve his yield and he hopes to have a continuous partnership with the lenders. Norboy always makes sure that he respects the people around him since he believes that respect begets respect.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Aldrin Wilber

texts.es: Wilber, tiene 38 años vive en casa de sus padres, inicio su negocio aproximadamente hace diez años vendiendo su mercaderia en el mercado, para luego establecer su negocio en un puesto alquilado que le permite tener mayores ganancias ya tiene gran acogida por sus clientes por la atencion que les brinda, solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia y poder ampliar su negocio para llegar a tener una distribuidora de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Wilber is 38 years of age. He lives in the home of his parents. He started his business approximately ten years ago, selling merchandise in the market. then later established his business in a rented position that permits him to have greater profits. He already has a great reception by his clients because of the service that he offers them. He requests the loan for the purchase of merchandise and to be able to expand his business to become a distributor of Natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and expand his business to include natural products

loans.name: Pau

texts.en:
Pau F. is 52 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Pau has many years of experience in this business.  Pau needs a loan of WST$2000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 800 talas or US $333 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Pau joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Pau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is divorced and has seven dependents. She has received junior high education.

Ama fries fresh fish for sale at Elmina which she has been doing for twenty years. She distributes her fried fish to kenkey sellers in her locality and uses her income in taking care of her children. Kenkey is fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves and often served with fish.

Ama will add the loan she hopes to get, to her original capital to purchase more fresh fish to fry. She plans on reinvesting in her business the profit she anticipates getting.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat J. is a resident of Lahore, which is famous for its gardens and greenery. She is 29 years old and is the mother of two daughters who are of 2 years and 1 year old respectively. She lives in a three-room brick house with her husband and family that they moved into three years ago.

Riffat is a seamstress and does sewing work for her neighborhood customers. She is very good at her art and has a good reputation among her customers for her good work.

Riffat’s husband has a business selling ready-made garments. He operates a shop in the market and sells clothes for gents and children. His business is going very well but he needs further improvement to it because new designs are introduced rapidly in the fashion industry and to keep his shop up-to-date he needs to offer new garment collections, otherwise the other clothes sellers will take the advantage of this which would effect his sales.

Therefore, Riffat has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband improve his business. With the loan, he will buy more stock of ready-made garments to sell to his clients. Riffat is very hopeful that her husband will make positive use of the loan and successfully upgrade his business and increase his income.

This is Riffat’s second loan and she has been found to be a responsible loan user of Asasah. She never misses any meetings and has paid her installments on time.

loans.use: To purchase ready-made garments for her husband's business

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
This is Marisa Sto. D., 30, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Nepumoceno Sto. D., a driver. She is also the mother of two children: one in high school and one in elementary school. By the grace of God, Marisa has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send both of her children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Marisa, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can give to their children.

Marisa operates a variety store; she also oversees operations of their tricycle and maintains their piggery. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail prices by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages in order to expand her product inventory. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Marisa dreams to be able to give all her children a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase products for variety store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena A. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 46 years old and is married with five school-aged children. Elena owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Elena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresa Mercedes

texts.es: La señora tiene un año de estar laborando en la Alcaldía Municipal de Catarina desempeñando el cargo de Responsable del Centro Turístico Mirador, en donde con su salario mantiene a sus dos hijos que están en edad escolar y que a punto de sacrificio los ha sacado adelante, ahora ella le solicita a CEPRODEL un financiamiento para pagar unos gastos personales que tiene y así seguir desarrollando el crecimiento y mejoramiento del nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The lady has been working for the past year for the City of Catarina as the Attendant at the Mirador Tourist Center.  She uses her salary to support her two school age children.  She has managed to move them ahead in life through much sacrifice.

She is asking CEPRODEL for a loan to pay some personal expenses she has so that she can continue developing and improving her family’s living standard.

loans.use: For some personal expenses.

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es: Peregrina tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niña aprendió las técnicas agrícolas, ahora su labor se ha intensificado más en la ganadería, en donde compra y vende animal ovino, el cual cría en su casa; asimismo compra cuyes, así los reproduce y los vende, siendo éste negocio muy rentable. De esta manera puede esperar el tiempo de cosecha de maíz para que logre generarse ingresos, ya que este proceso requiere de tiempo, además que es muy trabajoso, por lo que siempre cuenta con la ayuda de su familia, tanto para la siembra como para la cosecha. Sin embargo ha habido temporada de mucha perdida debido al clima y otros factores, llegando a perder lo invertido, pero para ella no le es suficiente para renunciar, pues es su forma de vida del cual vive de ella. Por ahora su mayor anhelo es mejorar la cosecha de maíz, así como aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene. Es el crédito número 15 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece  a las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar alfalfa, así como comprar materiales de construcción para ampliar su granja de cuyes.
texts.en:
Peregrina is 50 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a house they own. Peregrina learned how to farm as a young child but her work now involves mostly small livestock. She raises sheep and guinea pigs, which she finds to be a profitable business. It provides her with income in the time before she can harvest her maize crop. Growing maize requires time and a lot of work from Peregrina and her family. Also, some seasons are affected by bad weather and other factors that can result in the loss of all her investments of time and money. Nevertheless, these challenges don't discourage Peregrina because farming is her way of life. 

For now, Peregrina's greatest hope is to improve her maize harvest and expand her livestock business. This is her 15th loan from MFP and she is very happy to have this financial resource. She is also grateful to be part of her community bank because all the members are responsible, supportive people. Likewise, she is grateful to the people who will fund this loan she is requesting. The loan will be very useful in developing her business. Peregrina will use the loan to purchase fertilizer for growing alfalfa, and construction materials to expand her guinea pig farm.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and materials to expand guinea pig farm.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora forma parte del banco comunal “El Eclipse Valdiviano”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Valdivia. Ella tiene un almacén en su casa, donde vende variados productos, como abarrotes, lácteos, confites y recargas de celular entre otras cosas. Con este préstamo comprará mercadería para su negocio. Tiene 2 hijas, de 16 y  14 años, para quienes Aurora es el único sustento económico. 
Tiene su almacén hace 23 años, pero desde el 30 de septiembre del pasado año 2009, cuando se quemó su casa y el negocio que tenía en la misma, perdió  todo lo que tenía. Luego de esa tragedia comenzó a arrendar y siguió con su almacén, aunque este es más pequeño que el que perdió en el incendio. 
El sueño de Aurora es tener una casa propia nuevamente y seguir creciendo en su negocio. Para ahorrar y cumplir su sueño tiene a la venta el terreno de la casa que se le quemó. 
Para Aurora Fondo Esperanza significa un gran apoyo económico y  le han servido las enseñanzas que recibe durante las reuniones, de grupo con la asesora, sobre la administración de negocios. También le ha servido compartir con sus compañeros, ya que hablan de las experiencias de sus negocios y ha podido tener nuevas ideas. 
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables de Chile. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de metalurgia, la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa, cervecera y molinera.
texts.en:
Aurora is part of the "El Eclipse Validiviano" communal bank, located in the city of Valdivia.  She has a small store in her house where she sells a variety of products, such as groceries, dairy products, sweets, and cell phone minutes, among other things.  She will buy merchandise for her store with this loan.  

She has two daughters, ages 16 and 14 years old, and Aurora is their only economic support.  She has had her store for 23 years, but on September 30, 2009, her house burned, along with the store inside.  She lost everything she had.  Since this tragedy, she started renting and restarted her store, although now it is much smaller than the one she lost in the fire.  Aurora's dream is to have her own house again and to continue rebuilding her business.  In order to save money and reach her dream, she has put the land where her house burned up for sale.

Fondo Esperanza has been a great economic support to Aurora.  She has also found the sessions during their meetings, when the advisor talks about business administration, to be useful.  It has also been helpful to share with her fellow group members, who talk about their experiences with their businesses and have come up with new ideas.

Valdivia is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Ríos ["The Rivers"] region. It is known for having one of the few navigable rivers in the country. Valdivia's principal economic activities are metallurgy; naval construction; wood, paper, and pulp production; brewing; and milling.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ines Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas de Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento Puno, tiene 23 años de edad,  tiene un hijo. Tiene grado de instrucción secundaria completa.
Verónica, está trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo recibido, que fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, lo utilizó para  incrementar la mercadería de su negocio, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales, estos productos son comprados desde Ilave y Desaguadero para poder  llevarlos  a Tacna. 
La señora  solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar la mercadería  de su negocio.
Su sueño es  progresar en su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir la alegría entre sus compañeras (socias).
texts.en:
Verónica is a member of the communal bank “Brisas de Rio Blanco”, located in the district of  ubicado en el distrito of Pilcuyo, El Collao province, departament of Puno. She is 23 years old and has a son. She finished high school.  

Verónica has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. The first loan she received was for S/ 300.00 nuevo soles. She used it to increase her business' merchandise. She buys and sells cereals. She buys these products from Llave and Desaguadero to be able to take them to Tacna. 

She will ask for a new loan for S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles. This loan will allow her to increase her business' merchandise. Her dream is to progress in her business. What she likes about the communal bank is the cheerfulness with the other members.

loans.use: To buy cereals wholesale

loans.name: Sotkinay

texts.en:
Sotkinay K. is a 51-year-old widow who has two daughters who are the main helpers in family business. In 1995, to support her family, she started her business in selling nuts and dried fruits. With the initial capital of 10,000 Kyrgyz Soms (~$200), she bought two parcels of goods and resold them at the local market. 

Her deceased husband helped her in all her activities, but after his sudden death, she didn’t give way to despair. She put all her efforts into giving her children all they needed. Sotkinay worked hard and managed to obtain a small shop that earned her a monthly income of 5,000 Kyrgyz Soms. Her tireless persistence led her to borrow two loans from Bai Tushum and Partners, which were repaid without any delays.
  
Now Sotkinay is applying for a loan of 70,000 Kyrgyz Soms to enlarge her assortment of goods. With the revenues, she plans to expand the family business by opening a second shop for her daughter. 

About Bai-Tushum
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga G. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. She is 46 years old. Dominga is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Dominga owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dominga has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Dominga joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dominga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Dominga is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Dominga from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita O., 35 years old, is from the town of Maribojoc. She is married and has four children, aged 13, 11, 9 and 2. Marita's business is making detergent soap and dishwashing liquid. She first sold her products to friends and now sells to more people in her community. Marita works hard to build her business. She hopes to have more customers.

Marita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase materials and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase materials and other supplies

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen owns a Colmado.  This is a shop where she sells such commodities as colored candles, bread, chips, sweets, cherries, gum, spices, matches, and chocolate cake by the slice, and other goods like rice, beans, oil, sugar flour, etc. A friend told her about microfinance, and how she could get a loan to invest in her business.  Carmen got her first loan to buy more goods and improve her inventory. Now, after 7 years as an Esperanza client, she is receiving her 9th loan. She is married and has five older children.

This Esperanza associate is an example of the dedication and effort that is possible to progress and improve oneself, her family and others. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).  The rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, is an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is 32 years old and married with three children.  She runs a hardware shop to earn her living.  She has been running the business for ten years with one employee.  She joined Faulu Kenya six years ago.  She has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has been able to send her children to school.  Currently, she is sending one of her children to high school.  She hopes to have a big business in the future. She has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 Kes to add to her stock of pipes, iron sheet, block board and plywood.

loans.use: To add to her stock of pipes, iron sheet, block board and plywood

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina E. is 27 years old and lives in the town of Banga. She is married, has four young children and makes a living by planting and harvesting rice. Her main goal is to save for her children's future, so she can provide them with a good education.

Dina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She successfully repaid her first loan and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy fertilizer and other supplies. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay for her children's tuition. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Mazher

texts.en:
Mazher is a 43-year-old single man from Metn. He has worked as a butcher for 11 years. Mazher is  requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to improve his business. He needs to buy new improved machines in addition to lower priced meat through paying cash. 

Mazher is well known in his region. His clients especially appreciate his cleanliness and high quality products.  Mazher has been an Al Majmoua borrower for seven consecutive years. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his business. He used to pay to rent on his shop but because his business improved he was able to buy his shop which is a good improvement. He's very proud of himself. Mazher is a  borrower in good standing.

loans.use: To buy new improved machines necessary to his business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. lives in the Mengo Mackay neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. Joyce has a restaurant. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Joyce sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. She also generates additional income through farming.

Joyce has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes and beef. The main business challenges for Joyce include thieves, transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to own a fully stocked restaurant. Joyce lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes and beef

loans.name: Myanzi Tukolerewamu Women's Development Group

texts.en:
31-year-old Halima B. has been selling produce for the last twelve years in the Mityana trading center and food market. The happily married mother of four says her business has been growing by leaps and bounds principally due to her hard work, tenacity and organization.

Halima sells mostly coffee, bananas and beans, and the fact that she owns a farm has really come in handy. She says she is able to sell mostly crops she has harvested from her own garden. In this way she has cut down on her expenditures and increased her profits. She says she is able to make weekly profits to the tune of 50,000 KES.

Halima belongs to Myanzi Tukolerewamu Women's Group, Mityana. With this loan, she is going to buy high-grade manure to improve her farming.

loans.use: To purchase high-grade manure

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member (her father). Halima has a beauty salon.  She has been in this business for four years and she works 7 days out of every week.  Halima sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  Halima has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. The main business challenge(s) for Halima include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon and also to own a fully stocked salon.   Halima lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Lakrima

texts.en:
Lakrima is a 45-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. She is married, and a mother of four children. Lakrima has a souvenir and gifts shop. She has been working in retail for three years. Her customers include community members from her region. Lakrima says that she is passionate about her work and that she can not imagine life without it. 

She believes that her business draws a smile to the face of everyone who gets a gift; she also sells stationery and some useful household items. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. This will be her third loan from Al Majmoua. She is planning to increase her store's inventory with the loan. She says that, without the loan, she would not be able to provide the same level of support for her family. In the future, Lakrima is hoping to further expand and develop her business.

loans.use: To increase her gift inventory.

loans.name: Saloon

texts.en: Saloon, age 29, is married and resides with her husband and children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Saloon sells fish, earning an income of $6 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who a construction worker, earning an income of $5 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Saloon and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of $900 to purchase a motorbike to transport fish to resell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Pura

texts.en:
Pura is 51 years old and married with two children. She lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. For the past five years, Pura has sold banana-que (deep-fried bananas with caramelized sugar) to earn a living.

Pura has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She is requesting a loan to purchase the raw ingredients to cook and sell banana-que. In the future, Pura hopes to achieve her goal of developing her micro-enterprise to increase her income so her family can lead a better life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make banana-que

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana, vende comida rápida como pupusas, tamales, pasteles y sodas, vive con su familia y tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 8, 6 y 2 años de edad, ella inicio el negocio hace diez años trabajando de lunes a domingo, este negocio es su fuente principal de ingresos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos para elaborar la venta como maíz, tomates, frijoles, hojas de banano, pollo y bebidas, que son parte de los productos para las pupusas, tamales y pasteles, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar el negocio.
Su aspiración es que sus hijos continúen estudiando, que a través del negocio pueda cubrir todos los gastos y necesidades de ellos.
texts.en:
Ana sells fast food such as pupusas, tamales, pastries, and sodas.  She lives with her family and has 4 children ages 12, 8, 6, and 2.  She started her business 10 years ago working Monday-Sunday.  This business is where she earns her main income. 

She is requesting a loan to buy products to expand sales such as corn, tomatoes, beans, banana leaves, chicken, and beverages which are the ingredients necessary to make pupusas, tomales, and pastries.  This loan will help her improve her business.

Her dream is for her children to continue studying and for this business to cover all of their expenses and needs.

loans.use: to buy materials to sell: corn, tomatoes, beans, banana leaves, chicken, and beverages.

loans.name: Junbert

texts.en: Junbert is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for 3 years. Junbert is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has no children. Junbert has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. He has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La Sra. Olga, es una cliente nueva, que vino a la institución por invitación D. un cliente bueno, que trabaja actualmente en nuestra agencia.  En el momento D. la evaluación del crédito la Sra. demostró una actitud buena, Cortez y amable,  La Sra. Olga vive en la zona tacagua la Paz Bolivia, ella en la actualidad vive con sus dos hijos, el esposo por razones D. trabajo se encuentra en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz, saco este crédito para surtir su mercadería y además para su capital, su puesto esta ubicado en una  calle concurrida D. la ciudad, ella tiene su patente al día, venD. desD. horas  8,00 a 21,00, con el tiempo piensa mejorar la infraestructura D. su casa para el beneficio D. su familia.
texts.en:
Olga is a new client that came to the institution invited by a good client who currently works with our agency.  When her evaluation took place she had a good, cordial and kind attituD..  

Olga lives in La Paz, Bolivia’s Tacagua zone.  She currently lives with her two children.  Her husband, due to employment, is in the city of Santa Cruz.

She took out this loan to stock merchandise and also to use as working capital.  Her stand is located on a busy city street.  Her permit is up to date.  She sells from 8am until 9pm.  

In time she hopes to improve her house’s infrastructure for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Antony Kamau

texts.en:
Antony is forty-two years old, married to a business-lady and they have five children aged between eighteen years old and five years old whom they wish to give a good education to the university level.

Antony runs a butcher shop which is located at a busy market known as Malinya in Kakamega. He has been running this business for the last four years and has managed to give employment to one person.

He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He is using his loan of Kes 60,000 to buy bulls to sell as meat.

He hopes to grow his business and open other butcheries in Kakamega town. He hopes that in future he will purchase a plot of land on which he will put up rental houses. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy bulls to sell as beef.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 56 years old and married with five children. For the past 15 years, she has run a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and she also earns an income buying and selling rice. Nenita works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid 11 previous loans from NWTF.

Nenita is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of products such as shampoo, groceries, and other items for her sari-sari store. Nenita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Agagul

texts.en:
Agagul is 41, married, and sells groceries from his food store. His vending location is well known for good prices that are lower than market prices. Agagul knows his customers' preferences and always offers them only good quality groceries. He has been in the grocery trade for more than 10 years. His business has been marked with consistent stability. He also has a shop where he sells mobile phones and accessories. His total income from both businesses is about 400 USD. Agagul has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history. 

With the first loan, Agagul was able to open this grocery store. He is hoping to invest a loan of 1500 AZN in additional merchandise, which will help him increase his turnover capital eventually. Agagul has a vision for the expansion of his trade, and we believe it will be helpful in his entrepreneurial endeavors.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Cintia Marilin

texts.es:
Cintia de 26 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijo, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Cintia desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cerdos, ovejas y aves), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Cintia es una mujer que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Cintia is 26 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and child, where they have only electricity (no running water).  Their home is located in the rural area of the Tambogrande district which is part of the Piura department.  This area focuses on agriculture, livestock and handicrafts.

For the last several years, Cintia has been working raising and selling farmyard animals (pigs, sheep and poultry).  Her farmyard is located in the rear of her home, and is of a suitable size and condition.  She feeds the animals with balanced animal feed, grass and natural grains so that her animals will reach an optimum size for selling in the different markets in the area, and so she can generate good earnings to cover her household costs.

She has requested a loan of 1,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of balanced feed for her animals.  With the earnings that she will generate with her animal sales, she will be able to cover the loan as well as have a better quality of life.

Cintia is a woman who has been able to move herself and her family ahead in life through effort and much determination.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Rodrigo De Jesús

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad Rodrigo es un luchador que siempre ha trabajado con la ilusión de sacara a su familia adelante y ofrecerle un mejor futuro. Desde hace 4 años tiene un negocio que le ha dado muchas satisfacciones, una tienda propia que fue una oportunidad para generar mejores ingresos y un posteriormente dejarle a sus 8 hijos un legado para su sostenimiento.

Rodrigo trabaja día a día con gran esmero para que su negocio siga progresando, actualmente ve la necesidad de comprar insumos para surtir la tienda con mas variedad y cantidad, pero no él no cuenta con el capital para invertirle a su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito con el cual comprar el surtido, mejorar las ventas, generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida notablemente.
texts.en:
At 63 years of age, Rodrigo is a fighter who always works with the intention of moving his family forward and offering them a better future. For the past four years, he has managed a business that has given him great satisfaction. Rodrigo has his own store, which gives him the opportunity to generate better income and provide an eventual inheritance for his eight children from which they can support themselves.

Rodrigo works day after day with great effort so that his business can keep progressing. At the moment, he needs to buy supplies to restock his store so that it will have more variety and greater quantity. However, he does not have the capital to invest in his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy inventory, improve his sales, generate more income, and improve his quality of life significantly.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a widow who takes care of four children. She sells cassava and at the same time prepares banku for sale at Elmina. Banku/akple is a fermented corn/cassava dough mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water to make a smooth whitish consistent paste.
To prepare banku, Esi first prepares a corn dough (maize that has been milled and left for a day) and cassava dough. She mixes the cassava and corn doughs and cooks them into a porridge-like consistency. To get the right consistency, she has to stir the mixture on a hot firewood stove. The texture of banku has to be fine, but firm. 
The accompanying dish can either be any kind of soup or sauce such as palm nut soup, groundnut soup or peanut soup, okra soup, or hot pepper sauce with fish of any kind. The most popular side dish for banku is okra stew.   
Esi's loan will be used to buy bags of maize and cassava to make dough for banku, which she will then sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and cassava to make dough for banku.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Lydia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La socia Isabel aún esta administrando su restaurante, ella se dedica  la preparación de desayunos, almuerzos y comidas en general, la socia a crecido mucho los últimos meses y esta muy satisfecha con los ingresos ahora ella desea invertir el credito en la compra de ingredientes, la socia requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor en especial los productos que salen a diario como son arroz, el aceite, los fideos, papa, carne, entre otros, ella comprara estos productos al por mayor para poder tener mejores ganancias. La socia invertira en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como fideos, aceite, arroz, papa, entre otros productos para la preparación de los diferentes potajes.
texts.en: Isabel still manages her restaurant where she prepares breakfast, lunch, and all other types of food.  She has experienced tremendous growth in recent months and is very pleased with her income.  Now she wants a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients in bulk, especially those products that she uses on a daily basis such as rice, oil, noodles, potatoes, meat, and other items.  By purchasing these products in bulk, Isabel will generate better earnings.  She needs these staple products so that she can prepare different dishes.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, noodles, potatoes, meat, and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Elyas

texts.en: Elyas is a 50-year-old farmer who raises and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables. He sells crops in the local bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN, and this is the sole financial income for his family. Elyas has 10 years of experience in farming. Now he thinks it is time to grow and he would like to get ahead in satisfying customers' demands. He would like to purchase more seeds and organic fertilizers in order to have more crops for next spring. For this purpose, he applied for an 1,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Mapera A Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the facilitator of the Mapera A group. His group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Patrick takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family and to improve his harvest. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Patrick will educate his children and save for future use. In 2012, the members of Mapera A group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.
The photograph shows the members of the group.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar Manuel tiene 42 años de edad  es casado tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de  8, 7 y 5 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La VRC. SAN JOSE Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El Rosario, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.
Oscar se dedica a la Agricultura tiene ya trabajando durante 27 años siembra fréjol, maíz, cacao. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para poder invertir en el ciclo corto siembra de maíz, fréjol , comprar abonos, urea, fertilizantes. 
El sueño es poder seguir aumentando la productividad. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.
En los tiempos libres le gusta dedicarse a la finca
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior ha podido invertir en la agricultura ha sembrado maíz,arroz, fréjol y  ha mejorado los ingresos económicos.
"Está muy agradeciodo por el crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Oscar Manues is 42 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives with his wife and children, ages 8, 7, and 5, in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

VCR San Jose is located in the El Rosario area, belonging to the canton of Ventanas.  This area is dedicated to farming short-cycle seeds like corn and rice.

Oscar has farmed for 27 years, planting beans, corn, and cacao.  He buys and sells in Ventanas.

He requests the loan to invest in short-cycle seeds like corn and beans, and to buy fertilizers.

His dream is to be able to keep increasing productivity.  He has not yet had any problems doing so.

In his free time he likes to work on the property.

With the help of the last loan he was able to invest in farming and has sown corn, rice and beans and is improving his finances.

He is very grateful for the previous loan.

loans.use: invest in short-cycle seeds like corn and beans, and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, así como alegre y amable, está casada con Arturo que es palmicultor, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos de 32 y 20 años de edad y sus dos nietos a los que quiere mucho, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Norma es la venta de jugos de frutas tales como naranjas, piñas, toronjas y otros. Cuyo negocio está instalado en el frontis de su casa, con una mesa en donde atiende a sus clientes de una manera amable y cordial durante toda la mañana hasta el medio día. 
Le agrada su negocio pues le permite contar con tiempo por las tardes para dedicarlo a su casa, y apoyar a sus hijas en el cuidado de sus nietos, además de ver buenas ganancias de hasta el 50% de lo invertido. Por tanto tiene planes de continuar en el negocio y desea poder ampliarlo instalado mesas y sillas, así como abrir un local en su propia casa donde pueda atender cómodamente a sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además dice sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser buenas personas y responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su negocio en la compra de frutas y con el saldo comprará mesas y sillas para la comodidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma is 48 years old. She is a hardworking, diligent woman, and happy and friendly. She married to Arturo who is a palm farmer. She lives with her husband and her 2 children who are 32 and 20 years old, and her 2 grandchildren who she loves very much, comfortably established in her own home. 

Norma’s business is selling fruit juice, such as orange, pineapple, and grapefruit as well as others. Her business is located in the front of her house, with a table where she takes care of her clients in a friendly and warmhearted way through the morning until noon.

What she likes about her business is that it allows her time in the evenings to be at home, and to help her daughters care for her grandchildren. Also, seeing good profit of up to 50 percent of the investment. Therefore, she has plans to continue in the business and wants to be able to add to the tables and chairs, as well as to open a facility in her own home where she can assist her clients comfortably. 

This will be her 4th loan with MFP, and therefore she is waiting for its approval in order to continue with her goals. Also, she says she feels good about the community bank because she considers the members to be good and trustworthy people.

With the amount requested of 2500 soles she will invest in her business buying fruit and with the remainder she will buy tables and chairs for the comfort of her clients.

loans.use: to buy fruit, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee un taller de mecánica el cual es muy visitado por las personas del lugar, últimamente ha aumentado la clientela pues tiene el mejor servicio con trabajo de calidad, a precios bajos; Ismael es un hombre dedicado al trabajo, muy  carismático y siempre se encuentra activo, le gusta estar adelante de la competencia para el Las metas e ideales que nos mueven, se generan a partir de las ganas de superarse, el está dispuesto a lograr sus sueños y es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que permita comprar herramientas, aceites, repuestos de carros entre otros. Ismael tiene la esperanza que así podrá darle a su familia seguridad economía.
texts.en: Ismael is 40 years old. He lives with his partner and their children. He has a mechanic shop that is very popular with people in the area. Lately he has increased his clientele because he has the best service and does good-quality work at low prices. Ismael is a man who is dedicated to his work, is very charismatic, and is always active. He likes to be ahead of the competition. For him, the goals and ideals that motivate him come from the desire to improve his situation. He is determined to achieve his dreams. This is why he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy tools, oils, and replacement car parts, among other items. Ismael has the hope that in this way he will be able to give his family economic security.

loans.use: to buy tools, oils, and replacement car parts.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY CACHIMAYO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucy; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ganados, ella vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere terminar de construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena y yeso al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucy is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Ccoyllorty Cachimayo” which is located in the District of Cachimayo in Anta Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 22 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child. Lucy divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling livestock at different fairs within the District of Anta. Through this business, she is able to help her children move forward. Lucy wants to finish the construction of her house, so she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and plaster in bulk.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and plaster.

loans.name: Torype Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
20 mujeres de ciudad del este se han unido con el propósito de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto poder ayudarse las unas con las otras. Ellas vieron una gran ayuda en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, es por ello que decidieron unirse. Actualmente están en el décimo sexto ciclo y desean llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Maximina nos cuenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la cual puede sacar adelante a su familia. Su negocio es el único medio que la ayuda a salir adelante. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que gracias a su sacrificio y esfuerzo ha podido ir creciendo de a poquito. Desea poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria y de esa forma poder ayudar más a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para surtir su local con arroz, fideo, azúcar, leche, panificados y demás artículos, los cuales tienen mucha salida y son los que más se venden.
texts.en:
Twenty women from Ciudad del Este have joined together to work as a team and through this work are able to help each other out.  They saw in Fundación Paraguaya’s enterprising women program a great help and decided to join.  They are currently in their 16th cycle and they want to reach the highest level within the program.

Maxima tells us that she has a well-stocked grocery store that she can support her family with.  Her store is the only source of help for her to get ahead.  She comments that she started out with very little but thanks to sacrifice and effort was able to gradually grow.  She wants to be able to continue growing as a micro businesswoman and thus be able to help her family even more.

She’s asking for the loan to stock her store with rice, noodles, sugar, milk, baked goods and other items which are very popular and sell the most.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Sylvia sells sweet bananas at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of sweet bananas. Her major business challenges are thieving during transport and defaulters. Her aspirations and goals are to expand her business into wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 year, marriage, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, soda. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase beans, soda for sale.

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
ENGLISH TRANSLATION
My name is Reina L. I am dedicated to the production and sale of tamalitos of elote.  I\'ve been running this businessabout 4 years, with the help of my daughters for the sale of my product.  My clients are excellent and  my business generates income to me for the sustenance of my home.  My goal is to increase my production and to have greater sales and with the gains that it obtains to be able to remodel my business and of giving a better study to my two daughters who estan to graduate as the school.


ORIGINAL SPANISH
Mi nombre es reina L. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tamalitos de elote, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, tengo la ayuda de mis hijas para la venta de mi producto, mis clientes son excelentes ya la mayoria de mi produccion es por encargo, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi hogar, mi meta es incrementar mi produccion y tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio y darles un mejor estudio a mis dos hijas que estan por graduarse del colegio.

loans.use: Compra de elotes, sal, agua, mantequilla, leña, fosforos,

loans.name: Falai

texts.en: Falai takes her three children to school,and this is where her sausage sizzle stall operates. The sausages easily run out as these are their favourites. Fifty tala each day is her target revenue thus in a week she earns two hundred and fifty tala. Falai is excited with how business is going and is not ready to give up even if her loan is paid off she is determined to continue on her sausage sizzles.

loans.use: To purchase sausages, cooking oil, fry, gas stove, Foil, tomato sauce, school fees.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is married and has two children ages 8 and 15. Her husband Jaime works as an intendant but his low salary is insufficient to meet their family's expenses so two years ago Juana decided to open a seamstress shop. She has ten years of experience as a seamstress. She outfitted a small space in her home and has two industrial sewing machines and a press. Little by little, she has come to be known among her neighbors for her quality work and demand for her services is growing. At this time Juana has a large order to fill and she needs to buy fabric. For this reason she needs a $475 loan. She promises to repay the loan within 6-12 months. You can play an important role in her success and raising her family's quality of life. Please do not hesitate to help. They are very grateful.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Juana es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 8 y 15 años de edad, su esposo Jaime labora como intendente y el salario que recibe es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, ante esta necesidad, hace dos años, Juana decidió abrir un taller de costura, en lo que tiene una amplia experiencia de 10 años, acondicionó un pequeño espacio de su casa donde tiene dos maquinas industriales y una plancha, poco a poco se ha dado a conocer entre sus vecinos y por su trabajo de calidad ha logrado incrementar sus pedidos y hacer crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos, Juana tiene un pedido grande y para poderlo surtir requiere de la compra de telas y varios complementos para la maquila de ropa, para esto necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Juana y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, no lo pienses más, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Umarboi

texts.ru:
Umarboi U. has been an active client of Microinvest for over 2 years. He has been in the wholesale business for at least 5 years. He is married with 3 children, all of whom are going to school. He began his business by selling rice. Initially his assets were worth $50. Today they are worth $120. Since the harvest season starts in August, Uramboi needs $200 to increase his sales. He will use the resulting profits to improve his children’s welfare.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Усмонов Умарбой, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 5 лет. Он женат, имеет 3 детей. Его дети учатся. Свою деятельность начал с продажи сельхоз. культурами, т. е. рисом. На начало его деятельности его актив составлял 50$. Сейчас его активы составляют 120$. Так как в августе начинается сезон, ему необходимо 200$ для увеличения товарооборота, а полученную прибыль потратить на благополучие своих детей.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Miss Dupe O. is 31 years old, and she has a communications stand at the University of Benin (UNIBEN). She sells rechargeable cards of all networks by wholesales, and makes calls for customers. She would like a loan of US$725 to improve her business. She is a faithful LAPO client, and she has two years of experience in this business.

loans.use: To buy more phones and rechargeable cards for sale

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
Maria Yolanda Martinez is a mother of 4 small children whose husband works for a man that sells display cases. His job, however, doesn’t provide enough income in order to feed them.

Things are getting worse as the children have been growing and have more needs, like clothes and shoes that no longer fit – in addition to school supplies that each time are growing more expensive. Due to this problem, she started to make handcrafted items to sell to her friends. However, she wasn’t making enough income to maintain her home, and therefore she started to sell fruits and vegetables out of her house for people in her neighborhood.

This is how, little by little and with a lot of heart, she is raising her children. However, the current situation is actually very difficult, since her husband hasn’t had many sales and there are still household expenses to take care of. In addition, the sales she’s had from her business have left her without any product and she needs to restock to be able to sell more. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $375 to pay over a term of 6 months. With your help, Maria Yolanda will be able to raise her children, while stabilizing her business and the job of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

María Yolanda M., es una madre de familia, de 4 pequeños hijos, y su esposo trabaja para un señor que vende vitrinas, y el trabajo no le deja suficiente como para sacar para comer. Las cosas se fueron empeorando en medida que los hijos iban creciendo y teniendo más necesidades como de ropa, los zapatos que no les quedaba, y lo útiles de la escuela que cada vez que van creciendo son más caros. Y debido a ese problema comenzó a hacer manualidades para venderlas entre sus amigas, sin embargo esto no le dejaba suficientes recursos para poder mantener el hogar, y por lo tanto empezó a vender frutas y verduras en su casa, para que los de la colonia le compren.

Así es como poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo a sacado a sus hijos adelante. Sin embargo la situación que está pasando actualmente es muy difícil, puesto que uno de su esposo no a tenido muchas ventas y en su casa los gastos no dejan de parar y las ventas que a tenido en el negocio se le fueron totalmente y necesita volver a surtirlo para poder vender más. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda María Yolanda, podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos, mientras se estabiliza su negocio y el trabajo de su esposo.

loans.use: To buy material and merchandise

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es:
Irma Yolanda is a 61 year old woman with a lot of enthusiasm for life and staying productive for society. She has three children who are already all married and who live outside of her home. Irma lives only with her husband who is already retired and living off the retirement pension he got. However, this money is not enough to pay the their household expenses. This is why Irma has been working selling jewelry through catalogue to neighbors and friends. Since she was much younger, Irma has been selling different kinds of things, from homemade meals, to clothes, to beauty products among other things, but right now she sells jewelry.

However, in this Christmas season Irma is requesting a loan for US $375 to be paid in a period of 4 months, and with this money Irma will be able to buy merchandise such as rings, bracelets, necklaces, earrings, pendants, etc, to be able to have products to offer to her customers. With your help Irma will be able to do well and help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Irma Yolanda una mujer de 61 con muchas ganas de vivir, y seguir siendo productiva para la sociedad. Tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya están casados todos y viven fuera de su casa. Irma vive solamente con su esposo quien ya está jubilado y vive sólo de la pensión que le dieron. Sin embargo con este dinero no les alcanza para pagar los gastos de su casa. Es por eso que Irma se dedica a vender joyería por catálogo a sus vecinas y amigos. Desde que era más joven doña Irma se dedicó a vender varios tipos de cosas desde elaborar comidas, vender ropa, productos de belleza entre otras cosas pero hoy se dedica a vender joyería.

Sin embargo en esta temporada navideña Irma está solicitando un crédito de US $375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Irma podrá comprar mercancía tales como anillos, pulseras, cadenas, arracadas, aretes, dijes, etc. Para poder tener productos que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Irma podrá salir adelante y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Buying jewelry to offer to her customers (Comprar joyería para ofrecerle a sus clientes)

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Mrs. Wilma F. lives in her own house with her husband and their four children in the town of Tupac Amaru in the city La Paz. She runs a neighborhood shop from out of her home and her husband works as the chauffeur of a public taxi.

The rooms that they live in are in a precarious condition for no being supported with the proper structures. For this reason there is a permanent risk. The requested loan will be used to demolish this room and build two new ones. This is the third time that Mrs. Wilma F. solicits a loan and a socioeconomic analysis qualifies them for it.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Wilma F. vive en casa propia en la zona de Tupac Amaru de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Enrrique Quispe y sus cuatro hijos. La señora Wilma tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio y su esposo trabaja como chofer de un taxi publico. Las habitaciones que ocupan se encuentran en condiciones precarias por no contar con estructuras apropiadas y el riesgo es permanente. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la demolición de una habitación y la construcción de estructuras nuevas para dos habitaciones. Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To take down an old room and build two new ones

loans.name: Gombolola Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Gorette N.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock. Gorette is 41 years old and is married. She has six children ranging in age from 2 to 14 and they all go to school.

Gorette is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Dina N., Rose N., and Carol N.. Sarah N. has a salon and wants to buy more braids and hair oils. Dina N. is currently operating a used clothing business and wants a loan to expand. Rose N. operates a business tailoring and wants to buy a new sewing machine and more materials. Carol N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to increase her charcoal stock.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đỗ Thị Lâm, 42 years old, and her husband realize that they can not rely only to their traditional rice farming so she takes out loan to raise pigs and he works extra as a construction labor to take care of weekly payments. Her first loan with the TYM Fund five years ago was 125USD. The loan amount was increased since then. This time she is applying for a loan of 650USD to expand her pig farm. The income is steady at 180-200USD a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Xuất thân từ một vùng nông thôn làm ruộng thuần túy, chị Đỗ Thị Lâm, 42 tuổi, và chồng chị đều nhận thức rằng nếu chỉ làm ruộng thì sẽ không bao giờ đời sống gia đình khá giả. Vì vậy chị và anh đã bàn nhau vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, đồng thời anh đi làm thợ xây để lấy nguồn trả hàng tuần. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương, vòng vốn đầu chị vay 125USD mua lợn giống. Sau một năm, cảm thấy tham gia Quỹ rât có ích cho phát triển kinh tế gia đình, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều vay cao hơn. Đến nay chị đã tham gia Quỹ được 5 năm, vòng vốn này chị dự định vay 650USD để mở rộng chuồng trại, mua thêm lợn giống và lợn nái. Thu nhập bình quân mỗi tháng từ 180-200USD.

loans.use: Buy piglets

loans.name: Veronica Patricia

texts.es:
Veronica G. is married. Her husband works as a laborer in a company. Because of lack of financial resources to cover their expenses, she decided to work selling shoes more than three years ago. In the beginning she started selling only to her relatives, but little by little she has increased her clientele.

Now she requests a loan for US $475, which she will pay back in 6 months, to buy shoes in cash because that way she can get them at a better price and obtain better profits. With your contribution Veronica will be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Verónica González es casada su esposo es obrero en una empresa. Debido a la falta de recursos económicos para solventar sus gastos ella decidió dedicarse a ala venta de zapatos hace más de tres años. Primero empezó solo vendiendo a su familia y poco a poco ha incrementado su clientela.

Ahora requiere un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar zapatos de contado ya que así se los dan a un mejor precio y ella obtiene mejores ganancias. Con tu contribución verónica seguirá con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To waterproof and repair the outside of the house

loans.name: Aaron Adepeju

texts.en: Aaron A. is business-oriented and very determined to expand her business. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more kitchen utensils and gift items for her shop. She is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She has been in this business since the year 1986. She remains grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more utensils and gift items

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.en:
first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=32985&_tpos=2&_tpg=1

Ambrosia belongs to the Señor de Huanca Village Bank.

She is a 42-year-old single mother and has 3 children. She sells emollient, a hot drink prepared with flax seeds and an herb with curative properties. She is a mobile seller with a cart in a central street in Ayacucho. She works at night.

Ambrosia needs a 1000 soles loan to buy sugar, herbs and linseed oil.

She wants to educate her children so that they could be professionals, but she also dreams about building a house and bettering her business.

loans.use: Buy sugar, herbs and linseed oil.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine O. is 39 years old, is married, and has a child.  She sells second-hand clothes, and she also sells palm oil to market women.  She has been in this business for the past seven years.  “My business is situated in a very busy location, and this has greatly improved my sales,” said Mrs. O..  She needs a loan of $700 to buy better-quality used clothes and to use in her oil business.  She says thank you to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase better-quality used clothes

loans.name: Magui

texts.fr: Magui K. est âgé de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous à l’école. EIle habite à  Danyi, un village à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Madame  Magui tient depuis 2 ans une boutique. Avec ce second crédit, elle souhaite acheter des sacs de riz, des cartons de laits, de sucres, des boissons et des huiles alimentaires en vue de les revendre et augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Les gains issus de l’activité permettront à madame Magui de faire face aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Magui K. is 31 years old, married, and the mother of three children, who are all in school. She lives in Danyi, a village located about 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Ms. Magui has had a shop for two years. With this second loan, she would like to buy sacks of rice, boxes of milk, sugar, beverages, and cooking oil with the goal of reselling them and increasing the capacity of her business. The gains from the business will enable Ms. Magui to address the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, boxes of milk, sugar , beverages, and cooking oils

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
La señorita Mirna M. tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su hermana y su cuñado desde hace un tiempo en la ciudad de Capitan Miranda. 

La señorita Mirna y su hermana son propietarias de una Despensa que poseen en el mismo lugar donde viven. Ambas son muy trabajadoras y mediante esta actividad ellas pueden solventar los gastos del hogar. Ademas tienen muchos deseos de salir adelante y progresar economicamente.  

Ella ha solicitado el credito para la compra de mercaderías para su Despensa, tales como: harinas, yerbas, fideos, aceites, azucar, arroz, bebidas en general, panificados, productos enlatados, y otros. Ya que hace tiempo que cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientela de la zona que acude a realizar sus compras.
texts.en:
Miss Mirna M. is 27 years old, single, and has lived with her sister and brother-in-law for some time in Capitan Miranda city. Miss Mirna and her sister are owners of a convenience store that they own in their home. Both are very hard-working and through this activity they can meet their household expenses. In addition they have many wishes to be successful and progress economically. She has asked for a loan to buy merchandise for their store such as: flour, tea, noodles, oil, sugar, rice, beverages, baked goods, canned goods and more. She has had a good number of neighborhood customers for quite some time who come to her for their shopping.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
