loans.use: Buy merchandise for their store such as: flour, tea, noodles, oil, sugar, rice, beverages, baked goods, canned goods and more

loans.name: Ni Made Suniti

texts.id: Ibu Ni Made Suniti dengan tekun menjalankan usaha ternak babinya yang sudah ditekuninya sejak menikah dengan I Nyoman Ariasa dan usahanya ini telah begitu banyak membantu keluarganya dalam memenuhi segala kebutuhan mereka. Saat ini Ibu Ketut Suniti masih memelihara satu ekor babi penggemukan dan berencana untuk menambah jumlahnya beberapa ekor lagi. Itu sebabnya Ibu Ni Made Suniti mengikuti program ternak babi yang dikelola Yayasan Dinari dengan jangka waktu enam bulan yang akan dilunasi pada akhir periode. Ibu Ni Ketut Suniti memiliki harapan yang besar bahwa pinjaman dana yang diperolehnya bisa membantunya mengembangkan usahanya sehingga keuntungan yang biasanya diperoleh sekitar Rp 350.000 bisa bertambah  dan keluarganyapun bisa semakin sejahtera dan anaknya yang masih bersekolah bisa menyelesaikan pendidikannya.
texts.en:
Ni Made Suniti has been farming pigs since she got married to I Nyoman Ariasa. This business has been helping her pay for daily living expenses. Currently Ketut Suniti is farming a fattening pig. She plans to farm a few more pigs. Therefore, she joined DINARi foundation's pig farming training program and requesting a 6 month loan. Ni Ketut Suniti really hopes that the loan will help her expand the business so that she can increase her profit that is currently at about $40 per cycle. She plans to increase her family's living standard with the additional income and pay for her child's tuition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Membeli anak babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa M., 31 years of age, is a dynamic and hardworking mother of three children in Barangay Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Melissa was a working student in college. After graduation she married Elmer M., a fisherman. Since her husband’s income is not enough to meet their daily expenses, she helps out by selling “Puto” made of cassava every day in the nearby school in their municipality.

When she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she attended trainings about how to run a business and expanded her business to a sari-sari store. She wants to obtain financial assistance amounting to PHP 50,000.00 to purchase a variety of goods to be sold in her sari-sari store, so that she can increase her sales and income. She plans to purchase a motorized fishing boat in the near future to be used by her husband.

She really values her credit worthiness, and she has been a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC since 2001.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of goods for sari-sari store

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Ayni II Village Bank.  Juana is 65 years old and separated, with two children. She has a store on a centrally located street in the city of Ayacucho where she rents wedding dresses, party dresses and suits. She also has a workshop where she sews clothing in the same location. She has several employees who help her sew.  Juana needs a loan of 2500 PEN to buy a variety of fabrics.  Juana dreams of buying more sewing machines for her workshop and of traveling to different places to relax. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni II.
Juana es separada, tiene 65 años y 2 hijos, Juana tiene una tienda en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde alquila vestidos de novia, de fiesta, ternos, además tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir que esta en el mismo lugar, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de un personal.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas variadas.
Juana sueña con implementar con mas maquinas su taller y viajar a distintos lugares para descansar.

loans.use: Buy a variety of fabrics

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the Yanapanakusun Village Bank. “Yanapanakusun” means “Let’s help ourselves” in Quechua, the first language of many of the group members. She is 29 years old and is the single mother of three children. Marcelina sells sweets from a cart near a large park in the city of Ayacucho. She has had this business for the past three years. Previously, she sold different kinds of merchandise. She works alone each day from 9am to 8pm. 

Marcelina is requesting a loan to restock her candy cart with a few things she’s missing. Her goal for the future is to improve and expand her business, and eventually establish her own juice stand or restaurant.

loans.use: Buy candy

loans.name: Loymira Margelith

texts.es:
La señora Loymira pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Samaritanas” vive en Jr. José Olaya Nº 782 – Sector Tacunga, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 32 años y es madre de 2 hijos los que todavía dependen de ella. Es casada, su esposo le apoya en el negocio. Con el primer prestamo decide comprar pollos para venderlos en el mercado por kilos. Tiene 3 ciclos con el banco.

En la actualidad continua con el negocio de venta de pollos enteros y en cuartos en un puesto ubicado en el mercado de la ciudad, esto le genera ganancias diarias para el pago de las cuotas mensuales del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/. 800 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara pollos vivos en cantidad de las avícolas que le permitirá vender a un precio mas cómodo y obtendrá mayores ganancias y además podrá ofrecer al por mayor a su clientela.

Loymira manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle surgir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Loymira belongs to The Samaritans' Municipal Bank. She lives on Jr. José Olaya Number 782, in the Tacunga division of the Tarapoto district, department of San Martín. She is 32 years old and the mother of two children who still depend on her. She is married and her husband supports her in the business. With the first loan she chooses to buy chickens to sell them in the market by the kilo. She has completed three cycles with the bank. Currently, she is continuing with her business of selling whole chickens and quarter chickens in a stand located in the city market. This will generate daily earnings for the monthly loan payments to the bank. With this loan of 800 soles ($250 USD) that will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a large amount of live chickens from the poultry farms, allowing her to sell for a more reasonable price and obtain higher earnings and, furthermore, will allow her to sell in bulk to her customers. Loymira expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large amount of live chickens from poultry farms to allow her to sell at a more reasonable price and obtain higher earnings and also allow her customers to buy in bulk.

loans.name: Ni Komang Yudi Artini

texts.id: Hidup di desa membuat Komang Yudi Artini yang bekerja sebagai Guru TK juga mempunyai usaha sampingan yaitu beternak babi.Yudi sudah bergabung dengan Dinari sudah dua kali periode di kelompok KWT Teratai Mekar  dan pelunasan dilakukan diakhir periode.Setelah melunasi pinjaman yang pertama dengan penjualan babi , Yudi kembali meminjam di Dinari dan kembali membeli bibit babi 4 ekor, harga perekor Rp 350.000  Dengan modal Rp.1.400.000,-,Yudi memelihara babi  dibelakang rumahnya. Harga pakan yang mahal,membuat Yudi juga kebingungan dalam mencari modal,dengan bantuan Dinari ,Yudi bisa membeli pakan dan juga beberapa ekor bibit babi lagi. Yudi memberi makan babinya 2x sehari pada pagi dan sore hari,kandangnya juga dibersihkan sampai bersih, sebelum Yudi memberi makan ternaknya. Keuntungan yang diperoleh perekor Rp.80.000,- . Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya yang duduk dikelas 5 SD. Anaknya yang pertama seharusnya kelas 3 SMA,tetapi karena kecelakaan,sudah meninggal 2 tahun yang lalu. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diberikan oleh Dinari usahanya semakin meningkat.
texts.en:
Living in the village urged Komang Yudi Artini who works as a teacher to have a side effort in rearing pigs. Yudi already worked with Dinari twice with KWT Teratai Mekar and settled at the end of the period. After repaying the first loan with the proceeds from the sale of the pigs, Yudi once again loan from Dinari and once again purchased 4 piglets, costing Rp.350.000,- (about USD35) each, with the funding Rp.1.400.000,- (about USD140). Yudi rears the pigs behind her house. The cost of feed is expensive causing Yudi to revert to obtain funding from Dinari, Yudi is able to purchase feed and several more piglets. Yudi feeds the pigs twice a day in the morning and late afternoon; the pigpen is also cleaned, before Yudi gives the feed. Profit from each pig is Rp.80.000,- (about USD8). This profit is used to support her livelihood and also cover her child’s education expenses currently in grade 5. Her first child would have been in grade 8 but due to misfortune, passed away 2 years ago. Her hope, with this loan from Dinari her effort will continue to be successful.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and it's feed

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente hace 12 años, es madre de 4 hijos que viven con ella en su casa. Sus padres fueron agricultores y ella los apoyó hasta hace poco en las labores agrícolas, hasta que le regalaron unos terrenos para que cultive cítricos, plátano y kion de manera independiente. En consecuencia, Maria se levanta a las 5.00am para preparar los alimentos y una vez cocidos alista el menú en la vianda que llevará a la chacra. Esa es su rutina diaria, de la cual se siente muy contenta, dedicándole toda su atención a sus cultivos junto a su esposo. Después de haber trabajado y cultivado el kion, esperan cosechar de 3 a 4 meses y en seguida lo comercializan, en su zona los venden a 1 sol el kilo, pero en ocasiones que mejora el precio opta por enviar sus productos a los mercados de Lima para captar mayores ingresos, pero debe acumular más de 1.000 kilos para que pueda cubrir el flete (costo de transporte). En el pasado no trabajó con créditos por temor, pero ahora tiene muchas esperanzas con su banco comunal, este es su primer préstamo y se está comprometiendo en pagar las cuotas en las fechas programadas. El dinero que solicita es para la limpieza de sus terrenos, quitándole las hierbas y malezas que en esta época de lluvia crecieron muy rápido y hoy dificulta el desarrollo de las plantas, por ellos necesita sacarlas para no perjudicar sus cosechas.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old, has lived with her partner for 12 years, and is the mother of 4 children who live with her at home. Her parents were farmers and she helped them until very recently with their farmwork, so her parents gave her some land on which she and her husband can grow citrus fruits, plantains, and "kion" independently. As a consequence, Maria gets up at 5:00am every morning to prepare the food, and once it's cooked, she gets it ready to take to the farm. This is her daily routine, which makes her feel very happy, dedicating all her attention to her crops, together with her husband.

After planting and growing the "kion" they wait 3 to 4 months to harvest it and immediately sell it. In their region they sell it for 1 sol per kilogram, but in occassions in which the price is better they opt to send their products to the markets in Lima to increase their income. However, they need to gather more than 1,000 kilograms in order to be able to cover the cost of transportation to market. In the past they didn't take out any loans due to fear, but now they have a great deal of hope with their communal bank. This is their first loan and they promise to make their payments on the due dates.

The money Maria is asking for is to clear their land, taking out the weeds that have grown very rapidly due to the rain and are making it difficult for the plants to grow. They need to pull the weeds so they don't decrease the harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clearing their farmlands

loans.name: Diomith

texts.es:
La señora Diomith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción”, vive en el Jr. Tacna Nº 658., Distrito de San José de Sisa, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 01 que todavía depende de ella.

Se inicio con un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00,  por iniciativa propia emprendió su  propio negocio de venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos.
Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelara a un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz, azúcar y almidón en sacos, huevos en javas, cajas de leche; e insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, tranquila, capaz y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Diomith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Sra. Diomith belongs to the "Mujeres en Accion" community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She's married, 44 years old and the mother of 2 children, one of whom still lives at home.

She began with a first loan of S/.300.00 and started a grocery business. She's still operating the business which is located in her house. Her most regular customers are her friends and neighbors. With this S/.1500.00 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in buying products to stock her business: rice, sugar, bags of starch, eggs, canned milk, toiletries and cleaning products, soft drinks and other products to keep her customers happy.

Diomith makes her own decisions about how to spend the earnings from the business. It's given her a sense of independence. Repaying the loans makes her feel capable and responsible. She's grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepeneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta F., 60 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois de Pout Diack depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson fumé et l’élevage de chèvres. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Binta F., age 60, is married and has five children to support. She has been been a member of the village lending group of Pout Diack for six and a half years. She is active in selling smoked fish and raising goats. Her revenues enable her to improve her family's living conditions. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell smoked fish and to raise goats

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, it can obtain larger sums and a short term for financing their businesses. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of vegetables, fish, costume jewelry, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Niagnéguéton 6 Group

texts.fr:
Niagnéguéton 6 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du hameau Sinsina Sesso de la ville de Koutiala région  de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Elles excellent principalement  dans la culture de l’arachide et du mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Niagnéguéton 6 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les trois  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, de mil  et d’intrants, au grand marché de Koutiala. 
Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certains  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail ou en gros, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Niagnéguéton 6 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 80 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Niagnéguéton 6 is a group of married women from the Sinsina Sesso hamlet of the town of Koutiala, Sikasso region, (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big extended traditional families with their children, husbands, parents- and sisters-in-law, etc. They have an average age of 33 and at least 4 children each. They excel principally in the cultivation of peanuts and millet.

In the intention of making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the Niagnéguéton 6 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso 4 years ago. After having correctly reimbursed the three preceding loans, they are now on their fourth rural loan.

The present loan will be used to buy minor agricultural material, a sufficient quantity of peanut and millet seeds, and entrants, in the big open-air market of Koutiala. After the rainy season, the harvests are stocked for a certain time so that they gain in value before being sold at the big market of Koutiala and in the surrounding markets, retail or wholesale and for cash, to a clientele mostly coming from the big cities.

The members of the Niagnéguéton 6 group each expect to make, after their agricultural produce has been sold, a profit of 80,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and cover current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of entrants, seeds, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Menelyn

texts.en:
Menelyn R. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Menelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Menelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling beverages, like soft drinks, in their village. Menelyn has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Menelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Menelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Menelyn is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Menelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of the children and provide for the family's needs.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Mujeres De Negocios Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Mujeres de Negocio conformado por La joven Tereza de Jesús S. C., es una mujer casada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo de los cuales solo su hijo de 6 años estudia su actividad económica es la venta de frijoles cocidos y leña. La ubicación es en su humilde vivienda. Teresa empezó este negocio desde hace 4 años. Anteriormente  vendía refrescos y helados ya que no poseía el capital suficiente, para invertir en más productos. Con ayuda de su esposo han salido adelante, por lo que algunas veces el salía a vender los refrescos en su comarca, sin embargo la situación económica por la cual ellos pasan no impiden que salgan adelante con su negocio. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como leña, frijoles, cuajadas, queso y crema. Sus sueños son que sus hijos puedan aspirar a poseer algún nivel académico. Su otra amiga Claudia del Carmen O. R. tiene la edad de 39años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio por cuenta propia, ya que tenía que sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que es Madre soltera y tenía que salir adelante con sus hijos. Por lo que con la ayuda de sus hijos, salía vender ya que uno de ellos estaba pequeño y necesitaba de cuido, por lo que algunas veces ofrecía sus productos y viajaba con su hijo. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la compra de cremas, perfumes y lociones. Su deseo es salir adelante con su negocio. Y la ultima es María Elena O. R. tiene 46 años de edad. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos y dulces. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, por que anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de cajetas así ayudaba para completar de pagar los gastos necesarios. Ya que el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cosméticos. A pesar de las diferentes actividades económicas que poseen las 3 todas tiene el sueño y el deseo de seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres de Negocio" (Women of Business) is made up of young de Tereza de Jesús S. C.. She is a married woman who has two children in her care of whom only her six year old son is in school. Her economic activity is selling baked beans and firewood. Her business' location is in her humble home. Teresa began this business four years ago. Previously, she sold refreshments and ice cream since she didn't have sufficient capital to invest in more products. With the help of her husband, she has been getting ahead. Sometimes he goes out and sells refreshments in their area. Nevertheless, their economic situation does not stop them from getting ahead with their business. The loan that they are requesting is for working capital used to purchase products such as firewood, beans, cheese curds, cheese and cream. Their dreams are that their children may aspire to achieve any academic level. Her other friend, Claudia del Carmen O. R., is 39 years old. She is a single mother. She has two children in her care. Her economic activity is selling cosmetics. It's been more than five years that she's been working in this business. She started it on her own since she had to get her children ahead and she is a single mother. So with the help of her children, she would go out selling. Since one of them was little, and needed care, sometimes she would go out to sell with her son. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital to purchase creams, perfumes and lotions. Her wish is to suceed with her business. The last member is María Elena O. R. who is 46 years old. She has two children in her care. Her job is selling cosmetics and sweets. She has been dedicated to this business for more than 15 years. Previously she sold cajetas (a dessert) and helped to pay the bills. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital to purchase cosmetics. While the economic activities of these three women is different, each has the dream and desire to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 19-year-old man living with his parents. In 2007, he decided to open an accessories shop as his own business. Today, Bilal is requesting to borrow US$ 900 to purchase merchandise in order to satisfy the demand of the market  and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Hok M. is a 37-year-old married woman and mother. She works sewing clothes for the garment industry and gets a salary of US$120 a month. She provides her income to manage her family’s daily expenses.

Hok M. is married with two young children who are enrolled in school. Her husband’s name is Mr. Eum Nhor, age 30, a construction worker, who appears in the photograph here.

Hok M. and her family face difficulty with electricity use because her house doesn’t have electric power. Therefore, Hok M. is taking out a loan to pay for the expense of hooking up to the electricity supply. The rest of loan will be used to decorate her old house.

loans.use: To pay for hooking up to the electricity supply and to decorate her old house

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Olga Marina Méndez tiene 49 años. Ella dio inicio con su pulpería hace más de 18 años. Y con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado obtener nuevos productos para su pulpería, la mayoría de sus clientes son sus propios vecinos, Olga se levanta muy temprano para realizar las tareas del hogar y dedicarse a sus hijos, es una madre muy responsable que le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que disfruta hablar con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos de consumo diarios, detergentes, jabón, cosméticos y refrescos. El mayor sueño de Olga es convertir su negocio en una pequeña distribuidora en donde ofrezca lo necesario.
texts.en:
Olga Marina Méndez is 49 years old and has been operating a grocery store for the past 18 years. With the help of financing, she has managed to obtain new products for her business. Most of her customers are her own neighbors. Olga wakes up early in the morning to perform household chores and then spends time with her children. She is a very responsible mother who enjoys her work and talking with her customers.

The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to buy everyday consumer products, detergents, soaps, cosmetics, and soft drinks. Olga dreams of converting her business into a small distribution center that offers all the basic necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 54 years old and married with two children. She sells roasted beef popularly known in Nigeria as bush meat. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more roasted beef to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more roasted beef to sell

loans.name: Jesualina

texts.es:
La socia Jesualina, es  natural del distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años de edad, ella vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, la socia tiene 2 hijos, ella  es  conviviente y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de quesos, nuestra socia vende en la feria de Inquilpata todos los viernes sus quesos, la socia desea el préstamo para poder adquirir mayor número de quesos y así tener un mayor y mejor ingresos económico.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
M. Lola is a 46-year-old mother who does sewing work in a tailoring shop to earn money for her children. She started because she loves this trade. Lola is doing her best to ensure that her children will have a good education and the best future. She hopes that her children can continue with their education. That is the reason that she needs to continue growing her business. She asks for a 2,000 somoni (TJS) loan that will be invested in buying a new sewing machine to increase her production and cover customers' demands. Help this family improve the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Lola’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new, modern fabrics for sewing national dress

loans.name: Tamemsu Ii Group

texts.en: Hawa M., Fatmata K. I, Fatmata K. I., and Yeabu S. are the members of the Tamemsu I. loan group. This is the first loan they are seeking from SMT and Kiva, and they are looking for 2 million LE in order to expand their businesses. Hawa is the leader of this group, and she is 45 years old. She has seven children, all of whom attend either primary or secondary school. Hawa has been in business for five years selling such goods as palm oil, rice, and peppers to supplement her husband’s income as a driver in town.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of rice, palm oil, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodabi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Wholesale and individual sales of corn and beans

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji M. sells various items in her shop, such as sugar, salt, books, and rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase other items for her retail shop .  Keji is 30 years old and is married to a soldier. She has 4 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open another retail shop in a market.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary P. is from the village of Bagumbang Bonifacio. She is 28 years old. Rosemary is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Rosemary owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rosemary has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosemary joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemary has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosemary is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosemary from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer D. 61 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y 4 D. sus 6 hijos, quienes viven en su casa, pero ya son mayores e independientes.

Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado al comercio y ha vendido infinidad D. cosas. Esta actividad le fascina porque conversa muchísimo con la gente, mientras obtiene ganancias económicas. 
A inicios preparaba algunos postres y los vendía por porciones; D. ese modo, poco a poco, fue avanzando y con la ayuda D. su esposo lograron obtener y construir su casa, donD. hoy alquilan un espacio como local comercial. Pero Blanca no ha dejado D. vender sus dulces ambulatoriamente, recorre todas las calles, especialmente donD. hay más jóvenes, quienes son sus mayores consumidores. A su vez, estar ocupada es lo que más le agrada, ya que D. ese modo obtiene ganancias y no se estresa. 
Sus planes a futuro son D. terminar D. construir tres cuartos más en su casa, para alquilarlos y cubrir sus necesidades en su vejez.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, donD. ratifica su compromiso D. seguir trabajando responsablemente, ya que este préstamo es D. mucha ayuda para la marcha y el crecimiento D. su negocio. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. materiales D. construcción para su casa y golosinas para seguir trabajando como comerciante ambulante.
texts.en:
Blanca is 61 years old and lives with her husband and four of her six children, who live at home but are adults on their own. All her life she has been in business and has sold many different things. She really enjoys her work because it allows her to have conversations with many people while bringing her an income. She started out making and selling various desserts. She moved forward little by little, and together with her husband, they were able to build their home, which includes a small retail space that she rents out. Blanca has not stopped selling her treats on foot. She walks all of the streets, especially those where there are more young people, who are her biggest customers. Being busy what she likes to do the most, especially since this way she is able to earn an income without stress. Her plan is to build three more rooms onto her home so she can rent them out and be able to cover her needs in her old age. This will be her third loan through MFP, and she reiterates that she will continue to work responsibly and that this loan will be very helpful for the advancement of her business. She will use this loan to buy building supplies for her house and also candy and treats that she can continue to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials and candy for resale

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo Antonio M. con dos crédito que ha tenido con FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le esta haciendo falta colocarle el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa  de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera. 
Es esta solicitando el préstamo para construcción y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos que obtiene como secretario general del sindicato del empleo. 
Su deseo es que sus casa y familia este mas seguros y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Ricardo has used the previous two loans through FVP to build a new room but it still needs a roof. He plans to build a concrete slab so that the home will be more secure and last longer. He is asking for this loan to pay for the construction and plans to repay it from the income he receives from his job as an office assistant at the employment office. He would like his home and family to feel more secure and live better.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete slab roof

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: Adèle F. est une femme de 66 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants tous majeurs. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KOUDOSS depuis 3ans et demi et a été 7 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de légumes, et de poissons. Son activité lui a procuré des ressources financières qui lui ont permis d'équiper sa maison en se payant des meubles de salon. Son mari est admis à la retrait depuis plus de 5ans et elle le soutien dans le payement des factures d'électricité et autres charges familiales.
texts.en:
Adèle F. is a 66-year old woman who is married and has five children, all of whom are adults. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (credit association) in DAROU-KOUDOSS for three and a half years and has benefited from seven consecutive loans. She is building up a small vegetable and fish business. Her business has procured for her financial resources which have allowed her to fit out her house with the purchase of lounge furniture. Her husband has been retired for more than five years and she supports him in the payment of electricity bills and other family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Felix Eladio

texts.es:
Félix Ramírez de 58 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es soltero pero tiene un hijo de 16 años que estudia.   
 
Félix inicio como ayudante en un taller mecánico haciendo reparaciones de carros, arreglo de motores y todo tipo de arreglos para carros, gracias a este trabajo pudo aprender como ser un mecánico profecional. Con sus pocos ahorros alquilo un local para independizarse como mecánico. 

Ahora el trabaja desde las 08:00 am hasta las 20:00 pm todos los días. Hace reparaciones de motores, válvulas, inyectores etc. Una de las complicaciones que hasta ahora tiene es el clima muy lluvioso. Pero con el préstamo quiere comprar hierro para su negocio.

En el futuro quiere una ferretería (lugar donde hay herramientas de venta) para asegurar el futuro de su único hijo. Y tener su propio taller.
texts.en:
Félix Ramírez is a 58-year-old man who lives in a peri-urban area of Perimetral de Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and has the basic utilities. He is single but has a 16-year-old son who is currently in school.

Félix started out as a mechanic's assistant, fixing cars, repairing engines, and performing all types of automotive repair tasks. Thanks to this job, he was able to learn how to become a professional mechanic. With his little savings, he was able to rent a garage and became a self-employed mechanic.

He now works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm every day. He repairs engines, valves, fuel injectors, etc. One of his biggest problems is the rainy season; however, he would like to purchase sheet metal for his business.

In the future, would like to have his own garage and a hardware store where he can sell hand tools so that he can ensure his only son's future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheet metal

loans.name: Hub

texts.en: Mrs. Hub P. is 45 years old and she is a villager who lives in Pou village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice in order to earn for his family's living expenses. In this farming she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her farming crop. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide and to pay out for hiring a water machine to water her rice and to pay out for plowing. Aside from farming, she also sells boiled rice. Her husband, Mr. Toak Srey, is a motorbike taxi driver. He can make a small income to improve his family's standard of living. This couple does not have any children. Her husband is on the left, in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer; rice seed and pesticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fixing up his house

loans.name: Sot

texts.en:
Mr. S., 37, resides in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He owns a medium size farm that he inherited from his grandparents. Here he plants different types of vegetables from which he earns a living. He normally harvests and sells vegetables when it comes to maturity. He lives with his wife who works as a garment factory laborer. This couple was married years ago and they have three school-aged children. 

S. has difficulty irrigating his crop because his farm is far from the watering system. S. is therefore applying for a loan to buy a pump to pump the water to his crops.

loans.use: To buy a pump for irrigation

loans.name: Mrs. Voeun Voeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of twelve people who live in Pean Meas Kaeut village in Takeo province. They will each use their share of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their businesses. 

Mrs. Voeun Voeun was selected by the other members of her group as their village bank president. She is 25 years old. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice that she sells to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Kha Khoem, is a broom seller door-to-door. Both of them work hard at their businesses but they still do not earn much. For that reason, they wanted to start a new business but they did not have enough money to invest in it. Thus, Mrs. Voeun Voeun is seeking a loan to buy some piglets for breeding. Through this activity, they hope to support their five children, all of wH. attend local public school.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en:
Ghazi is a 55-year-old man from Lebanon. He is the father of three children. He has been working as a blacksmith. He is skilled at many kinds of metal work including furniture. 

Ghazi is proud of his experience and strong reputation in his work. He notes that it has been a challenge to secure financing for his business. Today, for the third time, Ghazi has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to purchase a spot welder for his work. His previous loans allowed him to continually improve his business by either purchasing better tools for his work, or simply by purchasing more iron for his business. In the future, he hopes to keep on improving and expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a spot welder for his work

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda pertenece al Banco Comunal Amor Divino y lo que le agrada son las reuniones amenas que la distraen mucho y los prestamos fáciles.
Hilda es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian su sueño es que ellos sean profesionales, docente de profesión y trabaja por las noches, Hilda tiene una pequeña pensión en su casa en donde vende comida solo en el almuerzo, tiene 30 personas pensionadas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 1 persona, además Hilda brinda el servicio de preparación de comida para diferentes eventos y compromisos. En el ultimo año compro un terreno en la ciudad de Lima en donde construyo su casa para que sus hijos viajen a estudiar a la capital y su préstamo solicitado será invertido en la compra de puertas y ventanas para la casa.
Hilda tiene la intención de implementar una boutique.
texts.en:
Hilda belongs to the communal bank “Amor Divino” and enjoys the entertaining meetings and the easy loans. Hilda is married with two children in school. Her dream is for them to become professionals. She is a teaching professional and works at night receiving a small salary. She also sells lunch to 30 retired people from her home with help of one other person. She prepares food for various events and meetings. Last year, she bought a plot of land in Lima and constructed a home so her children could go to school in the capital. Her loan request would be used to purchase doors and windows for her home. Hilda plans to open a boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase doors and windows for her house

loans.name: Sikola

texts.en:
Sikola S. is 38 and married with 5 children (ages 1 - 15).  She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting taro to sell.  Sikola needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Sikola joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sikola's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Mariana Santos

texts.es:
Mariana Santos E. S. tiene 50 anos. Vive en union libre en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos: 2 gemelas de 31 anos y una hija de 25 anos. 

Mariana es una socia de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dideican al cultivo de maiz, arroz, soya, platano, papaya, y otros.

Mariana se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de soya, maiz, y frijol. Realiza sus compras y ventas de sus productos en Mata de Cacao a la semana. 

Solicita el credito para su agricultura. Lo va a invertir en sembrar mas maiz y frijol. Su sueno es sacar un negocio mas grande y seguir creciendo. 

En su tiempo libre hace cosas en la casa como cocinar, arreglar la casa, y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mariana Santos E. S. is fifty years old and lives in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar province. She has three children: twins, a thirty-one year old, and a twenty-five year old daughter. Mariana is a member of the communal bank "Genesis," which is located two hours from Chillanes. There are eleven members in total, who for the most part, cultivate corn, rice, soy, plantains, papaya, and other crops for a living. Mariana is a farmer who cultivates soy, corn, and beans. She makes her purchases and sells her products in Mata de Cacao each week. She is taking out a loan for her farming and is going to invest it in planting more corn and beans. Her dream is to have a bigger business and to keep growing. She does house work like cooking, straightening up the house, and helping her family when she has free time.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in corn and beans to plant.

loans.name: Urjinsuren

texts.en:
Urjinsuren J. lives with her husband in Central province of Mongolia in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and she operates a consumer goods retailing business with the help of her husband. Her husband is a plumber for the local Heating Station and is employed with a salary of 310,000 MNT per month. 

She began her business in 2009 with working capital of 1,000,000 MNT. Since then, she has been working hard to operate her business and her working capital has grown to exceed 2,500,000 MNT. 

She would like to grow her business in order to sell vegetable products as well and be able to save money for purchasing an apartment so that she can improve her quality of life. Urjinsuren is the kind of person who is hard working and modest. 

She is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of food products at wholesale prices and to increase her working capital as well.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of food products to sell

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées avec en moyenne 43 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants, qui vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à N’Gala, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités agricoles. 
Elles cultivent le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, FILY S., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de main d’œuvre pour entretenir environ 1,6 hectare de petit mil, d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser après la campagne, un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA environ.
texts.en:
he ten members of the Benkadi I group are married women who are on the average 43 years old, with five children; they live mainly in polygamous families in N’Gala, a village in the Diola prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the 2nd administrative district of Mali). They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better manage their agricultural business. They cultivate pearl millet, peanuts and beans. They are on their second agricultural loan, having duly repaid the previous loan. With this new loan, Fily S., the group’s leader, plans to purchase agricultural inputs, small tools and pay the cost of labor to work about 1.6 hectares [approx.4 acres] of pearl millet, peanuts and beans. After harvesting, the produce is sold in the town of Diola and in Massigui, to a customer base composed of both men and women. After this agricultural season the group members plan to earn an average revenue of about 50,000 West African Francs each.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, weeding, fertilizers, herbicides and small tools

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Чаборов Акбар проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 21 год. Холост. Мать учительница, преподает в средней школе. Брат на заработках в России. Сам Акбар имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей на рынке. У него продуктовый магазин. Он в основном продает конфеты и печенья. В этой области имеет  хороший опыт. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота т.к. на канун праздников спрос на его товар увеличивается. На будущее он хочет собрать деньги, чтобы устроить свою свадьбу.
texts.en:
Akbar J. lives in Yavan. He is 21 years old and single. His mother is a high school teacher. His brother works in Russia. Akbar has a high school education. He works trading in the market. He has a grocery shop. He basically sells candy and cookies. He has a good deal of experience in this area. He is taking out a loan to increase his sales since demand increases near the holidays. In the future, he wants to raise money to get married.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing sales

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES DE SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Saylla en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Katia;  La socia tiene  30 años de edad;  ella es soltera; La socia se dedica a la crianza de  aves de corral y cuyes. La socia requiere en esta oportunidad el crédito para comprar animales de corral y de este modo incrementar sus ganancias. La socia compra tiernos los animales los cría engorda y vende, algunas veces se reproducen y esto genera mayor ingreso y esta vez ella aumentara sus animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar aves de corral. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Katia is a member of the community bank "Los Rosales de Saylla" [The Roses of Saylla], which is located in the Saylla district in the province and department of Cusco.  

Katia is 30 years old and single.  She works raising poultry and guinea pigs.  She would like this loan to purchase farm animals to increase her income.  She purchases young animals and raises them to be sold.  Sometimes they reproduce and this generates more income and increases the number of animals she has.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase poultry.

Katia is thankful for and values the loan she has been given, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of farm animals

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo de 48 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil lugar caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. Tiene un taller de ensamblaje y un carro que lo utiliza para expreso. 

Hace 7 años el comenzó en su carro haciendo expresos pero como necesitaba mas ingresos para poder mantener a sus tres hijos. Comenzó con un talle de ensamblaje en la parte delantera de su casa. Poco a poco tubo una buena acogida con los vecinos de su barrio. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 07h30 haciendo expreso y desde las 13h30 hasta las 18h00 con su taller de ensamblaje. Hace puertas, ventanas, etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques y pintura para que su negocio y casa estén mejor ubicados. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su vivienda y tener una compañía de expresos.
texts.en:
Arturo is 48 years old.  He lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil, a place where the majority of the inhabitants are involved in business.  He owns a woodworking shop and a car that he uses to make deliveries.

Out of necessity, 7 years ago he began using his car in the delivery business.  This enabled him to support his three children.  He began his workshop in the front part of his house.  Little by little he gained a good reputation with his neighbors.  Currently he works from 6:30am to 7:30am making deliveries and then from 1:30pm to 6pm he works in his shop.  He makes doors and windows etc.

With the loan he would like to buy cement, blocks and paint in order for his business and home to be better positioned.  En the future he would like to finish building his home and own a delivery business.

loans.use: To buy cement, blocks and paint.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Sanu Maiya

texts.en:
Sanu Maiya C. is 35 years old, and married, with 2 children aged 17 and 10.  In 2000, she established her furniture-making business.  She works 7 days a week and 8 hours a day to support her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchase wood and timber for her work.  In the future, Sanu Maiya plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way.  Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  http://www.kiva.org/partners/62

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn B. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 21 years old. Rosalyn is married and has one child. To make a living, Rosalyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosalyn works hard to be able to save for her child's future.

Rosalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies

loans.name: Fausto

texts.en:
Fausto T. Jr. is from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 38 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Fausto owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs to sell. Fausto has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Fausto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Dorotia

texts.en:
Dorotia D. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Antipolo, Brgy.Linao, Talisay City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two businesses. She is a tailor who makes curtains, pillow cases, and bedsheets. She also owns a motorcycle taxi business. Her husband, Cresoncio D., works as a motorcycle driver to earn his living. They have five children between the ages of 9 and 23. One is married, and the other four are currently going to school. 

Dorotia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Dorotia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her increase her monthly income to PHP 36,000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her twelfth loan, she is borrowing PHP 49,500, which she intends to use to purchase more material to sew. Her goal is to continue to save and buy land for her family. Dorotia D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase material

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica, de 33 años, convive con su pareja María (34), tienen dos pequeños  hijos,  juntos habitan  una casa alquilada  ubicada en el distrito de Quimbiri.Ella es  una mujer muy alegre, carismática y empeñosa en sus labores desde que obtuvo la mayoría de edad se desempeño en diversos trabajos, acumulando sus ahorros decidió instalar una bodega, pues era  el negocio que siempre anhelo tener. En la actualidad  ofrece variedad de víveres al gusto del cliente, y su negocio esta situado en el distrito de Quimbiri donde y ya esta trabajando  10 años, esta muy satisfecha pues cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja. La venta de víveres le proporciona buenas ganancias por que gracias a ello pudo comprar un lote de terreno para poder brindar una mejor estadía a su familia. Entre sus  planes a futuro están el de  comprar un motocarro  y así cooperar con la ayuda de la carga  a sus buenos consumidores.Este es su octavo préstamo de Yessica con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es  una socia muy querida y colaborada.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprara más víveres para surtir mejor  su tienda y así abastecerse de productos, de esta manera espera continuar adelante.
texts.en: Yessica is 33 years old and lives with her partner, María, who is 34.  They have two young children and live in a rented house in the district of Quimbiri.  She is a very happy, charismatic, and hard-working woman and has been working in different jobs her whole adult life.  With her savings, she decided to open a grocery store, as it was the sort of business she always desired to have.  She currently offers a variety of grocery items to satisfy her customers.  Her business is in the district of Quimbiri and she has been working there for 10 years.  She is very happy there and can depend upon her partner's support.  Selling groceries has provided a good income and, thanks to this, she was able to buy a plot of land to help her family.  Her future plans include buying a car to be able to deliver to her good customers.  This is Yessica's eighth loan with MFP and she feels that the loan money will greatly help her business to grow.  In her bank she is a very well-liked woman who works well with others.  She will use the 1,000 nuevos soles to buy more groceries to better stock her store and to carry more products.  In this way, she hopes to continue to move forward.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her business

loans.name: Lino

texts.es:
El Señor Lino O. F. vive en concubinato y es padre de familia de dos hijos a los cuales apoya y ayuda en su educación junto a su pareja, vive en concubinato  más de 4 años, se dedica a la producción de naranja y mandarina, ingreso que les sirve solo para sobrevivir y tener una vida estable, El cliente desea incursionar en una nueva actividad la de moto taxista la  cual mejorara su calidad de vida, esta actividad es una de las más solicitadas en el medio donde vive el cliente porque la gente se moviliza a su trabajo y domicilio en este medio de transporte por la rapidez y facilidad que cuenta este servicio que está a su alcance.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta.
texts.en:
Lino O. F. is in a live in relationship and is the father of two children whom he supports and helps with their schooling.  He’s been in this relationship for more four years.  He also raises oranges and mandarin oranges.   This provides only enough income with which to survive and maintain a stable life.

He would like to begin a new business venture, that of driving a moto-taxi.  This will help him to improve their quality of life.   This is one of the businesses in highest demand in the area where he lives because people use this mode of transport to travel between work and home, because of its speed, ease, and accessibility.

This will be his first loan, through our institution, which he will use to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: Moto-taxi

loans.name: Lavinah

texts.en: Lavinah is a twenty-five-year-old married woman with two children, renting a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in hardware and the drug shop business for two years. She started with a small drug shop and as it expanded, she started a hardware business. Her hardship is debtors, price fluctuation and thieves. Her vision is a pharmacy and a well stocked hardware shop plus a wealthy family. Lavinah needs the money to buy medical drugs, cement, iron sheets and nails for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing drugs, cement, iron sheets and nails

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy school supplies, stuffed toys and notions.

loans.name: Joline Niptial

texts.fr:
Cliente de 27ans célibataire sans enfants. Après son baccalauréat  elle débute son commerce en vendant des sandales en 2009. 
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son stock en achetant des sandales femmes et pour enfants.
Son ambition est de devenir grossiste auprès des détaillants. 
Elle souhaite devenir responsable afin de prendre soin de sa vie quotidienne et de sa famille.
texts.en:
This client is 27 years old, single, and has no children. After taking her baccalaureate, she started her business of selling sandals in 2009.  This loan will allow her to increase her stock of sandals for women and children.
 Her ambition is to be a wholesaler to retailers.  
She hopes to be responsible for taking care of her daily needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's sandals

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.en:
Yuriy is married with a daughter, Yuliya. He is a farmer from Gladkovka. Yuriy grows early spring vegetables, i.e. tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes and cucumbers. He has been in farming for 10 years. Currently, his turnover capital amounts to 200,000 Grivnyas. 

Yuriy is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds, wood, plastic film and fertilizers for greenhouse maintenance. He is planning to grow 4,000 tomatoes and 1,000 cucumbers in his greenhouses and sunflowers on his land lots.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, wood and fertilizers for his greenhouses

loans.name: Morie's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Integrated Community Primary School based in Kenema city. This school was founded in September 1999 by D.P Musa-Koken to improve education in the district. The teachers of this institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone,  to seek a loan for 12,900,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, these teachers will be in a better position to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries will not let them do.

This will be the first loan that the teachers of the Integrated Community Primary School are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. Morie S. is the leader of this group.  Morie is 41 years old.  He was born in Gbatorma. Morie is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 18 years. He is married and has 2 children – 1 in primary school and the other in secondary school. Morie has requested a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to pay school fees for his children and to buy house building materials (cements, iron corrugated zincs, etc.).

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children and buy building materials for his house

loans.name: Fauste

texts.en: Fausta is 35 years old.  She has 6 children who are between 2 ½  and 16 years old. Her husband is a teacher.  Fausta owns a general store in which she sells books, pencils and milk. She is requesting a loan to buy more items for her store. With the profits generated, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: add inventory to her general store

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas Achieng O. is a young married lady. Her husband is a businessman and they have four children between the ages of eight and two, whom they hope to educate to university level. Her business is located at the busy Nyalenda market in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya that harbors Lake Victoria and is commonly referred to as the lake basin.

Dorcas runs a dressmaking and embroidery business and her major customers are the ladies. She has been operating this business for four years now and has managed to provide employment to two people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is lack of enough equipment for embroidery. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well

Dorcas is using this loan of 30,000 KES to purchase materials and a sewing machine to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and increase her sales. She describes herself as quiet, soft spoken and honest.

loans.use: to buy materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Kousar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her beauty salon business. She is a beautician and has good experience in her field. She is especially known for her bridal makeup.  With the loan, she will buy cosmetics and beauty products to improve her services for her clients and increase her revenue. She is confident that after the loan, her business will start giving her more profits and she will be able to support her family better. She is the mother of two children. Both of her children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her daughter is studying in class 3rd while her son is studying in class one. Her husband works in a factory for a low income. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for herself and her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kousar.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Lucia

texts.pt:
Natural de da Maputo. Foi a escola ate 5 classe, solteira e Mae de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 7 e 19 anos. 
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do salário que recebe consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adesma apartir de conversas com colegas de serviço e amigos e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
A Senhora vem a tornar se cliente da Hluvuku-Adesema no ano de 2007 ate o presente ano.  O primeiro financiamento no valor de 4.000,00Mts foi para compra de cimento para bater blocos, no segundo no valor de 6.600,00Mts tambėm  compra cimento, no terceiro emprestimo no valor de 8.000,00Mts para compra de pedra, no quarto emprestimo foi no valor 9.000,00Mts para compra de cimento para iniciar com as fundações  foi para compra de varoes e cimento, no quarto e Com o presente emprestimo de 20.000,00Mts pretende continuar com a sua actividade( compra de aros para janelas , chapas de zinco  e outros materiais).
Tenciona ver  a sua casa concluida e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Born and raised in the district of Matutuine, in Maputo province, Lucia attended school up to the 5th Grade. She is a single mother to 3 children aged between 7 and 19. Currently she lives and works in Ponta D'Ouro's tourist area in the district of Matutuine. With the salary that she receives, she manages to feed her family and save a little in her BCI bank account.
She learned about Hluvuku-Adesma from conversations with work colleagues and friends and decided to approach them for clarification on how to become a client, and to win financial backing for her projects.
The applicant became a Hluvuku-Adesema client on the 11th August 2007 and remains so today. Her first loan of 4,000Mts was used to buy cement for making cinder blocks. The second loan was for 6,600Mts which was also used to buy cement, her third loan was for 8,000Mts to buy stone, the fourth loan was to buy cement in order to begin laying foundations (to buy rods and cement). By combining the fourth loan and this one for 20,000Mts she plans to continue her current activities (to buy window arches, zinc sheeting and other materials).
She intends to finish building her house and she is relying on Hluvuku-Adsema for further financing.

loans.use: to buy window arches, zinc sheeting and other materials

loans.name: Ledis Maria

texts.es:
Leidis   llegó desplazada al municipio de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar con su hijo después de la muerte de su esposo,  e inicialmente buscó la forma de generar ingresos trabajando en oficios domésticos, con los que genero sus primeros ingresos;  posteriormente aprendió una de las actividades artesanales más famosas en la cultura de esta región y se dedicó a ella: El tejido de mochilas bolsos y otras artesanías , que vende a clientes  que pasan por este pueblo donde llegan muchos turistas y también envía a otros municipios y poblaciones cercanas. Con ello acompañada de su cónyuge, quien se dedica a las labores del campo, ha logrado apoyar la gestión de su hogar  en el que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de  11-8 y 5 años y  en la actualidad se encuentran  estudiando, para  que con el apoyo de Ledis logren un futuro exitoso, tal como ella lo sueña.
Ledis espera aumentar su capital de trabajo, para que la clientela de su negocio crezca  y por eso ha recurrido a su credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará  materiales para hacer bolsos y mochilas e hilo fino por conos  y accesorios para adornar las artesanías. En la actualidad  el negocio de Ledis tiene una rentabilidad sobre ventas del 13%  que espera aumentar con su trabajo persistente , para poder alcanzar las metas que cada dia se propone.
texts.en:
A displaced Ledis arrived in the municipality of San Jacinto in Bolivar department with her son after her husband's death. Initially, she sought to generate income working in domestic jobs, from which she earned her first income. Subsequently, she learned one of the most famous artisan activities in the culture of this region and dedicated herself to it: sewing back packs, purses, and other artisan goods, which she sold to customers who passed through this town where there are many tourists, and also, she sent her products out to other municipalities and nearby towns.

With this work, and with her new husband who works in the countryside, she has managed to increase household earnings. There are 3 children now, aged 11, 8, and 5, all of whom are students. With the help of Ledis, they will have a successful future, just as she has dreamed.

Ledis hopes to augment her working capital, so that her customer base will grow and, thus, she has turned to 'credikiva' for her 1st financing through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to buy materials to make purses, back packs, and fine thread for cones and accessories to adorn her artisan crafts. 

At present, Ledis' business enjoys a profit on sales of 13% which she hopes to increase through persistent work, to be able to reach the goals that she daily proposes.

loans.use: buy materials to make purses and back packs, and fine thread for making cones and accessories to adorn artisan crafts.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina earns a living through making and selling polvoron. Polvoron is powdered milk candy, made of flour, sugar, butter and powdered milk. It is a famous sweet all over the Philippines. Josefina makes a bucket of polvoron daily. She makes packs of 25 and 90 pieces that she sells to store owners.

Josefina is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP to purchase wrappers and raw ingredients such as flour and sugar for polvoron. She hopes for her business to be stable. She said that although her 24-year-old child is already married, she still wants to support her and someday her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase wrappers and raw ingredients such as flour and sugar for polvoron

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es:
María  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 1 hijo.  María estudió la secundaria.
Se dedica a la venta de comidas, también vende bebidas gaseosas, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis años.  Su préstamo inicial fue por la suma de  S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
