Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/ 1,200.00 nuevo soles, comprará treinta cajas de gaseosas de todo tamaño y sabores.  Nos cuenta que la venta de comida la realiza los días sábado  y martes.  Ella trabaja sola en el negocio.
Su sueño es seguir y mejorar el negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Medalla Milagrosa" village bank, located in the district of Pomata, province of Chucito, department of Puno. She is 49, single and has 1 child. Maria studied through high school.

She sells food as well as sodas. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 years. Her initial loan was for a sum of 300 nuevos soles, money that she invested in her business.

With this new loan of 1200 nuevos soles she will buy 30 boxes of sodas of all sizes and flavors. She tells us that she sells food on Saturdays and Tuesdays. She works alone in her business.

Her dream is to continue with her business and improve it so that she can increase her income. What she likes most about her village bank are the reunions, the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: to buy 30 boxes of sodas of all sizes and flavors.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is married and has four children. She has received senior high education. Emelia sells items like soft drinks, canned fish, canned tomatoes, different types of soaps and others at Takoradi in the western region of Ghana, which she has done for 15 years. She will use the loan to purchase canned fish, soaps and other items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emelia plans to plough back the profit.

loans.use: to purchase canned fish, soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: Experia

texts.en:
Experia is 59 years old and a widow with 8 children.

Experia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Experia has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retailing business for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and a general store.

Experia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: El Castillo Group

texts.es:
El grupo está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Nelly quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla, yoltamal y cosa de horno desde hace 10 años en Piedra Menuda. Ella es casada y tiene dos niños por los cuales labora arduamente.
María con el crédito comprara materia prima maíz, queso, leña…etc. para seguir aumentando su negocio. 
Las otras integrantes Norma Alicia se dedica a la venta de ropa (pantalones, faldas, camisas…etc.) y Marvely Marisol vende ropa de todo tipo de mujeres, hombre y de niños.
texts.en:
The group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising people.

María Nelly is one of them.  She sells tortillas, yoltamal (Nicaraguan corn tamales), and things from the oven.  She has been doing this for ten years in Piedra Menuda.  She is married, and she has two children for whom she works arduously.

María will use the loan to buy raw materials like corn, cheese, and firewood, etc. in order to continue expanding her business.

Norma Alicia, also a member of the group, sells clothes (pants, skirts, and t-shirts, etc.).

Marvely Marisol, another group member, sells all types of clothing for women, men, and children.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Villa De Oro (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Villa De Oro que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les va a servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos van a mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 22 y 14 años de edad, los dos estudian en universidad y colegio.

Ella en su casa junto a su esposo tienen un negocio en el cual venden carne, legumbres y frutas, nos cuenta que ellos son de Santa Ana pero hace 5 años vinieron a esta linda y gran ciudad en la cual decidieron seguir con el negocio que tenían en su ciudad natal. Su esposo se desplaza al campo a comprar chanchos y vacas, luego los faena en su casa y ahí mismo vende la carne y otros productos que salen de estos animalitos, además de frutas y legumbres que también compra en el campo. Llevan más de 20 años dedicados a esta actividad y les va muy bien ya que venden un producto fresco y eso les gusta a sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar chanchos, frutas y legumbres.
 
Su sueño  tener una casa  de cemento y bien construida ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
The Villa de Oro communal bank meets twice a month in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its artisan work, which is recognized nationally and internationally. It is the birthplace of the famous Panama hat. 

This is a group of people who decided to unite and form this communal bank that will help them a great deal, since they are going to improve their small businesses with the loans. They dedicate themselves to a variety of activities such as agriculture, general business, and services, among others. 

In this place we meet María, 39 years old. She is married, and she and her husband have two children, 14 and 22 years old. Both are students in high school and college. 

She and her husband have a business in their home selling meat, vegetables, and fruit. She tells us that they are from Santa Ana, but five years ago they came to this beautiful, great city, in which they decided to continue with the business they had in their native city. Her husband travels to the country to buy pigs and cows, which he slaughters at home. From their home he sells the meat and other products from these animals, as well as fruits and vegetables that he also buys in the country. They have been doing this work for more than 20 years, and it is going very well for them, since their products are fresh, and their customers like that. 

This loan is to buy pigs, fruits, and vegetables. 

Her dream is to have a well-constructed cement house, since the one she has is made of cane.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, and pigs

loans.name: Nipashe B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya!  Fred is the facilitator of the Nipashe B group. Fred and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. The members of Nipashe B group are all maize farmers, the most common staple crop in Western Kenya.

Fred takes care of six children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and high quality seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Fred had an excellent maize yield harvesting 17 bags on 1 an acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Fred was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Fred will invest in raising livestock and savings for the future.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

In 2012, the members of Nipashe B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Picture:
In the picture above, Fred is pictured with his group. Their field officer Tiberius is on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Cristian De Jesús

texts.es:
Este cliente labora para un centro turístico de san Rafael del sur, desempeñándose en el cargo de electricista, casado y padre de cuatro hijos, solicita crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
Espera seguir siendo beneficiado con estos programas de apoyo a personas que como nosotros dependen del salario, este y todos sus créditos los destina a mejorar la vivienda de su gran y hermosa familia.
texts.en:
This client works as an electrician for a San Rafael del Sur tourist center.  He is married and has four children.

He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to improve his family’s standard of living.

He hopes to continue to benefit from these programs that support people like us who are dependent upon wages.  This loan and all his loans are destined to improve his great and beautiful family’s house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like corrugated metal sheeting and wood and to pay for the labor costs.

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en:
Uzma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver and provides transport facilities to the passengers. With the loan, he will repair the engine of his rickshaw because it is creating problems for driving. 

Uzma is a working lady. She works in people's houses doing sweeping and cleaning work. The income she earns helps her pay the school fees for her children. She has four children and three of them are studying. She is a very caring and supportive lady who performs her household duties very well along with her work. 

Uzma is hopeful that after repairing his rickshaw, her husband will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers and earn better profits.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: La Vida Plena (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Vida Plena está formado por 6 socias y 2 socios quienes son personas amables, gentiles y emprendedoras, que laboran a diario en sus diferentes actividades económicas las que les permiten salir adelante con sus familias. Viven por los alrededores del cantón Paute (Cuenca), lugar que es privilegiado  por su clima templado,  sus tierras son propicias para la floricultura y cultivo de varias frutas, este lugar tiene una gran gastronomía típica, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora María Lourdes, vive por la comunidad de Uzhupud (Cuenca), tiene 38 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 19, 18, 13 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija en una escuelita del sector.

Doña María Lourdes se dedica la agricultura, cultivando tierras que no son de su propiedad, este trabajo lo realiza de lunes a sábados todo el día. También se dedica a la cría y venta de cuyes en su casa.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y gallinas.
 
Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Vida Plena is made up of 6 female members and 2 male members who are nice, kind, and enterprising people. They work every day performing their different economic activities which allow them to get ahead with their families. They live in the outskirts of the canton Paute (Cuenca), a privileged place due to its mild climate. Its land is favorable for flower growing and growing various fruits. This place has a large, traditional gastronomy and its people maintain their culture and traditions in their villages.

One of this group's members is María Lourdes. She lives in the community of Uzhupud (Cuenca), is 38 years old, and is a single mother of 4 children of the ages 19, 18, 13, and 11. Her two oldest sons work and help her financially, her third son studies in secondary school, and her youngest daughter studies in a small school in the area.

Mrs. María Lourdes makes a living as a farmer, farming lands owned by others. She performs this job from Monday to Saturday all day. She also makes a living raising and selling guinea pigs in her home.

This is her first loan with the bank and she will invest it in the purchase of guinea pigs and chicken.

Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chicken.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif is a 55-year-old man who is making keys. He has 20 years of experience. He is married and has four children. Akif has a small shop where he makes keys and locks, which are handmade and very popular among local people. His monthly income is about 200 AZN. His son works with him. He applied for 1,200 AZN in order to improve working conditions and purchase material to make keys. Akif has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase material and improve work conditions.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de San Lorenzo se reunieron 12 mujeres, quienes vieron en el programa de la fundación paraguaya una oportunidad de progreso y de ayuda. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, solidarias y muy humildes, quienes trabajan duro para poder ayudar a sus familias a salir adelante.
Una de ellas es la señora Mariela, quien por medio de la venta de ropas puede ayudar a su familia. Ella cuenta que este trabajo la ha ayudado a salir adelante y cubrir los gastos de la casa. Comenta que gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que vende, ha logrado formarse una clientela que siempre dejan de ella las prendas que vende.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar shorts, camisillas, remeras, y otras prendas de verano, pues se acerca la época de calor y quiere estar preparada para ofrecerle a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of San Lorenzo, 12 women got together who saw the Fundación Paraguaya program as an opportunity for progress and help. They are hard working, supportive and very humble women. They work hard to be able to help their families and get ahead. 

One of them is Mariela, who is able to help her family by selling clothes. She remarks that this job has helped her get ahead and cover the household expenses. She says that thanks to the good quality of the products she sells, she has established a clientele that always goes to her for the clothes she sells.  

She is asking for the loan to buy shorts, tank tops, t-shorts and other summer clothing. Warm weather is coming and she wants to be ready to offer these clothes to her customers.

loans.use: to buy shorts, tank tops, t-shorts, and other summer clothing.

loans.name: Maria Eloisa

texts.es: La señora María Eloisa a sus 47 años de edad es madre de una hija de 10 años, se dedica a la venta de mercancía tal como ropa de niño, dama y caballero. Este negocio surge de la necesidad de aumentar sus ingresos, esto debido a que su hija se encuentra en situación de discapacidad cognitiva y su madre esta muy enferma, la señora María Eloisa debe estar al cuidado de ellas dos. Las señora María Eloisa desea comprar surtido con el cual pueda suplir la demanda por temporada de fin de año. Lo anterior le permitirá a la señora María Eloisa incrementar sus ingresos y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su madre e hija. La señora María Eloisa sueña con tener su propio almacén y ver con mejor estado de salud a su madre e hija.
texts.en:
María Eloisa is 47 years old and has a 10-year-old daughter.  Her business is selling merchandise such as men's, women's and children's clothing.  This business came about as she needed to increase her income because her daughter has a cognitive disability and her mother is very sick.  María Eloisa must care for the two of them.

María Eloisa would like to buy stock so that she can meet her end-of-year demand.  Her previous loan allowed her to increase her income and thereby improve her mother and daughter's quality of life.  María Eloisa dreams of owning her own store and seeing her mother and daughter in better health.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's and children's clothing

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
El señor José Raúl y su esposa son los que atiende juntos el negocio de venta de ropa en diferentes partes de la ciudad; comentan que con el préstamo va a invertir en comprar más ropa nueva de temporada de invierno y así tener más variedad de mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
Don José Raúl además de atender su negocio los fines de semana, también tiene un empleo como intendente (limpieza) de una escuela. Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de ellos dos y tener un prestimonio seguro cuando ya estén viejos ya que sus hijos están casados y tiene sus propias familias.
texts.en: José Raúl and his wife, together, tend to their clothing business in different parts of the city. They will use the loan to invest in the purchase of more new clothing for winter. This way, they will have more variety to offer their customers. In addition to running the store, José Raúl works as a school janitor on the weekends. They wish to improve the quality of their life and to have a secure living when they are older and their children are married and have their own families.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for his business selling used and new clothing.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante en su trabajo por sus hijos. Rosa vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en Otavalo, Provincia de Imbabura. Rosa tiene una tienda de víveres.

Empezó con este negocio hace un año, no tiene mucha variedad de productos lo que ocaciona que no tenga muchos clientes lo que genera bajas utilidades económicas, es por eso que realiza su primer crédito en Fodemi porque va a invertir en la compra de víveres para abastecer su negocio ya que por temporada de diciembre obtiene más ventas e ingresos económicos que le ayudarán a mejorar la calidad de vida.

El sueño de Rosa es poder tener su propio local y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Rosa is a woman that likes to advance in her work for her children. She lives with her husband and their 5 children in Otavalo, Imbabura Province. Rosa has a grocery store. 

She started the business a year ago. She does not have a lot of variety in her products, which causes her to have fewer customers and less profit. This is why she is taking out her first loan with FEDEMI. She is going to invest it in the purchase of groceries to stock her store. In the December season, she has better sales and income, which will help her improve her quality of life. 

Rosa’s dream is to have her own location and for her children to continue studying.

loans.use: stock her store with groceries since sales increase in December

loans.name: Banco Comunal Arca De Noe Group

texts.es: El Banco Arca de Noé está conformado por 8 integrantes en el cual son mujeres emprendedoras que se unieron para salir adelante y apoyarse entre ellas, este no es el primer crédito de este grupo, ya que anteriormente habías solicitado crédito y fueron excelente cliente manteniendo su record crediticio muy bueno. Josefa tiene 50 años, ya sus hijos están grande y la ayudan económicamente, su actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de tortilla se levanta muy temprano para trabajar y poder servirle a sus clientes un buen servicio. Josefa está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra  de maíz, comal, cal, bolsas entre otros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Arca de Noé” (Noah’s Ark) consists of eight members. These enterprising women have joined together so that they can move forward and support one another. This is not the first loan they have received as a group since they have requested previous loans and have demonstrated that they are excellent clients by maintaining very good credit records.

Josefa is 50 years old. Her children are already grown and help her financially. Josefa sells tortillas and must wake up very early so that she can work and provide her customers with good service. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business by purchasing corn, a griddle, lime, bags, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy corn, a griddle, lime, bags, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
Ana is very dedicated to her family. She has 3 small children and every day she works very hard for them. She began her own business 9 years ago with a counter, some shelves and a little merchandise of groceries. Ana wants to offer to her children a good education and a better quality of life. For that reason she needs to increase the capacity of her business to have a larger variety of products that allows her to have greater sales and incomes.

Ana requires a loan of $475 USD to purchase merchandise and in that way increase her capacity of products to sell. She hopes that the loan increases her income and could pay for a better education to her children and cover her basic necessities as well. In a term of 6 months Ana plans to return the loan, she and her family thank your support and affection.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Ana es una persona muy entregada a su familia, tiene 3 hijos pequeños por los que todos los días trabaja muy duro y con mucho amor. Ella inicio su propio negocio hace 9 años con un mostrador, unos cuantos anaqueles y poca mercancía de abarrotes. La sra. Ana quiere ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida por lo que ahora necesita aumentar la capacidad de su negocio para tener una mayor variedad de productos que le permita tener mayores ventas e ingresos.

Ana requiere de $475 USD para comprar mercancía y de esta manera aumentar su capacidad de productos para vender. Ella espera que con este préstamo aumente sus ingresos para pagar una mejor educación a sus hijos y cubrir sus necesidades básicas. En un término de 6 meses Ana planea regresar el préstamo, ella y su familia agradecen tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Denje

texts.en: I am a single woman, mother of  6. I sell second-hand clothes. This loan will improve my life  because I’ll be able to meet the basic needs of my children and pay their school fees.

loans.use: I will use the loan to expand my business.

loans.name: Mohammad Haraf

texts.en: M. Haraf lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and uneducated. He opened a retail shop and he needs money to purchase inventory. He wants to take an individual loan to buy milk, Pepsi Cola, powder, boxes of chocolates and packets of sweets. He is truing to be a great business dealer to make bright future for himself. He is happy now and he would like to thank AFSG for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Eunice

texts.fr: Madame Eunice N. est mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle est âgée de 42 ans. Eunice vend du savon et des habits pour femme devant sa concession. Son commerce marche assez bien, mais elle veut augmenter la quantité des marchandises à vendre. C’est pourquoi, elle sollicite un prêt de $225. Elle est sure qu’avec ce prêt, elle pourra améliorer son niveau de vie et celle de sa famille. Puisqu’elle aura plus de marchandises à vendre.

loans.use: Achat des habits pour femmes te du savon à la frontière entre le Tchad et le Cameroun pour les revendre à N'Djaména

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with one grown son. She lives in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, Ukraine. Galina is a small entrepreneur who sells clothing, footwear and household items in one of the local markets in her town. Her venture has provided a good source of income for the whole family. Galina has been in this business for 13 years. Her business growth has been characterized by persevering work and consistent improvement and currently, her gross income is about $4,000.

Galina would like to get a loan of $1000 to increase the range of inventory for sale in her kiosk and boost her sales. She believes that new inventory will attract more potential customers which would automatically increase her profit. Galina is planning to use generated profits to help her son who is facing some economic problems at the moment. We think Galina’s enterprising mindset and natural determination will help her repay this loan on time just as she has repaid each of her 12 previous loans with Nadiya Ukraine.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Evelyn Amparo

texts.en:
Evelyn owns one of the larger clothing and shoe shops in her community. She offers her neighbors the latest fashions in new and used clothes and shoes, and at reasonable prices. She has participated in group-level loans before, and is asking for this individual loan now so that she can really improve and advance her store.

She plans to use the money to buy a wider range of women’s clothing, particularly tank tops, jeans, and skirts. She says that this is the perfect time for her to take out this loan because in November, when the tourism industry picks up, people have more money to spend and will want to buy more of her clothes. By offering a better selection, she knows she will be able to capitalize on this opportunity.

Her goal is to continue expanding and improving her business every day, and to more importantly, always ensure that her two children, ages 7 and 9 years old, will always be able to attend a good school.

Evelyn is very grateful to everyone who is helping her to achieve her dreams with this loan.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew A. is a commercial driver; he has two taxis which he works with. He is married with four children ages 15, 13, 10 and 6. His wife is a trader who deals in food supplies. She is helping with the family finances. One of his taxis is parked at the garage because there is a problem with the engine. He also has to do some body work on the car.

He is asking for $1,200 to enable him buy a new engine and perform other maintenance work to put the vehicle back on the road.

loans.use: Buy a new engine and perform other maintenance work

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.ru:
Shamsiya B. is 43 years old, she has secondary education, married and has 11 children. Shamsiya has been breeding and selling livestock for the past 10 years. She plans to use her loan to buy several heads of livestock for breeding and sales. Because of such a large family, she plans to use the profits from sales to pay off her loan and the rest to support her family.

Shamsiya plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Боймонова Шамсия, возраст – 43 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 11-ть детей. Шамсия в течение 10 лет занимается разведением и продажей мелкого рогатого скота. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести несколько голов мелкого рогатого скота для их откормки и продажи. Так как у нее семья большая, получаемую прибыль от продажи скота она использует для погашения кредита и оказание помощи в содержание семьи.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Breeding and sales of livestock

loans.name: Mammad

texts.en: Mammad is a single man who lives in Khachmaz region. He was born in 1985. Mammad has worked as a dentist for a year and he now needs a loan of $725 to buy necessary medicines and  instruments for his profession.

loans.use: to buy medicines and  instruments necessary for the dental profession

loans.name: Ndeeba North A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Annet N.. She is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling. Annet is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a civil servant. She has 4 children ranging from age 14 to 19 and her children go to school. Each week, Annet makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy food warmers.

Annet is joined in her small group by Jennifer N., Perepetwa N., Asia K., and Beatrice M.. Jennifer N. has a business selling fish and wants to add to her business. Perepetwa N. is currently operating a business producing and selling rice and wants a loan to invest in her business. Asia K. operates a business selling soft drinks and wants to purchase a fridge. Beatrice M. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth material.

loans.use: To add to charcoal business

loans.name: Mutiah

texts.id:
Mutiah is married to a construction worker who has uncertain income. Sometimes, her husband can lay idle for some time. Mutiah started a small food kiosk that sells foods that she made herself. She starts her day at 5 am to purchase ingredient at the market with the help of her husband. After that she starts cooking, again with the help of her husband to prepare spices. Mutiah has a 9 month old daughter. This business is barely enough to cover daily living expenses with $80 profit per week. Mutiah hopes that DINARI loan can help her increase her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Mempunyai seorang suami sebagai pekerja buruh bangunan membuat Mutiah tidak tinggal diam, karena suaminya bisa bekerja jika ada proyek yang sedang berlangsung dan jika proyek selesai maka suaminya harus menunggu untuk proyek yang berikutnya. Mutiah membuat warung makan yang sangat sederhana dengan menjual makanan-makanan yang diolahnya sendiri. Mulai dari pukul 05.00 pagi Mutiah belanja kepasar yang diantar oleh suaminya, begitu juga dengan memasak makanan tersebut suaminya dengan setia membantu Mutiah dalam mempersiapkan bumbu-bumbunya. Mutiah mempunyai seorang anak perempuan yang masih sangat kecil dengan usia 9 bulan. Usaha yang dijalaninya mampu mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya dengan keuntungan 750.000 rupiah/minggu. Mutiah berharap dengan modal yang diberikan oleh DINARI mampu meningkatkan usahanya untuk lebih maju lagi.

loans.use: Purchase Ingredients

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
We want to finish the construction of our house. We don’t have the slab or the finishings, but for now I would like more than anything to pour the slab. We don’t have enough money to install the slab, and for that reason we are requesting a loan of $1,000 for the installation. This way the house will be more constructed.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Queremos terminar la construcción de la casa. Nos esta haciendo falta la losa y los acabados, por el momento quisiera mas que nada ponerle la losa. Pero no he tenido suficiente capital para ponerla es por eso que. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls. Para la colocación de la losa y así tener un poco más construido en la casa.

loans.use: Installation of slab for home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing to sell in her community.

loans.name: Tiaina

texts.en:
Tiaina V., age 50, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in the farming business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week.

Tiaina has 1 previous loan from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~$145 USD). SPBD loans are Tiaina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to renovate her house.

Tiaina has 7 children, five of whom attend the village school. Her husband is a fisherman who fishes three times a week, especially on weekends.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is separated, is 57, and has 3 children. She sells chicken in a stall at the 12 de abril market, located in Ayacucho center. She has been doing this for several years.

On Saturdays and Sundays, she sells typical food in a small San Juan Bautista district marketplace. Her daughter helps her with the job. She also sells food at fair periods, for example, in the Saint Week in a popular grove.

Isabel belongs to the Morenita Huamanga Village Bank. She needs a 2000 soles loan to help her to buy a car so that her son can work as a taxi driver in the city.

She dreams about having a store at home, expanding her business, and providing her children with everything they need.

loans.use: to help her to buy a car that her son can drive as a taxi

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina C. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has never received schooling. Faustina sells foodstuffs in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2008. Faustina uses her income to pay for her children's education. Faustina will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to acquire a piece of land to gradually build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Magdaleno

texts.es:
Magdaleno inició el negocio ya que el  y su esposa siempre han sido comerciantes  primero tenían una  tienda de abarrotes y después una frutería, actualmente establecieron una  mercería y papelería la cual la inicio desde aproximadamente 6 años.

El inicio un préstamo por US $925 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir su papelería y además de remodelar un poco el negocio.
texts.en:
Magdaleno began his business because he and his wife have always been merchants. First, they had a grocery store and, after that, a fruit store. At present, they have established a haberdashery and stationery store, which was started about 6 years ago. He is requesting a loan for $925, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to supply his stationery store and also to remodel his business a little.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Choem

texts.en: Mrs. Choem S. is a farmer in Trapeang Krasang Village in the Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Khut Mork, is a construction worker who earns a small income to help support his family. In spite of their dual income, the couple still live in poor conditions and in an old house. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Choem S. is requesting a loan to buy timbers to build a new home. Mrs. Choem S. is 32 years old and the mother of two children one of whom is attending the local school and the other child is 4 years old. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a new home.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda, 44, who hails from Clarin, Misamis Occidental is married to Lauro N., who is a typical farmer.  During the first year of their marriage, Melinda had a miscarriage which left her unable to have children anymore. She then just contented herself looking after the house and help her husband in his farming chores.To while away her time she decided to join PMPC and got deeply involved in its community activities. She was even able to organize a group of women in her village to develop their entrepreneurial capacities. 

After undergoing a series of training conducted by PMPC on how to become an entrepreneur and manage household finances, she then renovated the frontage of her house and converted it into a small retail shop. She was able to do this using a start-up loan of PHP 2,000 from PMPC. Her little business gradually grew and after two years she was able to increase her working capital to PHP 20,000. She is now able to earn an income of her own and not depend so much on the meager income from the farm of her husband. While the couple is childless, Melinda has focused her attention on leading the group of women entrepreneurs she organized in her village and help them succeed in their ventures.

Records of PMPC would show that for 15 loan cycles, Melinda has no record of default, and she was able to maintain her Member In Good Standing status. Her husband also helps her business when he is not on the farm.  

Her knowledge about how to handle customers properly helped her gain additional regular clients and increase the demand for her goods. Now she is applying for a loan worth PHP 20,000 for the purchase of additional stocks to further expand her retail shop.

The couple’s future plan is to increase their business assets so that they can build a concrete sari-sari store to protect their stocks. They also have plans to renovate their house, as it is only made of light materials.

loans.use: Purchase additional stocks for her retail shop

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Madame  Christine T. est née le 05 Novembre 1966 à Aného. Mère de trois (3) enfants, elle vit seule avec ses enfants car son mari l’a abandonnée. Son activité consiste à aller de village en village et parcourir la plage de la ville d’Aného pour acheter des crevettes, crabes et poissons qu’elle fait fumer pour revendre à la frontière Togo - Bénin où elle a beaucoup de clientèle. Dynamique et dévouée, Madame T. n’a plus de moyens financiers pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un financement pour acheter plus de crevettes, crabes et poissons. Ceci lui évitera des ruptures de stock et lui permettra d’acquérir d’autres marchés en vue d’accroître ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs. Christine T. was born November 5, 1966, in Aného. A mother of 3, she lives alone with her children, as her husband left her. Her business consists of going from village to village covering the beach in the city of Aného to buy shrimp, crab, and fish, which she smokes to sell at the Togo-Bénin border, where she has a lot of customers. Energetic and devoted, Mrs. T. has no more financial means to satisfy her clientele. She seeks a loan to buy more shrimp, crab, and fish. This will prevent her from running out of stock and will allow her to gain other markets in order to increase her revenues.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To smoke and sell fish, shrimp, and crab

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 44 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace 12 años viene dedicándose al comercio de diversos artículos según la temporada, por ejemplo; por  época escolar, vende útiles de escritorio; en el día de la madre, rosas y regalos; en fiestas patrias, banderas y escarapelas y ahora por tiempo navideño vende panteones, los cuales ofrece de casa en casa a sus clientes de confianza, vende al crédito, de esta manera obtiene los recursos necesarios para seguir adelante. Luisa trabaja diariamente caminando, de preferencia en las mañanas para lograr vender sus productos y por las tardes generalmente se queda a  cuidar a sus hijos en casa, adicionalmente tiene una granja de cerdos en su casa, por los que vela por su alimentación y después de cada cierto tiempo los vende y tiene un ingreso económico extra. Es la quinta vez que Luisa solicita un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, además, participa activamente en su banco comunal, siendo parte de la junta directiva. En dinero requerido se usará en la compra de panetones (postre tradicional en fin de año), valorizados en 80 soles la caja  de 8 panetones, comprara 10 cajas, y lo que resta será su capital para sus próximos productos.
texts.en:
Luisa is 44 years old and lives with her two children in her own home. For the past 12 years she has sold seasonal articles such as: during the school year, school supplies; for Mother's day, roses and gifts; for national holidays, flags and rosettes; and now during the Christmas season she sell nativity scenes from door to door. She sells on credit to trustworthy customers, and thus makes enough money to continue. Louisa works every day walking around. She prefers selling her goods in the morning and usually cares for her children at home in the afternoon. She also raises pigs at home, feeding them then selling them and thus making additional income. This is Luisa's fifth loan with MFP and she has shown herself to be punctual in her payments. She is also an active participant of her community bank, as she is on the board of the community bank. She will use the loan monies to buy panettones (traditional year-end desserts), each case of 8 panettones costs 80 soles. She will buy 10 cases. The remainder of the loan amount will be saved for capital for future merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy panettones for the season

loans.name: Ana Ethel

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Ana Ethel J. se dedica arduamente a su negocio de venta de ropa el cual ella comercializa en su propio tramo ofreciendo todo tipo de ropa de las diferentes marcas y para todo tamaño.

Ella es una dama que con sus múltiples esfuerzos ha logrado surtir su negocio de venta de ropa brindando mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. La razón por la cual ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la ropa ya que al irse agotando el inventario requiere de dicha compra ya que por esto lleva a cabo su actividad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Ethel J. works vigorously at her clothing business in the Central Market in the city of Chinandega. This is her own business where she offers all kinds of clothing of various brands and in all sizes. With great effort she has managed to run her clothes selling business and provide better living conditions for her family. She is seeking help from Ceprodel for a loan to buy clothing as her inventory has diminished and she needs to buy clothing inventory, as this is how she makes her living.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is a 19-year-old single man, living in in A. Msharafieh in the Beirut suburbs. He is an employee in a ventilation and air conditioning company in addition to home-based tailoring. Today he wants to borrow US$ 1,000 in order to buy additionA. tools and equipment for the tailoring business.

loans.use: Buy additional tools and equipment for his tailoring

loans.name: Rosa Ana

texts.es: La Señora Rosa Ana M. Tapia su edad es de 51 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Rosa no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Rosa es una librería. Hace más de cinco años que se dedica a este negocio. Dona Rosa inicio por la necesidad de no poseer un trabajo por que no poseía una manera de obtener una fuente de ingresos y con esto podría mantenerse. Los propósitos de Doña Rosa son de ampliar más su librería y así ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo ya que así podrá comprar lápices, borradores, marcadores y cuadernos. El deseo de Doña Rosa es que tengamos estabilidad económica ya que cada día los precios de los productos básicos varían. La cantidad que solicita es de C$6.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Ana M. Tapia is 51 years old and is single. Doña Rosa does not have children. She has a bookstore and has been working at this for more than five years. She started her business out of necessity as she had no work and no source of income and needed to support herself. Doña Rosa´s goals are to expand her store and offer a greater variety of products to her customers. This loan will be for working capital so she can buy pencils, erasers, markers and notebooks. Doña Rosa´s wish is for economic stability as every day prices for basic goods fluctuate. The amount she requests is for C$6,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica la señora Flor M. se dedica a su actividad ganadera por medio de la crianza de animales el cual se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace varios años.

El motive por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito ya que le urge la construcción de un corral para meter los animales ya que actualmente atraviesa el problema de que no posee un corral en buenas condiciones y esto implica que los animales se pierdan fácilmente. Con el crédito se beneficia grandemente junto con su familia.
texts.en:
For many years, Flor M. has worked as a rancher, raising animals in the community of Telica.

She has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to construct a corral for her animals, which she urgently needs. She does not currently have a corral in good condition, and this is means that her animals are easily lost.

Her family will greatly benefit from the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a corral for cattle

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 24-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Hassan has owned a barbershop for eight years. He requested a loan of 1330 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new seat and a washbasin. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan. 
Hassan is special in his work because he does it well and is aware of new haircuts. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Hassan decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new seat and a washbasin.

loans.name: Jemilat

texts.en:
Jemilat is 42 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions and drinks.

She is requesting a loan of N40,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Mrs. Ana P. is 48 years old and is married to Isidoro Marecos, who is a construction worker who earns a good living. They have a younger son and all live in the city of Pilar, in the neighborhood of Convai Norte. They live in their own house, where they have all the comforts of home.

Ana has been working in her tailoring business for more than ten years, and has all of the necessary resources for the development of her business – a large salon where she can make her garments.

She applied for credit to be able to buy fabric for her tailor shop, more specifially to make school uniforms. She is very thankful for the support she receives from the Paraguay Foundation. She plans to take advantage of the opportunity to grow her business, as this is the third loan she has received from the Foundation.

loans.use: To buy fabric for her tailor shop

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.en:
Edmundo T., from the village of Fatima Lingating, Baungon, is a 40-year-old married father of one infant-aged child. To make a living, Edmundo owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main source of income is derived from selling variety products such as canned goods, coffee, and bread in their village. Edmundo has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Edmundo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, he is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his second from HSPFI, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre (Friends Forever) Group

texts.es:
La asociación  “amigas por Siempre” está formada por catorce integrantes, nace aproximadamente hace tres años, Marina C. es una de las mas antiguas, cuenta que el grupo se conformo  invitando a vecinas y conocidas de la zona Los Andes, ella recuerda que a pesar que las socias  vivían cerca la misma zona no tenían mucho trato social, pero a medida que asistieron a las reuniones lograron formar un grupo muy unido y alegre.
Este grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades como ser: venta de verduras, zapatos, adornos, pero la actividad principal de este grupo esta basado en la ropa, realizan confecciones de polleras, mandiles de cocina, pantalones, blusas, también realizan tejidos de mantas y chompas.Luego comercializan sus productos en puestos y tiendas de la ciudad. Desean aumentar su produccion, para esto necesitan capital para comprar materia prima, tienen la seguridad de obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The "Friends Forever" Association has fourteen members, and it was founded approximately three years ago. Marina C. is one of the first members. She was there when the group was founded by inviting neighbors and acquaintances from the Los Andes zone. She remembers that in spite of the fact that the members lived close to the same area, they didn't have very much social contact. However, through attendance at their group meetings, they have become a very united and happy group. The group members work at different activities, including the sale of vegetables, shoes, and decorations. However, the main activity of the group is based on clothing. They make skirts, kitchen aprons, pants, and blouses. They also weave blankets and sweaters. Then, they sell their products in stands and stores in the city. They want to expand their production, and for this they need capital to purchase raw material so they will have the certainty of earning better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Maynor Agustin

texts.es: El señor Maynor A. tiene 26 años, casado su esposa ama de casa, tiene un hijo de dos años, vive en la comunidad de Villa del Carmen del municipio de Managua, los planes a acorto plazo es las mejoras a su casa y a largo plazo un mejor trabajo con mayores prestaciones. Trabaja en la alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo de guardia de seguridad desde hace seis meses, antes trabajaba en diferentes proyectos como obrero. El ha encontrado muchas dificultades para la terminación de su vivienda por financiamiento. Gracias Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, zinc. Obteniendo protección y seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Maynor A. is 26 and married. His wife is a housewife. They have a two year old son. They live in the Villa del Carmen community of the Managua municipality. His short-term plan is to make improvements to their house. His long-term plan is to get better work with larger loans. He works in the mayor’s office in Villa del Carmen. He has been a security guard there for six months. He previously worked on different projects as a laborer. He has encountered several financial difficulties in finishing his house. Thanks to Afodenic, he will be able to buy construction materials like cement, iron, and zinc. That way he will obtain protection and safety for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material

loans.name: Grenly

texts.en: Grenly Y. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 52 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Grenly owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Grenly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Grenly is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Victor F. tiene una vagoneta, que hace trabajar como taxi libre con un conductor asalariado. Victor una persona joven, además, es chofer hace siete años y trabaja en el Sindicato de Minibuses Señor de Mayo. Su esposa es la señora Epifania Callisaya que vende salchipapas y hamburguesas en la Av. 31 de Octubre. Ellos tienen 2 hijos pequeños que estan en la escuela primaria. La familia F. vive en zona San Antonio. Uno de los sueños de Victor y Epifania es ver que un día sus hijos sean profesionales. Ellos son unos padres muy responsables y dedicados con su familia. El préstamo que solicita Victor es para realizar un cambio de Gasolina a Gas Natural de su automovil.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor F. has a van which he uses in his work as a salaried taxi driver. Victor is young but has already worked as a driver for seven years, and is currently a member of the Señor de Mayo Minibus Union. His wife, Mrs. Epifania Callisaya, sells hamburgers, sausages, and French fries on la Avenida 31 de Octubre. They have two small children in primary school and live in San Antonio. One of Victor's and Epifania's dreams is to see their children become educated professionals. They are very responsible parents and dedicated to their family. Victor is asking for a loan to convert his van to run on natural gas rather than gasoline.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Conversion of van to run on natural gas rather than gasoline.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza S. de 51 años de edad reside en Colon municipio del departamento de La Libertad. María vive con su esposo y su hija Adriana de 19 años. María posee su negocio donde vende  tortillas, pupusas y pasteles; todo esto fabricado desde su casa, la cual se encuentra ubicada en calle principal, permitiéndole a María ser  fácilmente vista por muchas personas, aunque por los años en el negocio, ya posee una clientela estable. El crédito que solicita María, es para compra de insumos, que le permitan aumentar su producción de alimentos .
texts.en:
María Esperanza S. is 51 years old and resides in the municipal of Colon in the department of La Libertad. María lives with her husband and her daughter Adriana who is 19 years old. María has a business where she sells tortillas, pupusas (corn biscuits), and cakes. Everything is made from her house, which is located on the main street, allowing María to be easily seen by many people. Although she has only been in the business for some years, she already has a stable clientele. The loan that María is asking for is to buy consumables that will allow her to increase her food production.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of consumables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying a mill

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna L. is from the village of P-3, Valencia City. She is 37 years old. Myrna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling products like gravestone to customers. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials to manufacture gravestones. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to manufacture gravestones

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La señora Rosalina G. se ha destacado en el municipio de El Sauce por elaborar deliciosas tortillas las que son ofrecidas en su establecimiento donde a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana le visitan sus clientes para comprarlas.

La señora Rosalina elabora y vende tortillas los tres tiempos de comida a los pobladores del barrio La estación del municipio de El Sauce y el crédito fue solicitado para la compra de leña, maíz, cal, los cuales son los insumos indispensables para la elaboración de las tortillas. Es por esto que ella espera en que su crédito será proporcionado por la institución y de esta manera mejorará la condición de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalina G. has distinguished herself in the town of El Sauce by elaborating delicious tortillas. She sells them from her establishment, where beginning in the early hours of the morning customers come to purchase them. Rosalina makes and sells the tortillas before all three meal times to the people of the neighborhood "La estación" of El Sauce. The loan funds would be used to purchase firewood, corn, and lime, the three ingredients necessary for the production of tortillas. For this reason Rosalina hopes the loan will be approved by the institution and allow her to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase condiments

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive. en la comunidad de Copajira sector  Guaqui  de la Provincia Ingavi del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante de materiales de construcción los cuales adquiere en la ciudad de El Alto y los vende en la localidad de Guaqui. 

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Jacinto is employed in raising cattle, whose milk he sells to PIL Andina (Industrialized Milk Plant).

He lives in the community of Copajira, in the Guaqui sector of Ingavi Province, in the Department of La Paz, located three and a half hours away from the city of La Paz.

He lives together with his wife, who works selling construction materials that she buys in the city of El Alto and sells around Guaqui.

He will use the loan to purchase improved breeds of cattle and thereby increase his milk production, as well as his income.

This is his first loan with IMPRO, and the evaluation that was done qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en: Ofelya was born in 1958. She is married and has two daughters who are married and live on their own. Ofelya lives with her husband in the town of Ijevan. She worked as an accountant in one of Ijevan's factory for many years prior to its liquidation. Since 2004, she and her husband have made a living selling bouquets and wreaths from stall they rent in the town market. Thanks to the success of this business, Ofelya has been able to repair her house and pay for daughters’ education and weddings. She likes her work because it allows her to hear many romantic stories related to her bouquets. Ofelya has applied for a loan for 900,000 AMD to buy a big lot of flowers from which she will make compositions for sale. She plans to spend the expected income made possible by this loan to enlarge her shop.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of flowers

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is 32 years old, and married with 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria.  She is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She sells kerosene, water and juice at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more kerosene, water and juice to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene, water and juice to sell.

loans.name: Felix Nicolas

texts.es:
El señor Meléndez tiene un taller de ebanisteria en el municipio del Viejo donde tiene su propio establecimiento con sus propias herramientas de trabajo, este crédito lo utilizara  para la compra de madera para realizar sus trabajos con puertas, cunas mesas, sillas, todas estas de madera.

Él comenzó  trabajando con un señor y fue de esa manera que adquirió experiencia en la ebanisteria. Después él se retiro para poner su propio taller en su casa, el cual es el que le permite llevar el sustento a su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. M. owns and operates a woodworking shop in the municipality of Viejo. After learning the trade (and gaining experience) from a fellow carpenter, he started his own shop in his house. He will use the loan amount to purchase more wood to finish various work projects, specifically doors, cribs, tables, and chairs.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood for work projects

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 36 años, está casada y es madre de un pequeño hijo, quien es su mayor motivación. Gracias al trabajo de su esposo y al de ella, lograron reunir el dinero necesario para tener su casa propia, donde hoy habitan.

Pero actualmente, Luisa está pasando malos momentos debido al abandono de su esposo y quizás eso haya provocado la rebeldía de su hijo. A pesar de ello, sabe que tiene afrontar esta situación con mucha paciencia y sapiencia, siendo ahora ella, el único pilar del hogar.
Desde hace 16 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, con lo que logra solventar los estudios de su hijo, está conciente que ahora debe trabajará más, por ello la mayor parte de su tiempo lo está empleando en su negocio. Cuando ofrece sus productos, siempre tiene una sonrisa para cada cliente y aprovechando su habilidad persuasiva siempre logra buenas ventas.
Para el futuro, Luisa desea terminar de arreglar la infraestructura de su casa y comprar vitrinas donde pueda exhibir sus productos, pues está segura que el comercio es la actividad que quiere seguir realizando.

Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP y promete seguir siendo responsable en sus pagos. En su banco comunal se siente muy cómoda, ya que la han apoyado muchísimo en las circunstancias que le tocó vivir, por lo que está muy agradecida con sus compañeras. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en el incremento de sus productos de belleza, para que de ese modo siga trabajando en lo que más le gusta.
texts.en:
Luisa is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of a small son, who is her great motivation. Thanks to the work of her husband and herself, they managed to earn the money necessary to have their own house, where they live today. But at present, Luisa is having a bad time, due to the abandonment of her husband and perhaps that has caused the defiance of her son. In spite of this, she knows that she has to confront this situation with a lot of patience and knowledge, since she is now the only pillar of the home. For 16 years she has been dedicated to cosmetic sales, with which she manages to pay for the studies of her son. She is aware that she will now have to work more. Because of this most of her time is spent in her business. When she offers her products, she always has a smile for each client and takes advantage of her persuasive ability to achieve good sales. For the future, Luisa desires to finish fixing the infrastructure of her house and to buy showcases where she can exhibit her products. She is sure that this business is the activity that she wants to continue pursuing. This is her fifteenth credit with MFP and she promises to continue being prompt in her payments. She feels very comfortable in her communal bank, since they have supported her a lot in the circumstances that life has given her, for which she is very thankful to her companions. The money that she now requests will be invested in adding to her beauty products, so that she can continue working in the manner she likes.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for resale

loans.name: Siam

texts.en:
Siam V., age 39, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in the business of weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning approximately $3 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been with this business since 2004. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $1 per day. The standard of living has been improved since V. started this business, so she would like to have a loan to expand her business.

V. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more raw silk. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk for weaving

loans.name: Jenifer Jose

texts.es:
este cliente es originario del poblado de mina el limon,se dedica a la actividad comercial como es la venta de fritanga, es casada y su marido trabaja en la empresa triton minera, actualmente tienen una casa en proceso terminal de construccion, lo que lo han efectuado con ahorro de salrio y prestamos pequeños.
con la empresa ha obtenido 6 creditos pequeños los cuales han sido de gran utilidad, ya que tiene construida su vivienda y sigue haciendo mejoramiento en divisiones.
texts.en:
This client is from Mina el Limon, her business is selling fried snacks. She is married, her husband works in the Triton Mining Company. They have a house in the final stages of construction, which they have accomplished through savings from his salary plus small loans. Through her business, she has obtained 6 small loans that have been very useful to her, enabling her to build her house. Now she is in the process of constructing the interior walls.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials and labor

loans.name: Las Gemelas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Gemelas lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. Una de ellas es la señora Mercedes Dominga M. Martínez quien desde hace diez años se dedica a la realización  de cosa de horno, delicioso bocadillo a base de  maíz, queso, leche y crema. 


Cuando inicio M. con el negocio no contaba con las herramientas necesarias según expreso en la actualidad su negocio ha crecido tiene su propio horno, cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo de 12 años y dos personas que trabajan junto con ella. Esta invertirá el préstamo en la compra de materia prima como maíz, leche, queso y crema.

Mientras Paulina del Rosario L. M. luego de perder parte de su visión empezó a realizar tortillas y luego invirtió en la producción de postres nicaragüenses como buñuelos  y cajetas de leche, coco, piñonate, masa, coyolito, maní y papaya.  Y Martha Evelyn S.  otra de las integrantes del grupo hace cuatro años empezó vendiendo chiverías y con el tiempo fue surtiendo su pequeña venta.
texts.en:
The group "Las Gemelas" (the twins) consists of three women who are hardworking, spirited, and enterprising. One of them is Mercedes Dominga M., who for 10 years has been making and selling a delicious baked dish made of corn, cheese, milk, and cream.

When M. began this business she did not have the tools she needed, but today her business has grown and she has her own oven. She can depend on support from her 12 year old son and two people who work along with her. She will invest the loan in buying raw materials like corn, milk, cheese, and cream.

Meanwhile, Paulina, after loosing some of her sight, began to make tortillas and later began making Nicaraguan deserts such as doughnuts, toffee pudding, coconut, candied pine nuts, cake, masa, coyolito, peanuts and papaya. And Marta, the other group member, has been selling dairy products for four years and over time has been gaining sales.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make deserts, and typical dishes with milk, corn, cheese and cream.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch M. is 46 years old and she is a villager who lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Nhar Nget, is a taxi driver who owns a car for taxi driving and can make a small income to support the family's way of life. 

In order to support her husband's business, Touch M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a car machine to replace the old one. This couple has two children: one is a driver who supports the father's business, while the other is a staff employee in a casino club. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a car machine

loans.name: Sr. De Qoyllority Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR. D. QOYLLORITY”; Ellos son 12 miembros emprendedores y trabajadores; los socios viven en el distrito D. Muñapata provincia D. Quispicanchis departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Josefina, tiene 44 años D. edad, tiene 4 hijos D. 26, 24, 20, 12 años D. edad  la socia alternando sus actividades del hogar con la crianza D. animales menores, ella compra y cría ovinos al por mayor y luego los venD. 

Nuestros socios alternan sus actividades con el comercio minorista ellos e dedican a diferentes actividades entre las cuales están venta D. comidas en el mercado, venta D. coca, (la hoja), crianza D. cuyes y porcinos en muñapata, crianza y venta D. animales menores y mayores, tienda D. abarrotes. Nuestros socios desean el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Los socios agradecen el préstamo y se comprometen a seguir cumpliendo con el pago D. sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the communal bank “SR. D. QOYLLORITY”. They are 12 enterprising and hardworking members. The members live in the district of Muñapata, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cuzco. Our member is Josefina. She is 44 years old. She has 4 children, aged 26, 24, 20, and 12. She alternates her activities between the home and raising small animals. She buys and raises sheep wholesale and later sells them. Our members have different activities in retail. Among their different activities are selling food at market, selling coca leaves, raising guinea pigs and pigs in Muñapata, raising and selling large and small animals, a grocery store. Our members want the loan to reinvest in their different businesses. The members are thankful for the loan and they are committed to keep paying off their debts in the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member is asking for the loan to buy a pair of sheep and thus increase her production.

loans.name: Riinya

texts.en:
Riinya is 47 years old. She is a widowed mother of 4 children aged between 14 to 23 years old. All of her children are currently attending school. She is a farmer from Eastern Kenya in Nkubu town. Riinya has been farming for 24 years and to date she has 3 permanent employees and 10 casual labourers. Her main produce is tea, which she sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority. She also earns income from rental houses she owns in the area and taxi services she offers to the locals.

Riinya recently completed her first loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES. 48,150 which she used to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She has now requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for KES. 75,000 to purchase a dairy cow.

The income from this loan will assist her in renovating her house and educating her children. She also plans to build residential houses on another part of her land with the profits from this loan. In future, she would like to expand her farming by constructing a zero grazing unit and installing a biogas plant.

She says, "Juhudi Kilimo has greatly improved on service delivery, and patience and hard work pays off eventually".

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ligarda

texts.en: Ligarda B. is from the village of Gosi Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 49 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Ligarda owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP whenever she sells her raised animal. Ligarda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Ligarda is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, sugar, flour and water

loans.name: Trancisto

texts.es: Trancito tiene el negocio de venta de leña. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre ha sido una persona muy confiable y humilde. El está pendiente de lo que su familia necesita, el inicio por su familia pues tenía que recorrer distancias muy largas por ofrecer la leña el tiene clientes en las orillas de la ciudad, que esperan a Trancito para que les venda la buena calidad de leña. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Trancito has been selling firewood for more than five years. He has always been a reliable and humble person. Trancito is aware of what his family needs, so he travels great distances so that he can sell firewood to his customers who live on the outskirts of the city. They wait for him because he sells high quality firewood. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Jannette

texts.en:
Jannette O. is from the village of Cabunungan, Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 21 years old. Jannette is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Jannette owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products like home made sausage (chorizo and longanisa) in the local community. Jannette has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jannette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jannette is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jannette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products like home made sausage

loans.name: Reina Maria

texts.es: Reina María tiene 34 años. Su hijo estudia y ella se hace cargo de que el tenga lo mas necesario. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, por lo que Reina tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación y con financiamientos, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer responsable. Sus inicios debido a la difícil situación económica, ella tomo la iniciativa por cuenta propia y ofrecer sus productos por catálogos, así sus clientes escogen los diferentes productos. Este financiamiento es para comprar perfumes, tintes, pintura de uñas, cremas y polvos. Pues siempre sueña con tener un establecimiento propio.
texts.en:
Reina María is 34 years old. Her son is in school, and she makes sure that he has what he needs most. Her economic activity is selling cosmetics. Reina has worked with the Foundation and with loans for a long time, and she has always shown herself to be a responsible person. She started out due to a difficult economic situation; she took the initiative to start working for herself and offering products out of catalogs, so that her customers can choose from a range of products. This loan will be used to buy perfumes, hair colors, nail polish, creams and powders. She is always dreaming of having a shop of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kudratilla

texts.en:
Kudratilla A. is a resident of Kadamjai, a nice town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. He is 35 years old, married, and he has a two-year-old daughter.  

Seven years ago, with the initial investment of 7,000 KGS, he started to breed livestock. Selling some sheep after fattening, he makes about $108 per month.  That profit made it possible for him to save money and start repairing his house.
