With money received from the loan he wants to purchase four sheep and four goats in order to increase the numbers of his livestock.  In the future Kudratilla plans to open an auto repair station. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase four sheep and four goats

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He is 42 years old, married and has been blessed with four school-aged children. He has been farming for five years and employs two farmhands. He sells his milk at a local market. He also earns income from small-scale farming of tea which he sells to a local tea factory. He faces the challenges of lack of animal feed and animal diseases due to lack of enough information on preventive measures. 

Simion has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimoto to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to acquire an additional asset that will be used as security for future loans and will increase the income of his family through the sale of milk. He hopes to improve his farm to be a more productive and profitable business in the future. He is grateful to Juhudi for their support.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne N. is a 36 year old married mother of two children. Anne is a business lady, selling different household products in Mazeras, Mariakani. Her business is 13 years old and is a success.

Anne is accessing her second loan from KADET LTD and plans to buy more stock of sugar, maize, wheat flour, and sodas for her retail shop. Her husband is Donald and is also a businessman in Mariakani. Anne hopes to expand her business and open a grocery store soon.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, maize, wheat flour, and sodas for her retail shop.

loans.name: Nuvia Estibilita

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales,  se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “16 de Julio”.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Nuvia ella tiene 36 años de edad, está casada hace 13 años, de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 11 y una precisa pequeña de 7 años, los dos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer de un expreso escolar.

A los 17 años aprendió corte y confección en la Academia Luis Alfredo Carvajal de la ciudad de Portoviejo, es así  como tiempo después se dedico a coser ropa y hoy tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, trabaja todos los días de 8am a  10h30 y de 14h00 a20h00, en espacios de tiempo se dedica a ayudar a sus hijos en las tareas de la escuela, confecciona todo tipo de ropa pero lo que mas le gusta hacer es ropa sport y casual, trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana ya que sola no alcanza a  cumplir con los trabajos que le llegan.

Este crédito es para comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace ya seis años y le gusta por las facilidades para realizar los pagos y por la ayuda que recibe de la institución.

Su sueño es tener un taller grande en el centro.
texts.en:
The members of the “16 de Julio” communal bank meet every two weeks on San Eduardo street toward Santa Ana, in the city of Portoviejo.  Since colonial times, the city has been referred to as the city of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we find Nuvia.  She is 36 years old and has been married for 13 years.  She has an 11 year old son and a precious 7 year old daughter, both attending school.  Her husband drives a school bus.

When she was 17, she learned how to cut and make clothing at the “Academia Luis Alfredo Carvajal” in Portoviejo.  She began making clothing and now has her own small tailor shop in her home, where she works daily from 8:00 AM to 10:30 AM and then from 2:00 PM to 8:00 PM.  In her spare time she helps her children with their homework.  She makes all types of clothing, but what she enjoys making the most is sport and casual clothing.  Her sister helps her because she gets too many orders to do herself.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric and other materials.  She has been with her communal bank for six years and she likes the ease of repayment terms from the institution.  Her dream is to have a large shop in the city center.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
I. Ali is 55 years old. He is married and has two children. He is the sole breadwinner for his family, and his only income comes from raising and selling sheep and large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers and sheep from farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his sons and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. 

Ali is thinking about expanding his business because the income from his present herd is not sufficient to provide for his family. He plans to purchase more lambs. To do so, he needs to invest an additional 1000 AZN in his business. In order to obtain this amount, he has applied, for a second time, for a loan from Kiva. Ali has a good client history and has successfully finished his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Dionisio  Efraín

texts.es: El señor Dionisio G. A. es comerciante del Bisne mayoreo se dedica al servicio de transporte de Chinandega león y Corinto desde hace 15 años es soltero no tiene hijos a su cargo tiene cuatro años y medio de trabajar con Ceprodel en los cuales los financiamientos le han servido para reparación de su microbús y mejoramiento de su casa la cual la ha venido mejorando poco a poco
texts.en: Sr. Dionisio G. A. is a businessman at the wholesale market in Bisne.  He has been providing transportation services to Chinandega, León, and Corinto for 15 years.  Dionisio is single and does not have children.  He has been working with CEPRODEL for 4½ years and has used the loans to make repairs to his minibus and gradually make improvements to his home.

loans.use: Purchase tires & reupholster the seats of his minibus

loans.name: Kuy's Group

texts.en:
Six people form this group loan. They are located in Peam Reang Kraom village in Kandal province. The group selected Mrs. Kuy S., a 31-year-old married woman, as the group leader. The members of this group loan hope that their families will increase their incomes to improve living conditions. 

Mrs. Kuy S. is a farmer who owns and cultivates a plot of rice field for a living. Her husband, Mr. Kaing Sokha, 40 years old, works as a Khmer cake maker. Mrs. Kuy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more Khmer cake supplies to support her husband's business. 

This couple has a child who is four years old and not in school yet.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer cake supplies

loans.name: Robilyn

texts.en:
Robilyn M. is from the village of Catibac, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Robilyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Robilyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. She is also engaging in selling NATASHA & AVON products. Robilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Robilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Robilyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Robilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta J. is from the village of South Cogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Julieta is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, snack foods, and biscuits.  She also sells electronic loads of Globe & Smart pre-paid calling cards in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory like beverages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Julieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Chriss

texts.es: Chriss, de 27 años, está casada con Ángel, de 26 años. Ambos tienen una hermosa hija, Angelis, de un año de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo arduo en el sembrío, fertilizar y cosechar, es el compromiso que asumió Chriss hace 8 años; pues según afirma desde muy niña, gusto del campo y producir la tierra. Ahora ella tiene más de 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra plátanos a gran escalo, los cuales cosecha 2 veces al mes. Lo que más le gusta a Chriss, es poder negociar sus ricos plátanos por medio de los intermediarios, los cuales gustosos le aconsejas nuevos mercados donde ella puede expandirse y poder ofrecer sus frutos. Por ello más adelante desea convertirse en una comerciante mayorista, y poder viajar por todo el país ofreciendo frutas oriundas de la selva. Esta es primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y espera salir adelante junto a su banco comunal que constan de personas comprometidas con el progreso. Con el crédito que solicita, planea comprar 3 bolsas de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá sobre los viveros de café que hace poco plantó.
texts.en:
Chriss, 27, is married to Ángel, 26. They have a beautiful daughter, Angelis, who is one year old. They live as a family in their own home, located in the Unión Palomar community (central Peruvian rainforest).   

Eight years ago, Chriss took on the commitment to do the arduous work of planting, fertilizing, and harvesting. She says that she has liked the country and the production of the land since she was a little girl. 

Now she has more than 2 hectacres of agricultural land, where she plants plantains on a large scale and harvests them twice a month. What Chriss likes best is being able to sell her delicious plantains through intermediaries, who willingly advise her on new markets where she can expand her sales and offer her fruits.  

In the future she wants to become a wholesale vendor and be able to travel around the whole country offering fruits native to the rainforest. 

This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes to get ahead in life together with her communal bank that is made up of people who are committed to progress. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase 3 bags of organic fertilizer, which she will apply to beds of coffee that she recently planted.

loans.use: To purchase 3 bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mariana Del Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora. Mariana C. es socia del banco comunal Divino niño Jesús, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca que es considerada como la tercera ciudad  más importante del País, es de clima frió, su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente es amable y calida.

La Señora. Mariana tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y  tiene 3 hijos de 22, 18 y 7 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su último hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un taller propio en donde trabaja en la rama de la carpintería, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Mariana se dedica a la venta de ropa, actividad que la realiza en sus tiempos libres hace 2 años, vende sus productos a sus amigas y conocidas, también vende  imágenes de cristos que realiza su esposo actividad que la realiza hace 5 años.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio y  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su mercadería. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mariana C. is a member of the Divino Niño Jesús Communal Bank.  She lives in the Miraflores sector of the city of Cuenca.  It is considered to be the third most important city of the country.  The climate is cool, the cuisine is quite varied, and it enchants both locals and foreigners. The people are friendly and welcoming.

Mariana is 40 years old and married.  She has three children, ages 22, 18, and 7.  Her first two children are married and live independently.  Her last child goes to a school in the city.  Her husband has his own shop where he works in the carpentry trade.  They do not have their own house; they rent where they live.

Mariana sells clothes.  She has been doing this in her free time for two years.  She sells her products to her friends and acquaintances.  For five years she has also been selling replicas of Christ that her husband makes.

She has been a member of the communal bank for one and a half years.  She will use her new loan to buy more clothes to stock her merchandise.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase an additional sewing machine and a special curtain eyelet-making (little holes) machine

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a single woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Rehema has operated a tailoring business for the past two years, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major business challenge in the high cost of transportation. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase more bundles of clothing materials and embroideries. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of their loans products.

loans.use: To  purchase bundles of clothing materials and embroideries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy material and thread for embroidery business.

loans.name: Reachel

texts.en: Reachel, 35, is a dairy farmer. For extra income, she also farms crops. She started dairy farming after receiving capital from Faulu Kenya and has now been running her business for three years. With the income she generates, she is able to raise her child. Reachel hopes to become a prosperous farmer in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a dairy cow and a chaff cutter.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and a chaff cutter

loans.name: 25 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE MARZO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Juana.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: macrame de mantas, tejido a máquina de enaguas, macramé e hilados, tejidos a chompas, compra y venta de ganado, venta de verduras, venta de frutas.

La señora Juana, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que trabaja con Pro Mujer hace 10 años y que ingreso a la institución por la promoción en zona que se hizo.

En la actualidad la señora Juana tiene un negocio de venta de verduras que trabaja hace 17 años, nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió este oficio de su hermana mayor. El crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de verduras), la que compra de la Ceja, de la cuidad de El Alto y la venderá en las ferias de lunes a domingo de 7:00 a 20:00. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los servicios integrales, salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “25 DE MARZO” (March 25th) community bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional office.  The group has eight members and its president is Juana.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: macramé-ing blankets, weaving 'enaguas' (traditional underskirts) by machine, macramé and spinning yarn, knitting sweaters, buying and selling livestock, selling vegetables and selling fruit.

Juana, the bank's president, says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for 10 years and became a member of the institution when they were doing some promotional activities in her area.

Juana has a business selling vegetables which she has owned for 17 years.  She tells us that she learned the business from her older sister.  Juana will use the loan that she is currently requesting to increase her merchandise (buying vegetables).  She buys her merchandise in La Ceja, in the city of El Alto and sells it in street markets from Monday to Sunday, from 7.00am to 8.00pm.  This work allows her to make the money she needs to support her family.  Juana lives with her partner and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the comprehensive services they offer, the health services and the loans.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine M. lives in Ijevan. She is married and has three daughters, all of whom are married. Her youngest daughter's family lives with her. 
Karine worked as an economist in a building organization until it closed in 1993. Then Karine and her husband rented a space in the Ijevan Central Market and started selling clothing and shoes. For the past 18 years, thanks to her profits, Karine has paid for her daughters’ educations and organized their weddings. A few years ago, with her business’ income, Karine supplied free sweets - chocolate, candy and cakes - to Ijevan School N4. 
This is Karine’s 10th loan from Nor Horizon and 2nd loan from Kiva.  She is seeking a 250,000 AMD loan to buy spring clothes and shoes from Yerevan.

loans.use: to buy spring clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Pushati

texts.en:
Pushati O. D. is 43 years old. He is married to Gladys D. who is a housewife and they have six children. Pushati is a farmer and he has been in this business for the last ten years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.
Pushati learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through a marketing campaign carried out by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he will use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profits from this loan to settle the loan and expand his farming business. His hopes and dreams are to become a large-scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land for farming and build rental houses. He is a painstaking man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
María de 24 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos que cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el caserío Luchadores Sociales del distrito de Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.   Zona que desarrolla la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y artesana.

María se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora (bebida realizada a base de maíz molido que lo dejan fermentar y luego le colocan otros insumos y está lista para consumirla) y de harina de maíz, lo prepara en su mismo domicilio, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años  y lo ofrece a sus clientes que la conocen, de esta manera ella se ayuda a tener más ingresos económicos ya que con lo que su esposo le da diariamente nomles alcanza para solventar sus gasto familiares.

A solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar insumos y utensilios para seguir elaborando la chicha de jora que vende y la harina de maíz, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos, ya que su clientela se ha incrementado, para poder pagar su cuota y de paso mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  María desea que más adelante su negocio cresca para seguir ayudando a su familia y brindarle mejores comodidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 24 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and children. The house has running water and light, it is located in the Luchadores Sociales hamlet, district of Tambogrande some 40 minutes from the department of Piura. Most of the inhabitants in the area are farmers, cattle breeders and in handicrafts.

María makes and sells chicha de jora (a drink made from grinded corn that is fermented and is then added some ingredients and its ready to be consumed) and corn flour that she makes in her home. She has been working for 4 years in this field and she offers products to her customers and this way she can have more income since what her husband makes is not enough to meet the household expenses.

María went to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy supplies and utensils to keep making chicha de jora and corn flour which will allow her to have more income since her customers have increased. María will be able to pay her loan and improve her families’ quality of life. She hopes that in the future her business will grow to keep supporting her family and to give greater comfort to her children.

loans.use: buy supplies and utensils to make chicha de jora.

loans.name: Tum

texts.en:
Mr. Tum is 54 years old and the father of four children who are single. One of them is employed in overseas manufacturing. 

Mr. Tum is a local farmer as well as a soldier in Siem Reap province. In order to share responsibility, his wife raises a few ducks and chickens to produce eggs, and then sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at her house. With the rainy season coming now, Mr. Tum will use the loan for which he is asking to rent a machine to plow on his farmland in order to grow fruit crops, and to buy insecticide for protection of his fruit crops.

loans.use: to grow fruit crops and to buy insecticide to protect his fruit crops.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI I est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de NIKANKAN de l’ex arrondissement de Kimparana   région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et au moins 7 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide et du soja.  Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne.
SITAN, la première assise la main sur le petit seau, compte utiliser  son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide et soja  des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et SAN,  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI I comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 39000 à 42500 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en: Benkadi I is a group of married women from the village of Nikankan, of the outer neighborhood of Kimparana, a region of Segou, the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  They live in traditional families.  They are 29 years old on average and have at least 7 children.  They raise peanuts and soy.  With the intention of making their agricultural concerns profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program four years ago.  After having fully repaid their previous loans, they are on their fourth country loan.  Sitan, the first seated with her hand on the small bucket, expects to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut and soy seeds, some light equipment, and agricultural fertilizers at the big market in Kimparana.  After the rainy season, the harvests are stored for a certain amount of time so that they gain value before being sold at the big markets in Kimparana and San and at surrounding markets at retail (or often wholesale) for cash to a customer base generally coming from the big cities.  The members of the group Benkadi I expect to each make a profit of 39,000 to 42,500 FCFA after the harvest of their agricultural products, which will be used to pay the interest on their loans and their families' current expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and light equipment.

loans.name: Yajaira Cristina

texts.en:
Yajaira is 31 years old and lives in the city of Ibarra, in northern Ecuador. She is married but is living with her parents because, at the moment, she is separated from her husband. She has three daughters who are three, seven, and 12. Yajaira is a hardworking and responsible person who has a business selling cosmetics door-to-door. She began her business with a microloan from FODEMI that gave her the capital to begin working in the sale of beauty products. Yajaira reports that her business is going very well and that she has progressed and is happy with what she’s accomplished. 

Yajaira is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. Past loans have helped her change her products and this flexibility has increased her earnings. In addition, she is also able to offer a longer period of credit for her customers, who pay in increments. Yajaira’s dream is to have her own local cosmetics shop so that she no longer has to walk door-to-door to make her sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet, a 41-year-old resident of Plaridel, is married and the mother of three children. For five years, she has sold fish to earn a living. A member of PMPC for four years, Janet  is requesting a loan for 5000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Geirell Dario

texts.es:
Geirell es vecino de la comunidad de Cimarrón, ubicada en Santa Teresita, Turrialba, en la provincia de Cartago. Esta zona es reconocida por sus actividades agropecuarias donde mayormente se destaca la ganadería lechera, por la gran cantidad de ganado vacuno que se presenta ya que es una de las zonas rurales de Costa Rica.
Geirell necesita un préstamo por el monto de ₡600.000 (seiscientos mil colones),  ya que se dedica a la agricultura y necesita este dinero para la compra de semilla de banano, para así ofrecer calidad de producto a sus clientes en el momento de la cosecha. El destaca que su objetivo es aumentar sus ingresos económicos por medio de esta actividad agrícola, para así poder  desarrollar bien su negocio, superarse como ser humano, obtener una vida digna y mayor solvencia económica para él y su familia.
El pertenece a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Nueva Esperanza de Cimarrón, una de las 110 empresas en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Geirell lives in the community of Cimarrón, located in Santa Teresita, Turrialba, in Cartago province.  This area is known for its agriculture, especially its dairy farming, as there are a large number of cattle in this rural part of Costa Rica.

Geirell needs a loan in the sum of 600,000 colones because he is a farmer and needs to buy banana seeds.  In this way he can offer quality products to his customers at harvest time.  He emphasizes that his goal is to increase his income through his farming activities so that he can develop his business, succeed as a person, and have a decent life and better economic situation for himself and his family.  

Geirell belongs to the communal bank "Nueva Esperanza de  Cimarrón," one of the 110 communal banks in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant bananas

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 32 years old and single. She operates a small retail business selling an assortment of goods which includes snacks, spices, clothes, etc. She has been running this business for five years now. She says that the business is profitable, and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. 

She is using her loan of kes 80,000 to add to the stock of snacks, clothing and spices in order to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into wholesale and put up her own premises, where she will not be paying rent. She also hopes to build a residential house for herself. She describes herself as jovial and welcoming.

loans.use: to buy clothes, snacks, spices etc

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, 43, is a resident of Maligaya Echague. She is married and has nine children. Marivic’s earnings go to meet daily needs, pay her electric bill and for allowances for the children.

For almost the past twenty years Marivic has made furniture. She is able to earn about 2,000 PHP monthly. According to her, her finished products are distributed to other villages where she has agents.

Marivic is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy materials such as wood, varnish and nails. By improving her furniture, she hopes to encourage more customers to buy it.

Marivic hopes that she will be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to buy materials such as  woods, varnish and nails.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es: La señora Griselda es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la elaboración de bordados y ropa típica la cual comercializa en Rivas desde hace varios años. Ella tiene un pequeño taller cuenta con seis trabajadores y con el crédito comprará materia prima tela, hilo, lana…etc.
texts.en:
Griselda is a hard-working and enterprising woman.  She does embroidery and makes traditional clothing, which she has been selling in Rivas for several years.  

She has a small workshop with 6 workers, and will use the loan to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, wool etc.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, wool etc.

loans.name: Marisela Esther

texts.es: La Señora Marisela de 33 años es una persona soltera muy emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene un pequeño negocio donde se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (leche, huevo, arroz, azúcar, fideos), además de la venta de golosinas (galletas, chicles, chocolates), entre otros, el crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de estos productos de abarrotes y así poder incrementar mejor su negocio con una tienda más surtida y con más variedad, eligió este negocio con la finalidad de tener mayores ingresos y por la demanda de tiendas por la zona donde vivía. Su gran sueño de la señora Marisela es culminar sus estudios superiores, la señora está muy agradecida por el crédito brindado ya que podrá incrementar sus ventas y su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Marisela, aged 33, is a single woman who is very enterprising with the desire to move ahead in life.  She has a small store where she sells groceries (milk, eggs, rice, sugar, noodles).  She also sells sweets (cookies, gum, chocolates), among other things.

The requested loan is to invest in the purchase of these grocery products so that she can grow her business better by having a better stocked store with a greater variety of products.

She chose this line of business with the intent of having better income, and because of the demand for stores in the area where she lives.

Señora Marisela's big dream is to complete her further education.  The Señora is very grateful for the loan that's being provided, and with which she will be able to grow her sales and her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries (milk, sugar, rice, noodles), and sweets (cookies, chocolates), among other products.

loans.name: Kabero Group

texts.en:
Martin is the facilitator of the Kabero group. Martin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Martin takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and secure enough food for his children. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had a good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½  acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Martin was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Martin will educate his children, ensure food security, raise livestock and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Kabero group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia tiene 23 años de edad y estudio hasta quinto año de primaria por falta de recursos económicos, Doña Leticia es casada y tienen tres hijos de nombres los cuales estudian la primaria y el preescolar. Doña Lety como es conocida en su localidad esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para invertir en su negocio de frutas y verduras de temporada como aguacate, nopales, papas, quelites, guayaba, naranja etc. ella tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 3 años. Comenta que a diario a las cuatro de la mañana sale a surtir a la central de abastos a una población cercana a su localidad para que le den un buen precio y para agarrar la fruta fresca.  Uno de las dificultades es que a veces no tiene muchas ventas y se le echan a perder sus verduras por que abecés tiene pocas ventas. Comenta doña Lety que el préstamo les beneficiara por que gracias a este podrá surtir mejor su puesto de frutas y con las ganancias podrá aportar un poco más de gasto para su casa y así sus hijos tendrán una mejor calidad de vida, una de las metas que tiene la señora Leticia es tener un puesto en el mercado ya que donde esta es ambulante, también dice que en su casa vende frutas y legumbres y ahí quisiera poner un  local establecido ya que lo tiene en su cocina y le gustaría hacer un local especial para su negocio.
texts.en: Leticia is 23 and only has a 5th grade education because of lack of resources.  She is married and has three children in preschool and elementary.  Since Lety is well known in her town she is requesting a loan to invest in her fruit and vegetable business to sell seasonal fruit such as avocado, nostle fruit, potatoes, spinach, guava, oranges, etc.  She has been in business for approximately three years.  She starts her day at 4:00 a.m. when she goes to the produce market in a nearby town.  There she buys fresh fruit at a good price.  One of the difficulties she has is when sales are slow and the produce goes bad.  Lety says the loan will be beneficial because she will be able to stock fruit and with the earnings contribute more to the household expenses which will improve her children's lifestyle.  One of Leticia's goals is to have her own stall at the market, since now she is a street vendor.  She also sells fruits and vegetables out of her home where she would like to set up a stand instead of using her kitchen as a salespoint.

loans.use: To sell fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Saidmurod

texts.ru: Саидмурод умный и решительный молодой человек. Ему  33 года, женат, имеет двоих детей. Саидмурод  опытный  предприниматель. Он  занимается куплей и продажей более 10 лет. У  Саидмурода собственный магазин, в котором осуществляется купля и продажу бытовой техники это стиральные машины, холодильники, духовки, электронагреватели  и газовые баллоны. У него в магазине работает один продавец. Три четыре раза в месяц он приобретает товары  из города на общую сумму 4500$ - 5000$  США с наценкой 14-15%.  Саидмурод продает качественный  товар и у него много  постоянных клиентов. Он хочет получить займ на сумму $3000 США для покупки бытовой техники, получение, которого поможет разнообразить ассортимент товаров и развить бизнес. Саидмурод надеется на вашу поддержку и выражает вам свою признательность.
texts.en: Saidmurod is a smart and decisive young person.  He is 33 years, married and has two children.  Saidmurod is an experienced entrepreneur.  He has been involved in buying and selling for over 10 years.  Saidmurod has his own store, where he buys and sells household appliances, such as washing machines, refrigerators, ovens, electric heaters and gas containers.  He has another salesperson working in his store.  Saidmurod buys merchandise with a 14-15% add-on in the city three to four times per month, using a total sum of $4500-5000.  He sells quality merchandise and has many loyal customers.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of household appliances, which would help him expand his current merchandise selection and develop his business.  Saidmurod hopes that you will support him and expresses his gratitude to you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 52 years old and married with two children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past 10 years, Josefa has been a farmer who plants crops to earn a living. Josefa has been a member of GDMPC for two years. 

Josefa is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase crop fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she hopes to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase crop fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam, 36, lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Sam has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells spare parts.

To help expand his business, Sam has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy spare parts for resale and will help Sam to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Sam hopes that in the future he will be able to further expand his business.

Sam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Mary Wanjiku

texts.en:
Mary is a 21-year-old married woman. She has a son who is three months old. She describes herself as honest. 
Mary has a store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in Nakuru town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to add to her stock of cereals. She will use her loan of 40,000 KES to buy maize, beans, peas, and wheat flour. Her business goal is to be a major supplier of cereals in her hometown area of Nakuru within five years.

loans.use: to buy beans, peas, maize, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yadira;  La socia tiene 30 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia es enfermera de profesión y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, ella cría cuyes, pollos, y en esta ocasión la socia desea invertir en la compra de 20 cuyes para la venta, la socia tiene sus contratas para vender cuyes en la zona. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes en un total de 20.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Yadira belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Concebida de Arin."  This communal bank is located in the Arin district of Calca province in the department of Cusco.

Yadira, 30, is single.  She is a nurse by profession, and she also raises small animals.  She raises guinea pigs and chickens, and at this time she wants to invest in the purchase of 20 guinea pigs to sell.  Yadira has contracts to sell guinea pigs in the area.  She requests a loan to invest in a total of 20 guinea pigs.

Yadira is grateful for this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of 20 guinea pigs

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo, debido a que se acerca la temporada de fin de año donde sus ventas aumentan, ella quiere fortalecer el negocio y estar preparada para esta época, comprando productos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, verduras, chancletas.
El préstamo anterior le generó mayores ganancias debido a la inversión en mercadería logrando satisfacer las demandas de los clientes y mejorando su condición económica.
texts.en:
Josefa is asking for a loan again. The end of the year is approaching, when her sales increase. She wants to strengthen her business and be ready for the season, buying basic necessity products such as basic grains, produce and flip-flops.

The previous loan generated bigger earnings due to the investment in merchandise. She was able to meet her customers' demands and improve her financial condition.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, produce and flip-flops.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana Elizabeth de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive con su hijo en casa propia. Ella posee un taller de costura, realiza todo tipo de prendas como blusas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues el trabajo que realiza es de muy buena calidad y vende a excelentes precios ; Ana es una mujer emprendedora con muchas metas por alcanzar, siempre está dispuesta a trabajar duro, se levanta desde muy temprano a confeccionar la ropa, le gusta estar adelante de la competencia por eso se mantiene siempre a la vanguardia, piensa que la motivación es lo que te ayuda a empezar pero el habito es el que te mantiene firme en tu camino, tiene ese habito de trabajo es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor. Ana Elizabeth tiene la esperanza que así podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Elizabeth, 45, lives with her daughter in her own house.  She has a sewing shop where she makes all types of articles of clothing like blouses, shirts, pants and dresses, among others.  Lately her clientele has grown because the work she does is very good quality and she sells at excellent prices. 

Ana is an enterprising woman with many goals to reach.  She is always willing to work hard.  She rises very early to start making clothes.  She likes to stay ahead of her competition so she’s always on the cutting-edge.  She believes that motivation is what gets you started but habit is what keeps you firmly on the path.  

She possesses that work habit and that’s why she decided to request an INTEGRAL loan that will make it possible for her to buy fabric at wholesale.  Ana Elizabeth hopes that she’ll be able to provide economic security for her home and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Guadalupe es casada tiene 1 hijo que aun depende de ella económicamente, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y no descuidar la familia, cuida 4 niños en su casa. Desde hace 7 años su esposo adquirió una casa de interés social donde actualmente viven, las paredes se están deteriorando lo que necesita un mantenimiento y también quiere poner piso de concreto porque en temporadas de lluvias se hace un charco y mucho lodo. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar cemento, arena, yeso y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Guadalupe is married and has a son who is still economically dependent upon her. To help her husband with household expenses and to avoid neglecting her family, she cares for 4 children in her house. Some 7 years ago, her husband acquired a publicly-subsidized house where we presently live. The walls are deteriorating and in need of maintenance. Also, I want to install a concrete floor because during the rainy season, the floor becomes one big puddle and quite muddy. To carry out the project, we need to buy cement, sand, and plaster, and to pay the workers.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for needed home improvements.

loans.name: Enagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON est composé de trois  personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Aicha est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Aicha est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Aicha est mariée à un électricien du nom de Abou. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Aicha vend depuis vingt- ans du savon liquide et des plateaux d’œufs. Aicha s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Aicha ensemble avec les membres de ce groupe ENAGNON, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du savon liquide et des plateaux d'oeufs.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Gustavo is very committed to his family, especially to his wife because she could not have children due to health problems. However, Gustavo\'s optimism as great as his love for his wife. For this reason he works repairing household electronics and appliances and has his own business. Gustavo has 30 years of experience repairing this kind of products, but at the moment his job has become more difficult. For this reason he needs tools and spare parts from these kind of products.

Gustavo needs a loan of $475 USD to purchase tools and parts. It allows him to continue fixing the electronics products and from that way he can obtain an income to cover all his family necessities.

**This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Don Gustavo es una persona muy entregada a su familia, especial mente a su esposa ya que no pudieron tener hijos debido a que ella tiene problemas de salud. Sin embargo, el optimismo de Don Gustavo es tan grande como el amor a su esposa. Por lo que trabaja en un taller de reparaciones de aparatos electrodomésticos. Don Gustavo tiene 30 años de experiencia en la reparación de este tipo de aparatos, pero en estos tiempos el trabajo se ha hecho más difícil, por lo que necesita de herramienta y chatarra de estos aparatos, porque de esta manera el extrae las piezas que aun puede utilizar para sus composturas.

Don Gustavo necesita un préstamo de $475 USD para comprar herramientas y chatarra. Esto le permite seguir arreglando los aparatos electrodomésticos y de esta manera seguir obteniendo un ingreso para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, en este caso el y las de su esposa.

loans.use: Purchase tools and scrap

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: I am a married man a father of 4. I sell second-hand books. I am the main breadwinner. I believe the loan will help me increase my business skills and educate my dependents.

loans.use: I will use the loan to intensify and expand my business.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.en:
Ligia has 12 years of experience with her business. She started as a school bus chauffer. Then, she managed a grocery store that was far from her home. Noting that this required a lot of travel time, she decided to start a business in her home and saved money to do this start-up. So far, she's been running the business from her home for 2 years and it is going very well. She works every day from 6am to 11pm. Her husband helps a lot with the business as well.

Ligia requires credit in order to enhance her business line with more products such as meats and sausages. She would like to buy an oven in order to start making breads as well.

Ligia is married and has 3 children who are all studying. During their spare moments, they help with the store as well. Her husband is a chauffer and uses his own car to chauffer school children. In addition to running her store, Ligia is studying baking in a course run by a company called Empresa. She hopes to finish the course and then be able to start making fresh bread products to sell.

Ligia tiene una experiencia de 12 años con su actividad. Se inicio siendo chofer de expreso escolar. Pone un local de venta de víveres lejos de su domicilio. Viendo que esto le significaba demasiado tiempo decide con sus ahorros adecuar su hogar para poner su negocio en casa. Actualmente tiene ya 2 años en su domicilio y le ha ido muy bien. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Su esposo le ayuda mucho en su negocio siendo una ayuda enorme para ella.

Ligia desea el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con otra clase de productos como lo son las carnes y embutidos. Además ella ya cuenta con un horno y muy pronto comenzara a producir panes.

Ligia es casada. Tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian y en sus ratos libres le ayudan con la atención de la tienda. Su esposo trabaja de chofer en carro propio haciendo expreso escolar. Ligia además de su trabajo ella también estudia panadería en nuestros cursos que da la Empresa. Su deseo es poder terminar su curso y de esta manera con el conocimiento comenzar a trabajar en la elaboración de productos de panadería.

loans.use: Augment her business with new products

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
This entrepreneur’s name is Elena F. and she is 23 years old. She is married and does not have children. She lives with her husband in a small house located in a small town near Caaguazú. Her husband works in a shop that rebuilds electrical components of car motors.

She is the owner of a small business located in the Abasto market. She travels very early every day to go to her business, which is 30 minutes from her house. She sells all kinds of women’s clothes, such as pants, shorts, t-shirts, and coats.

Because of the fact that it is the winter season, she would like to buy warm clothing to sell. She is requesting a loan of $400.00, with which she will buy clothing for winter, such as sweatpants, sweaters, coats, pants and wool sweaters. There is a lot of demand for these types of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La emprendedora se llama Elena F. y tiene 23 años, ella está casada, no tiene hijos. Ella vive con su esposo en una pequeña casa ubicada en un pequeño pueblo de Caaguazú; su marido es empleado en un taller de rebobinados. Elena es dueña de una microempresa ubicado en el mercado de Abasto de la ciudad, ella viaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas para ir a su negocio que queda a 30 minutos de su casa. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, vende todo tipo de prendas femeninas como remeras, pantalones, shorts, camisas, camperas y calzados. En vista de que es temporada de invierno, ella desea comprar pendas de abrigo para la venta, por lo que solicita un crédito de $ 400 con los que comprará compra de ropa para invierno como: buzos, poleras, sacos, pantalones y polleras de lana, pues tiene bastante demanda de estas prendas.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing, such as sweatpants, sweaters, coats, pants, and wool sweaters

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.en:
The condition of my bathroom is unhygienic for my family. As such, I need to fix it and put in a floor. I am asking for $1200.00 dollars to work on my bathroom and put in a floor.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Las condiciones en las que esta el baño de mi casa ya son antihigiénicas para mi familia así es que necesito repararlo y poner el piso”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para preparar el baño y poner piso.

loans.use: Repair bathroom and install a floor in it.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa is part of the Banco Comunal Flor del café. She sells chicken meat at a stand at the local market in the district of Soritor, Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martin. She decided to start her business in order to continually support her family and to generate her own income in order to grow personally.

With the recent loan given to her by Manuela Ramos of $233 that will be repaid in four installments, she will buy 30 to 40 chickens, special pepper, and garlic in kilos to sell her farm chickens. This way she is able to meet the needs of her clients and the local market.

She is 54 years old and has five children. She is content with what she does and she is satisfied with the results she has obtained ever since her group of clients has increase. Her goal is have her own shed to raise the chicken. She wants to sell large and small quantities and to supply the region with this essential food to many families.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal Flor del café, se dedica la venta de pollos viscerados, tiene un puesto en el mercado de su localidad, en el distrito de Soritor, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martin. Decidió iniciar su negocio por que tenía que sacar adelante a su familia y de esa manera generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona. Con el reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 700.00 soles ($ 233.00), el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 30 a 40 gallinas de las chacras, especies como culantro, ají especial, ajos en kilos para licuarlos y surtir su puesto de venta de pollos de granja y criollos, y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y del mercado local. Tiene 54 años y 5 hijos, esta contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha su clientela aumentó, su meta es tener su propio galpón para criar y tener su centro de acopio, vender al por mayor y menor y abastecer a la zona con este alimento primordial en la cocina de muchas familias.

loans.use: Purchase chicken and garlic.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
I am Khursheed B.. I am married and a mother of seven, four boys and three girls. I live with my family in a big city, Lahore, Pakistan. I stay at home and do my household chores; I do not go out and work because I have grown old and my sons have started earning income. My husband owns a vegetable business in a nearby market.

One of my sons paints and polishes furniture on order. My son is in the process of expanding his business so that he can take on bigger orders and thus increase his income. He wants to give to us so that we can be comfortable and worry free in our old age. For this purpose he requires a loan for his business.

loans.use: Expand furniture business

loans.name: María De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria De La Luz is a single mother of two children. She is putting them through school so that they would have a better future. She can do this thanks to the fact that she has started a small business selling natural consumer products. At first she tried these products herself and noted that they worked, this made her realize that these products could sell and with the help of her family, little by little attracted customers that currently seek her out, to sell them these dietary supplements.

In December, however, her sales decreased and she currently does not have enough money to replenish her inventory. This is the reason for Maria to be requesting a USD $525 loan that she is going to repay in 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy merchandise to offer to her customers. With your help Maria will be able to improve the future of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

María de la Luz es madre soltera de dos hijos. A quienes tiene estudiando para que sean personas de bien, los mantiene estudiando gracias a que María decidió comenzar su propia microempresa de venta de productos naturales para consumo personal. Primero María utilizó estos productos y se dio cuenta que servían, fue así como se convenció de que estos productos los podía vender y asó poco a poco empezando con su familia comenzó a hacerse de clientes que actualmente la buscan para poder venderles estos complementos a sus dietas.

Sin embargo en Diciembre las ventas para María disminuyeron, y es por eso que maría actualmente no cuenta con dinero suficiente como para resurtir su negocio. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $525 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Zarnigar

texts.en: Zarnigar (her brother is pictured) is a  53 year old widow with 3 children. She and her family live in Khachmaz region.  Zarnigar and her brother have been in clothing sales for 5 years, and now they need a loan of $850 in order to buy clothes to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Mwajua's Molemo Group

texts.en:
Mwajua is 35 years old and is married woman with1 child, aged 4 years old. Mwajua owns a small saloon, which she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

In the past, Mwajua has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who have business dealings in timber sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Joha

texts.en:
Joha is 33 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 12. Joha is a charcoal seller who started up her little business in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $275 from her sales.

In the past, Joha has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a second loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel started her business because her husband´s income was insufficient to meet the family´s expenses. She´s allways had a knack for business and saw the opportunity to increase their earnings with her family´s help. Six years ago she began selling refreshments, fritters, and sweets amongst her neighbors. Eventually she began to sell meat next to her brother´s store on saturdays and sundays.

She is requesting a $500 credit to purchase foodstuffs to be paid back in six months. With your support, Isabel will make it.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase food to prepare

loans.name: Yaye Diabou

texts.fr:
Yaye Diabou Cissé is 39 years old, unmarried with 3 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Manguiline Santhiaba in Bignona in the Ziguinchor area for 7 years. She runs a business selling thioub (a type of dyed cloth). She buys her goods in Tambacounda and sells them in Bignona. With her income, she looks after her family and supports the education of her children. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Yaye Diabou Cissé ,39 ans, célibataire, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona dans la région de Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans. Elle mène une activité de vente de thioub (tissus teintés) .Elle va acheter à Tambacounda pour vendre à Bignona. Avec ses revenus elle entretien sa famille et assure la scolarité des enfants. Yaye est très dynamique. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell thioub (a type of dyed cloth)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase jewelry and clothing for her business.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to invest the money in the construction of a new room for her house. She has worked as a teacher in the school Rubén Darío for the past 8 years, and she performs her job with great love and care. She lives in the city of Nueva Guinea (New Guinea), Nicaragua. She has two daughters, the oldest of whom is 8 and studies in the second grade, and the youngest still a baby of one year. Sandra’s husband works as a police officer. Both share the responsibility of sustaining the family and providing their daughters with an education. Sandra’s dream is to continue studying, to be healthy and have stable work, and to improve the conditions of her home so that her daughters will not lack anything.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra está solicitando el préstamo a nuestra Institución para invertirlo en construcción de una habitación en su vivienda. Labora como docente de la Escuela Rubén Darío desde hace 8 años, en la cual se desempeña con mucha responsabilidad y amor a su trabajo. Habita en el municipio de Nueva Guinea. Tiene 2 hijas , la hija mayor de 8 años estudia su 2do grado de educación primaria y una bebita de un añito, su esposo trabaja como Policía. Ambos la responsabilidad de llevar el sutento a su familia, y proveerles de educación a sus hijas. Su sueño es seguir estudiando, tener salud y estabalididad laboral, tener mejores condiciones en su hogar para que a sus hijas no les falte nada.

loans.use: To build an additional room

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda, 31 years old, has 3 children. Two of them are students and the youngest is a baby. She lives with her husband who sells groceries wholesale and who helps her out whenever possible.

She is a determined and visionary woman. She sells beer wholesale (50 cases daily), a business which she runs from her home, working 24 hours a day. She has a select clientele (warehouses and bars) and she sells the product for cash or credit. What she likes about her work is selling and meeting many people. What is difficult for Esmeralda is that she does not have a secure area for storing her products.

She works to take care of daily expenses and for her children´s education.

She would like to build an adequate space in her home where she can store the beer. Later on she would like to have a distributorship, not only for beer but also for soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Esmeralda, de 31 años, tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudiantes y el último un bebe, ella vive junto a su esposo, quien es comerciante (vende abarrotes al por mayor) y la apoya en lo posible.

Ella es una mujer decidida y visionaria, se dedica a la venta de cerveza al por mayor (50 cajas diarias), negocio que instaló dentro de su vivienda, trabaja las 24 horas del día. Su clientela es selecta (bodegas y bares) y les deja su producto al crédito o al contado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender y socializa con mucha gente. Lo difícil para Esmeralda es no contar con un local seguro para almacenar sus productos.

Esta madre trabaja para solventar los gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos.

Quiere mandar a construir un local adecuado en el interior de su vivienda, donde almacenará sus cervezas. Posteriormente quiere llegar a tener una distribuidora, no solo de cerveza, sino también de bebidas gasificadas.

loans.use: Build a space to store cases of beer, which she sells wholesale.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Né le 07 avril 1969 à Tchékpo dans la préfecture de Yoto, monsieur T. Kodjo est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Depuis 2004, il a crée un établissement de vente des matériaux de construction surtout du ciment dans le quartier d’Agoè.  
Il n’a jamais sollicité du crédit mais sollicite ce premier compte tenu de la demande important de ses clients. Ainsi avec ce crédit il achètera 6 tonnes de ciment de type fortia qui est apprécié par les clients compte tenu de sa qualité. Ce nouveau stock de ciment lui permettra de bien vendre afin de pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Born on April 7, 1969 in Tchékpo in the Yoto prefecture, Mr. Kodjo T. is married and the father of two children. In 2004, he opened a business selling construction materials, especially cement, in the Agoè district.

He had never asked for a loan but now is requesting his first due to large orders he has received from his customers. With this loan, he will be able to buy 6 tons of Fortia cement which is most sought after by his customers due to its quality. This new stock of cement will allow him to increase his sales so as to better cater for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 6 tons of cement

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad Baji, married to J. F., lives in a small town called Kot Radha Kishan, located near Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in the town for the last 8 years. Irshad Baji has two daughters, the eldest of whom is 7 years old, while the youngest is 1 year old. For the past five years, Irshad Baji’s husband has been working as a tractor driver, while Irshad Baji has been earning income running a milk sales business. She owns two buffalos that produce up to 24 liters of milk per day. On average, Irshad Baji earns US$5-6 per day from the milk sales. Currently, she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk business.

loans.use: Purchase of another buffalo for a milk business

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
One of the coastal barrios in the town of Plaridel is the barangay Usocan, where a certain woman named Meriam A. lives. She is 46 years old and married to Juanito, a devoted and brave fisherman. The couple was blessed with two children and both of them have settled down.

Mr. Juanito once worked with their neighbor who had a fishing boat. He had a small share of the fishing income, but it was not enough for the whole family. Meriam happened to become a Paglaum Co-op member when one of their neighbors (a co-op member too) sold the couple Paglaum’s programs and services five years ago. The couple was so thankful for Paglaum because they were granted enough money to purchase machinery for their own fishing boat. From then on, Meriam's husband no longer worked with their neighbor, but focused on his own fishing boat and has reaped their income from it. While her husband is focusing on fishing, Mrs. A. is also vending snacks, ice candy, ice, and bar-b-que in their neighborhood to provide additional income for the family. Bar- b-que is a kind of thinly sliced pork or any meat attached to a bamboo stick and grilled. It has a minimal selling price of only two to five pesos and is very affordable to the market.  

Currently, the couple has acquired three unit motorized pump boats and is applying for a loan worth fifteen thousand pesos (P15,000.00) for the acquisition of another fishing boat which is bigger and better than what they have now.  According to them, the bigger the boat is, the more it can fight big waves, can run through even during stormy season, and can transport and hold a number of huge fish caught at sea. An average of fifty kilos per day is their daily sales from one unit motorized pump boat, with an average of forty pesos (P40) selling price per kilo, depending on the type and variety of fish. 

The couple was so grateful for Paglaum MPC because through the co-op they were able to build a partially concrete house. The couple hopes for more blessings to come as they faithfully maintain their Member In Good Standing status with the co-op and pay their loans on time with no trace of default. The family is dreaming of having a “lantsa”, a much bigger fishing boat with at least 20 workers so that they can fish from coast to coast in the future.

loans.use: Purchase motorboat for fishing

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena R. se dedica a la venta de productos personales como lo son colas, chapas, pulseras, peluches y cosméticos en el mercado La Terminal de León donde ofrece sus productos a los clientes que a diario le visitan

Hoy en día ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de estos productos debido a que las ventas han estado muy buenas y al habérsele agotado la mercadería le urge comprar nuevamente los productos y es por este motivo que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Maria Elena R. sells personal products like pogs, bracelets, plushy toys, and cosmetics in the market La Terminal de León where she offers her products to her clients that visit her daily. Today she is asking for a loan through Ceprodel to buy these products given that sales have been very good and after having sold out the market she urgently needs to buy new products. It is for this reason that she that her loan will be granted and through this she will be able to continue business that needs your support very much.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Joyce D.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Joyce S. from Tukuyu. She is a widow with four children, between the ages of 5 and 16. Joyce has been running a rice business since 2007. She purchases rice on a wholesale basis and sells it retail.

She works at the business for 1-4 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her brother. Joyce currently earns about 380 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Joyce thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice in bulk

loans.name: Rosario Ventura

texts.es: La Señora Rosario Vásquez de 35 años de edad,  Casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un pequeño Taller,  habita conjuntamente con su esposo y sus hijos, desde su niñez se dedicaba a la artesanía, gracias a ello a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Caserío Palemop I de la Aldea Vásquez del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, ella ha llegado a solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un préstamo para la Artesanía con el fin de comprar materia prima para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda de su clientela aprovechando las ganancias y así poder darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario Vásquez is 35 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in Caserío Palemop I, Vásquez, located in the Totonicapán district of Guatemala. Rosario is a seamstress and makes traditional women's garments with the help of a small loom. Since childhood, she has been working in her craft. Thanks to her business, she has been able to help her family succeed and is well-known in her town. Rosario is requesting a loan from Asociación Asdir to purchase raw materials to meet customer demand, increase her profits and provide a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (Creation of traditional garments)

loans.name: Akanji

texts.en: Akanji O. is single and he is 27 years old. He sells and repairs rechargeable phones. He hopes to expand this business. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phones. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phones to sell

loans.name: Mouniratou

texts.fr:
C. Mouniratou est née le 05/12/1984 à Cotonou. Mouniratou est célibataire sans enfant.
Mouniratou vend les pâtes dentifrices et brosses à dents, coton et papiers-mouchoirs. Mouniratou a déjà deux crédit avec ALIDé. Depuis que Mouniratou a commencé par avoir de prêt à ALIDé, elle a augmenté son niveau d'activité et espère parvenir d'ici la fin de l'année à ouvrir une une petite boutique pour la vente de produits cosmétiques. Aujourd'hui Mouniratou demande un troisième crédit pour diversifier son activité.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Mouniratou C. was born on December 12th, 1984 in Cotonou. Mouniratou is single without children. She sells toothpaste and toothbrushes, cotton and tissues. She has already received two credits with ALIDé. Since she has been receiving credits from ALIDé, she has increased her activity level and she hopes to open by th end of the year a small shop to sell cosmetics. Today, Mouniratou requires a third credit to diversify her business. The meaning of ALIDé in Benin local language - Fon - is "a path always exists for the poorest". Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria, with a GDP per capita of $1,500. ALIDé offers special credits at 0% interest rate for very vulnerable people, and is part of a group that soon will launch a program of heath micro-insurance for the beneficiaries of a micro-credit.

Translated from French by anne-laure behaghel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of pencils and chalk, 3 boxes of cream and lotion, 12 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Osana

texts.en: Osana T., 38, is married with five children. She has one year of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the public six days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Osana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase plastic papers, sacks of sugar and other items for her business.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 42-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Mahdi has owned a butcher shop for fifteen years. He requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase goats for his shop. This is the first time that Mahdi has requested a loan. 
Mahdi is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. Mahdi decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for his shop.

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr:
N. V. Lucienne est née à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Lucienne est mariée à DAGA Richard. Lucienne est mère de trois (3) enfants. Lucienne n'a jamais été à l'école, ni appris un métier. Lucienne a été élevée par ses parents et aidait sa mère dans la vente de maïs et de l'huile végétale. Après son mariage, Lucienne s'était lancée dans la vente de bouillie de maïs. Actuellement, Lucienne vend la même chose que sa mère, mais pour son propre compte. Lucienne a déjà eu deux prêts de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Lucienne sollicite un troisième crédit présentement pour s'approvisionner en une importante quantité de maïs et d'huile de noix de palme afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.  

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
