HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou W. est une femme  de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de DIONGO depuis décembre 2006. Elle est vendeuse de poissons séchés et de poissons fumés. Son activité lui génère des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou W., aged 42, is married and the mother of five children in her care. She has been a member of the credit association of Diongo since 2006. She sells dried and smoked fish. Her activity gives her an income that enables her to participate in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To boost her income generating activity

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, la señora Carmen R. se dedica a vender productos varios como productos de plástico y otros productos que también sale a vender ambulantemente con dos canastos donde guarda los productos que vende.

Hoy en día, ella está solicitando un crédito para aprovechar la temporada donde se acerca el verano y requiere la compra de piscinas plásticas para niños ya que en esta temporada muchos son los que van al mar y ella requiere adquirir las piscinas plásticas para venderlas y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market, Señora Carmen R. sells various products, such as plastic products and other products that she can go out and sell as a walking vendor, using the two baskets where she keeps the products that she sells.

Now she is applying for a loan to take advantage of the season when summer is coming. This requires the purchase of plastic pools for children, since in this season many people go to the sea. She needs to acquire plastic pools so that she can sell them and in this way obtain income for her development.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic products

loans.name: Two By Two Group

texts.en:
Here are small-scale businesswomen from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group in order to enable them to improve their businesses both in terms of size and quality. In this way, they can make more sales, better profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

35-year-old Kadiatu S. is the leader of this group. Born in Makeni, she is married to a businessman and they have four children who are attending primary and secondary schools: three in secondary and one in primary school. Kadiatu sells slippers/flip-flops and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy dozens of slippers in a wide variety in order to develop her business.

loans.use: To buy dozens of slippers to add to her business

loans.name: Intihuatana Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIHUATANA”; Ellos son 13  miembros  alegres y trabajadores; los socios viven en el distrito de Urcos, provincia de Quispicanchis departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Marleni ella tiene 37 años de edad, ella es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus diferentes actividades para poder alimentar y educar a sus hijos ella compro con un poco de capital animales menores (cuyes, chanchos aves de corral), Nuestra socia vende los animales una vez que se procrean, también compra y vende maíz como semillas,  y los más chicos para alimento de aves de corral, la socia también trae flores de muñapata para venderlas, nuestra socia desea la mejor educación para sus hijos y es hoy el único sustento que ellos tiene, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades como son plantar plantas, e invernadero, compra y venta de queso, comidas en el mercado, venta de flores, engorde y venta de ganados, en la foto general no salen los socios, Samuel, Silveria, Pascuala, estaban ese día presentes y Gladys, pero no querían que se les fotografíe, una tenía paperas y los otros se disculparon. Nuestros socios agradecen el préstamo y se comprometen a seguir cumpliendo con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “INTIHUATANA” (Sacred Inca Stones) communal bank; it has 13 cheerful, hard-working members who live in Urcos district, Quispicanchi province, Cusco department. Marleni, 37, is a single mother of two children. In order to feed and educate her children she invested a bit of capital in the purchase of small farm animals to raise (guinea pigs, pigs and barnyard fowl). Once the animals multiply she sells them. She also buys and sells corn kernels as seed and uses the smallest ones to feed her barnyard fowl. In addition, she brings flowers from Muñapata to sell. She hopes to provide her children with the best possible education and she is their only means of support. She is asking for funds to buy pigs. Her fellow group members have various commercial activities. Some have plant nurseries; others make and sell cheese; some sell food or flowers in the market while others raise cattle. Members Samuel, Silveria and Pascuala do not appear in the group photo. They were present that day, so was Gladys, but they didn’t want to be photographed because one had the mumps and the others begged out. Our members are grateful for the loan and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Maria Encarnacion

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Gabriela.
Maria es casada, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante en su casa, además vende bebidas y un poco de abarrotes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza.
Maria sueña con tener un negocio mas grande, tener una distribuidora de cerveza y un taller de costura.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Gabriela Communal Bank. Maria is 50 years old, married, and has three children. Maria has a restaurant in her house. She also sells drinks and a few groceries. She does this everyday with help from her son. Maria needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy beer. Maria’s dream is to have a larger business, a beer distributorship, and a seamstress shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa L. is 55 and married with four children. She owns a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale and has many years of experience in this business. Epenesa needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone. She plans to use the earnings from her business, estimated to be 600 talas (approximately USD 240) per week, to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Epenesa joined SPBD and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone

loans.name: Shalon Group

texts.es:
El grupo Shalon lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y esforzadas una de ellas es A. M. que ha sus 60 años ha trabajado de todo desde vender ropa, nacatamales, sopas, electrodomésticos etc. Ella invertirá el crédito  en aumentar su mercadería y sus negocios.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Kelia Patricia N.  Martínez quien vende ropa desde hace dos años y sueña con tener su propia casa e Ivania   M. T. quien desde hace dos años se dedica a vender comida.
texts.en:
The Shalon group is made up of three hard-working, dedicated people. One of them is A. M., 60, who has worked in many different jobs from selling clothing to selling nacatamales to soups to home appliances, etc. She will use the funds to increase her stock merchandise and her businesses. Her fellow group members are Kelia Patricia N. Martínez, who has sold clothing for two years and hopes to own her own house and Ivana M. T. who has sold prepared meals for the last two years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, home appliances and ingredients for soups and nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales)

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en:
Batdelger D. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in Uvurhangai, a central province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter attends a local secondary school while his wife works as a kindergarten teacher in their town. Batdelger operates a taxi service. He began his taxi business in 2006 and has gained a lot of experience since then.

Batdelger and his wife are planning on opening a home goods retail business in the local market. He believes that they will be successful since his wife has a lot of experience selling these types of products and because he has experience owning his own business.

Batdelger says, "I am trying my best to complete my house within two years which will help our family live better and more conveniently." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: 040106_Hai Son _Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hang L. T. (40107029) is a 63-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hai Son_Hoang Truong _Hoang hoa.  Hang is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 040106_Hai Son_Hoang Hoa (040106_Hai Son_Hoang Hoa).


Hang is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, Hang operates a family member's business providing new clothing services to local community members.  Hang has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, Hang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hang has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be the 20th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hang plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Chinh (40106032) is a 44-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


2.  P. T. Toi (40106051) is a 37-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


3.  N. T. Duong (40106050) is a 40-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


4.  T. T. Thuong (40106048) is a 39-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


5.  L. T. Van  (40106040) is a 28-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


6.  L. P. T. Tuyet (40106039) is a 34-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


7.  N. T. Hai Duong (40106044) is a 31-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her retail clothing business.


8.  L. T. Sinh (40106043) is a 47-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hang L. T. (40107029) là 63 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hai Son _Hoang Truong _Hoang hoa.  Hang là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 040106_Hai Son_Hoang Hoa (040106_Hai Son_Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo mới cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hang thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hang kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2003, Hang đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hang đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 20th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Chinh (40106032) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  P. T. Toi (40106051) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  N. T. Duong (40106050) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  T. T. Thuong (40106048) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


5.  L. T. Van  (40106040) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


6.  L. P. T. Tuyet (40106039) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


7.  N. T. Hai Duong (40106044) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


8.  L. T. Sinh (40106043) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: María Alicia

texts.es: María Alicia C. D. C. D. 50 años D. edad, es una señora quien se ha dedicado D. lleno a su familia, y por quien ha trabajado para poder mejorar la estabilidad D. su hogar, ella vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como policía, y junto a sus dos hijos los cuales son estudiantes, con quienes residen en el municipio D. Ilopango. María trabaja vendiendo cosméticos como: maquillajes, perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo, cabello y rostro, ropa, carteras y otros tipos más D. accesorios, estos productos en su mayoría se piden por catalogo, y para poder darlos a conocer ella hace visita periódicas a sus clientes mostrándoles los productos que son lanzados en las diferentes campañas. Este trabajo es muy estable ya que día con día la demanda va creciendo, a pesar que es un trabajo bastante duro ya que debe andar por las calles, visitando clientes, incentivando a las personas a comprar, le permite crecer como comerciante y D. esta misma forma percibir ganancias las cuales son muy necesarias en su hogar. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos, sobretodo porque la mayoría D. sus clientes hacen los pedidos a crédito, y esto le dificulta a María poder hacerlos ya que carece del dinero necesario para hacerlos, D. esta manera ella podrá contar con el dinero y hacerlos, y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Alicia C. D. C. is 50 years old and has fully dedicated herself to her family and has worked to improve the stability of her household. She lives in the town of llopango, along with her husband, who works as a police officer, and her two children, who are students. María sells cosmetics such as makeup, perfumes, body creams, hair creams, and face creams. She also sells clothing, wallets, and other types of accessories. Most of her products are sold through catalogs and she occasionally visits her customers to show her products, which are promoted through different campaigns. This work is very stable and demand grows daily, but it’s very difficult because she must walk through the street to visit her customers and give incentives for them to buy. This allows her to grow as a merchant and also to receive income which is very necessary in her home. María is requesting a loan so that the can buy large quantities of products; above all because most of her customers buy on credit. It isn’t easy for María because she lacks the money she needs to be able to do this. This [loan] will allow her to have the money with which to [proviD. this service] and thus increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Plumkor Group

texts.en:
Assatuma S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Plumkor Group. Assatuma is 39 years old, married and has five children who range from 11 to 21 years old. 

She was not able to attend school due to a lack of financial support. She cares for five siblings.

For 15 years, she has been selling rice and cold water in Jorkpen Town Market in Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 8,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 40,000-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice and gallons of cold water.

She describes herself as a jovial woman. Her goal is to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and gallons of cold water

loans.name: Conteh United Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the C. United Group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They run small businesses and have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Obai C.. Obai was born in Magburaka town 40 years ago. He is married and has three children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools. Obai sells medicines and has been doing this business for five years now. He will use his share of this loan to buy more medicines to sell.

loans.use: To buy more medicines

loans.name: Sosik

texts.en:
Sosik S. lives in Vardavank village, Kapan area with his wife. His three children are already married and live separately from their parents. Sosik has a secondary school education and now he works in a private household as a hired worker. At the same time he has his own farm, where he raises sheep, cows, goats and pigs. Sosik's wife helps him a lot in this laborious work, and thanks to their farming, Sosik and his wife support their family and their farm. 

Sosik is asking for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy 12 ewes for his farm. Expanding his herd of livestock will allow him to develop his farm and to earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy 12 ewes for his farm

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia F. is a single woman who lives in  Brgy. Calapi, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a general store.  Celedonia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 23 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Celedonia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 24th loan, she is borrowing PHP 30,000, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and expansion of the business. 

Celedonia F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Damion

texts.en:
Damion J. started his construction company, Rock Enterprises Construction, 11 years ago in New Orleans when he realized that many of his friends and family who hired businesses to do repairs were often charged unreasonable prices. He started his business to provide affordable and quality work to residents of New Orleans and has since moved to the commercial and industrial sectors. Five years ago, Damion had to shut down his business after Hurricane Katrina hit the Louisiana coast. Through perserverence and hard work, Damion was able to pull his business together. There was fewer work with fewer people in New Orleans, and also, less people willing to invest in their homes. For people who needed renovation, many unlicensed contractors came to New Orleans and took advantage of that demand. All these factors contributed to making it very difficult for Damion to build his business back up again.

This same situation has happened again with the recent oil spill. Damion had seven large residential projects planned before the oil spill that would have brought almost $ 1 million to his company. However, because of the oil spill devastating the area, investors were not as willing to invest in these homes and decided to not go through with the projects. Damion and his 15 employees had been counting on those projects and now he does not have enough money to tide the business over until they get their next big project, which is currently under way. With this loan, Damion plans to  pay his employees and rent big machinery. Without this loan, Damion would not be able to complete this big project and would be forced to let go of some of his employees.

loans.use: New machinery and pay employees for next big project

loans.name: Marcela Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Marcela del Carmen Z. B. es trabajadora de la alcaldía, casada y madre de tres niños se desempeña en el área de barrido en el Mercado santa Ana de Chinandega tiene de trabajar  en la alcaldía ocho años  de los cuales ceprodel le ha brindado seis financiamientos que los ha ocupado en la reparación y remodelación de su casa poco a poco ella ha salido adelante su casa la ha compuesto con al ayuda de su esposo y sus niños estudian en la escuela primaria ella es una mujer luchadora y se esfuerza por sacar adelante a sus niños y a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcela del Carmen Z. B. is a city employee. She is married and the mother of three children. Marcela works as a street sweeper at the Santa Ana Market in Chinandega.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for eight years and has received six loans that were used for repairing and remodeling her house. Marcela has been able to gradually make improvements to her home with the help of her husband.

Her children are elementary school students. Marcela is a determined woman who strives to succeed on behalf of her children and the rest of her household.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Seema's Group

texts.en:
Seema G. M. is divorced and has two sons. They live in a small city called Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. Due to poor financial conditions, Seema was unable to educate her children, but she taught them the art of making curtains (used to hang on doors and windows to keep the  sunshine out). 

This has become their family business and they have been able to improve their financial position through this business. They make curtains to supply to different shops in the market and earn a good profit. The specialty of their curtains is that they use different embroidery designs to attract more clients.
 
Seema has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to grow their curtains business. With the loan, they will buy cloth, beads and colored thread in bulk quantity to make curtains in larger quantity to fulfill the orders of their customers.
 
Seema is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Seema.

loans.use: To buy cloth, beads and colored thread to make curtains

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan D. Sr. is from the village of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. He is 32 years old. Jonathan is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jonathan owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Jonathan's wife is shown in the picture because he was in Manila City trying to find a job. Jonathan has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jonathan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonathan is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jonathan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 39-year-old married woman from Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has 2 children, aged 19 and 16. Nora earns income  through farming and raising pigs. She and her husband, who is also a farmer, plant and harvest rice crops. They sell their harvest in their town's market. Nora also grows pigs for fattening and sale. Like any other mother, Nora aims for her children to finish college and have bright futures. 

Nora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Nora is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies and pig feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and pig feeds

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 57 años, vive con el menor de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la costura, tiene su taller en su misma casa y realiza todo  tipo de costuras tanto para prendas de vestir como para ropa casual. Los buenos acabados que realizan son el mejor prestigio que tiene para seguir ofreciendo este servicio, tiene más cantidad de pedidos en los meses de noviembre y diciembre porque  en estas fechas hay más demanda de prendas de gala y de vestir. Irma disfruta de realizar este trabajo que le permite estar en su casa y disponer de su tiempo es por esta razón que su deseo es tener una capital más estable para  seguir realizando sus costuras. Es su crédito número 9 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más telas.
texts.en:
Irma is 57 years old.  She lives in her own home with the youngest of her three children.

Irma has been sewing for 30 years.  She has a workshop in her home and there she sews all kinds of clothes, from formal clothes to casual clothes.  The good work that she does means she has a good reputation. This allows her to continue offering this service.

Irma has more orders to fill in November and December because during these months there is a lot of demand for formal clothes and dress clothes.  Irma enjoys doing this work as it allows her to be at home and set her own hours.  She would like to have more stable capital so that she can continue with her sewing work.

This is Irma's ninth loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being part of her community bank as all the members are people that she knows.  They are responsible people and very supportive of each other.

Irma is grateful to the people who will fund her loan because it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan money in buying more fabric.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa L. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Nimfa is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of making and selling specialty food, like chicken and pork kabobs, in the local community. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

Nimfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. 

Nimfa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed, like pork and chicken meat and spices. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed, like pork and chicken meat and spices

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 24 años, vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de su madre y de sus hermanos. Desde hace  4 años decidió  emprender su propia fuente de ingresos, en un inicio alquiló un local dentro de una calle comercial, ahí sufrió un percance, en el que le robaron todas sus cosa. Ante esto tuvo que establecer su negocio en casa de sus padres. Desde entonces se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de llamadas a celular, para ello cuenta con un control de tarifa casero que tiene  dentro de sus cabinas de locutorio. Además este negocio lo complementa con la venta de golosinas y algunos artículos de bazar como regalos y detalles para el arreglo personal, de esta manera su  negocio este más surtido, atractivo para su clientela. Afirma que le gusta trabajar de manera independiente porque puede disponer de su dinero y es por esta razón que esta planeando  adquirir mejores equipos pasa su negocio. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más tiempo de linea libre para realizar llamadas en su locutorio; asimismo en la compra de golosinas y bebidas gasificadas para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Pilar is 24 years old, and lives in her parents’ home, along with her mother and siblings.  Four years ago she decided to set up her own source of income, and rented premises on a commercial street.  There, she had a mishap, in that everything was stolen.  Because of this, she had to establish her business at her parents’ home.  Since that time, she has offered cell-phone service, and for this has a rate-control device in the phone booths.  She supplements this business with the sale of sweets and other general items, such as gifts and personal-care products.  Thus, her business offers greater variety, which is attractive to customers.  She states that she likes to work independently, because she can handle her own funds, and thus she is planning to purchase better equipment for her business.  This is her second loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She is pleased to be part of a communal bank, because all of the members are reliable and responsible.  She thanks all those who will manage the loan she is requesting, because it will be very useful in growing her business.  She will use the funds requested to buy more free line time to make calls in the phone booth, as well as to purchase sweets and soft drinks to offer her customers.

loans.use: To purchase free minutes for calling, as well as sweets.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 43-year-old widow who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  a general store and a grains trading business (buying & selling rice and corn).  She lives in Rizal, Palawan. 

Sylvia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past second loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sylvia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000,  uplifting her family's standard of living.  

This time, for her third cycle loan, Sylvia is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy additional goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Sylvia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Belquiz

texts.es:
Belkis A. vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas, vísceras y otros, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 7 años . Belkis inició su negocio desde hace 7 años, cuando su cónyuge empezó a trabajar como operario en un matadero de ganado ubicado en un municipio cercano y su buen desempeño lo llevó a ser secretario de una agremiación de matarifes; desde esta actividad puedo conseguir carne a un buen precio y trasladárselos a sus clientes de una manera competitiva. Sus clientes son sus vecinos, referidos y familiares que conocen la calidad y la seguridad del producto que ella vende. En la actualidad aspira a su primer credikiva con el cual comprará carne en mayor volumen con un capital a bajo costo, pues anteriormente dependía de un capital informal a muy alto costo el que planea reemplazar totalmente, para que su financiación sea exitosa y lograr el progreso de negocio. 
Belkis como madre, esposa y mujer trabajadora, tiene muchos sueños asociados a su familia, entre los cuales está el de tener su casa propia, ofrecer una educación de calidad a sus hijos y cumplir a corto plazo con una meta puntual y es la de comprarles un computador para que estén modernizados  desde su infancia.
texts.en:
Belkis A. lives in the town of Barranquilla and earns her living selling meat and offal from the house where she lives with her husband and their two children aged 2 and 7. She started her business seven years ago when her husband began work as an operator in a slaughterhouse located in a nearby municipality. 

Through hard work Belkis became secretary of the union of slaugherhouse workers. She was able to obtain meat cheaply and then sell it to her customers at competitive prices. Her customers are her neighbours, relatives, and people who are referred to her. They know that the meat she sells is of good quality and safe. 

She is now seeking her first loan which she will use to buy meat in larger quantities and thus at low prices. Before she had to borrow money at high interest rates. She hopes that her application will be successful so her business can progress. 

As a mother, wife, and hardworking woman, Belkis has many dreams regarding her family. She wishes to have a house of her own, to provide her children with a good education, and in the near future buy a computer so that her children grow up in the modern world.

loans.use: to buy meat in large quantities

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijas de edades escolares. Viven en casa propia en Monsefú, una zona conocida por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas. Las principales actividades que se realizan en este caserío son la producción de flores, la artesanía y la crianza de ganado vacuno. La zona está llena de vegetación y la comunidad es muy pequeña.

Desde hace más de siete años, Gregoria se dedica a la venta de pescado. Cuenta con un puesto en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado grande, muy conocido y con bastante movimiento. Desea ampliar su negocio y planea invertir una parte de su préstamo en la compra de más mercadería. También, desea renovar una parte de su casa a fin de poner una bodega en su domicilio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Gregoria es muy trabajadora y responsable. Quiere seguir creciendo su negocio y sus ingresos para seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 46 years old and has two daughters who are in school. She lives in her own home in Monsefú, an area that is known for its tourist and religious festivals. The main business activities in this village are growing flowers, producing handicrafts, and livestock breeding. This area is full of vegetation, yet the community is quite small.

Gregoria has been selling fish for more than seven years. She has a vending stall at the Moshoqueque Market. This large market is well-known and experiences considerable business activity. Gregoria wants to expand her business and plans to invest part of her loan in the purchase of more inventory. In addition, she wants to remodel part of her house so that she can establish a grocery store in her home. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

Gregoria is hardworking and responsible. She wants to continue growing her business and her income so that her family can continue moving forward.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory and remodel her house so that she can establish a grocery store.

loans.name: Rosalie Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Rosalie Fatou F. est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 1996. Elle est veuve et mère de 03 enfants qui sont autonomes. Mais elle a la charge de 05 de ses petits fils. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de boissons conditionnées en bouteille (des jus de fruits, de la bière, etc.)

Elle est détentrice d'une licence de vente. elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années. 

Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa nourriture et celles de ses petits enfants et de payer les factures d'eau et d'électricité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalie Fatou F. became a member of the Banc Villageois of WANGO in 1996. She is a widow and the mother of three independent children. 
She does however look after five of her grandsons. 

She runs a small business selling bottled drinks (fruit juices, beer, etc.). She holds a sales license, and has been engaged in this activity for several years.

Her goal is to be able to feed herself and her grandchildren, and to pay the water and electricity bills.

loans.use: to buy bottled beverages for resale

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Augusta; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y fideos, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para productos al por mayor para su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Augusta belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Angeles” (The Angels) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 45 years old, married, and has one child. Augusta divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery business. She sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, and noodles. Augusta manages her store from 7am until 10pm. This business enables her to help her children get ahead. Augusta wants to expand and improve her grocery store, so she is requesting a loan to buy products in bulk.

Augusta is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Martha Liliana

texts.es:
A sus 37 años de edad y con 7 hijos a carga por ser madre cabeza de hogar, Martha Liliana V. P. es una luchadora incansable. Desde muy joven ha trabajado en diferentes sectores y a pesar de las dificultades económicas por las que ha tenido que atravesar siempre ha salido adelante gracias a su dedicación y esfuerzo. 

Después de trabajar durante algún tiempo en un restaurante, Martha supo que este oficio podría convertirse en su propio negocio, oportunidad que le permitiría no sólo generar sus propios ingresos sino estar más cerca de sus hijos. Actualmente esta emprendedora necesita de un préstamo para comprar una carpa que pueda adaptar a su carrito de comidas rápidas y comprar insumos para ampliar su capacidad de producción. 

El sueño de Martha es poder tener un local propio que le permita ofrecer mayor variedad y convertir sus comidas rápidas en un producto reconocido en Medellín.
texts.en:
At the age of 37 and with 7 children in her care because she’s a head of household mother, Martha Liliana V. P. is an untiring fighter.  From a very early age she has worked in a variety of jobs and, despite the economic difficulties she’s had to pass through, has always gotten ahead thanks to her dedication and effort.

After having worked for a time in a restaurant, Martha discovered that this occupation could become her own business, an opportunity that would make it possible not only for her to generate her own income but also to be closer to her children.  This entrepreneur currently needs a loan to buy a tent that can be adapted to her fast food sales cart and to buy ingredients to increase her productive capacity.

Martha’s dream is to have a locale of her own that will allow her to offer greater variety and turn her fast food into a renowned product in Medellín.

loans.use: to buy a tent, install it on her fast food sales cart and to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia is from the village of Highway Lawis, Plaridel. She is 53 years old. Celedonia is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Celedonia owns & operates a business making & selling dining furniture to local businesses and community members. Celedonia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Celedonia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celedonia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw materials for her furniture making business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Celedonia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her furniture making business

loans.name: Sodisa

texts.en:
Sodisa is an active 49-year-old mother. Her husband works in Russia. Sodisa has five children and loves all of them. She is engaged in a farming business and cultivates wheat, rice and corn. Her son and daughter always help her to improve their living conditions. The income she earns from this business allows her to take care of her family of five children. She has a good credit history. Sodisa needs to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants. Sodisa is requesting a loan of $1,100 USD to help her with this purchase.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Amelia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre de dos hijos a los que ha tratado de darles lo mejor y una buena educación, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en un colegio de la localidad donde ha brindado sus servicios por más de veinte años para la buena educación de los niños.
Cuenta con su propia vivienda con buenas condiciones, la que ha mejorado gracias a su salario y a su negocio, una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como zinc, playcen y clavos, etc. para poner cielo raso en sus habitaciones de la casa, por tal razón decidió solicitar su primer crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Amelia is originally from the town of El Sauce. She is the mother of two children for whom she tries to provide everything, including a good education. Rosa is an elementary school teacher at a local school and has worked with children for more than 20 years.

She owns a home that is in good condition, thanks to the improvements she paid for from her salary and her business earnings. One of her needs at the moment is to acquire a loan to buy construction materials such as zinc, fiberboards, nails, and other items to install a ceiling over the rooms of her house. For this reason, she is requesting her first of loan from CEPRODEL so that she can finish this job.

loans.use: to purchase zinc, fiberboards, nails, and other items to install a ceiling.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with a two-year-old child. He does carpentry to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and employs one person. John also runs a grocery store with the assistance of his wife.

John is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy timber and nails. He is hardworking and is looking forward to opening other business outlets in the future to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy timber and nails

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR D. CCOYLLORITY D. YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Yungaqui, Provincia D. Anta, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ubaldina; la socia tiene 52 años; la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales todos sus hijos son independientes; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales, la socia se dedica a la venta D. animales como vacas, toros, la socia también elabora queso, leche, la socia tiene 8 vacas lecheras y ahora ella desea comprar una vaca. La socia se dedica  a la compra y crianza D. animales; la socia comprara una vaca ternera, la socia elabora quesos y leche sacados D. sus mismas vacas; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. vaca. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Taytacha Senor D. Ccoyllority D. Yungaqui". It is located in the district of Yungaqui, in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Ubaldina. She is 52 years old, married, and she has 4 children, two of whom are independent. She buys and sells livestock. She sells livestock such as cows and bulls. She also makes cheese, and milk. She has 8 dairy cows and she now wishes to buy another cow. She buys and raises livestock. She will purchase a calf. she makes cheeses and milk from her own cows. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of another cow.

She is very satisfied and very thankful for the support that is provided to her through this manner. She is committed to making her loan payments at the established frequency.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.
